name: Psyduck

attacks.name: Headache
attacks.text: Your opponent can't play Trainer cards during his or her next turn.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: While lulling its enemies with its vacant look, this wily Pokémon will use psychokinetic powers.

name: Buck's Training
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Draw 2 cards. As long as Buck's Training is next to your Active Pokémon, each of your Active Pokémon's attacks does 10 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Ducklett
flavorText: These bird Pokémon are excellent divers. They swim around in the water eating their favorite food—peat moss.

name: Prinplup

attacks.name: Ice Blade
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Wash Over
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: Its wings deliver wicked blows that snap even the thickest of trees. It searches for prey in icy seas.

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: High Voltage
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent can't play Trainer cards from his or her hand during his or her next turn.

name: Castform Snow-Cloud Form

abilities.name: Temperament
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for any Castform and switch it with Castform Snow-cloud Form. (Any cards attached to Castform Snow-cloud Form, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) Shuffle Castform Snow-cloud Form back into your deck. You can't use more than 1 Temperament Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Hail
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: Its appearance changes with the weather. Recently, its molecules were found to be just like water.

name: Prinplup

attacks.name: Fury Attack
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: Because every Prinplup considers itself to be the most important, they can never form a group.

name: Hyper Potion
rules: Choose 1 of your Pokémon. Discard 1 or 2 basic Energy cards attached to that Pokémon. If you discarded 1 Energy card, remove up to 3 damage counters from that Pokémon. If you discarded 2 Energy cards, remove up to 5 damage counters from that Pokémon.

name: Starly
flavorText: Because they are weak individually, they form groups. However, they bicker if the group grows too big.

name: Illumise

attacks.name: Helping Hand
attacks.text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Twirling Sign
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

flavorText: With its sweet aroma, it guides Volbeat to draw signs with light in the night sky.

name: Charmander

attacks.name: Call for Friends
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Fire Basic Pokémon, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

flavorText: The fire on the tip of its tail is a measure of its life. If healthy, its tail burns intensely.

name: Ditto

abilities.name: Transform
abilities.text: If Ditto is your Active Pokémon, treat it as if it were the same card as the Defending Pokémon, including type, Hit Points, Weakness, and so on, except Ditto can't evolve, always has this Pokémon Power, and you may treat any Energy attached to Ditto as Energy of any type. Ditto isn't a copy of any other Pokémon while Ditto is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

flavorText: Capable of copying an enemy's genetic code to instantly transform itself into a duplicate of the enemy.

name: Dark Patch
rules: Attach a basic Darkness Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Darkness Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Pansage

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

flavorText: This Pokémon dwells deep in the forest. Eating a leaf from its head whisks weariness away as if by magic.

name: Shellder
flavorText: Its hard shell repels any kind of attack. It is vulnerable only when its shell is open.

name: Beldum

attacks.name: Reaction
attacks.text: You may switch Beldum with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

flavorText: The magnetic force generated by its body repels the ground's natural magnetism, letting it float.

attacks.name: Call for Friends
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Retaliate
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Wobbuffet.

name: Cubchoo
flavorText: Its nose is always running. It sniffs the snot back up because the mucus provides the raw material for its moves.

name: Cosmog

attacks.name: Dust Gathering
attacks.text: Draw a card.

flavorText: Its body is gaseous and frail. It slowly grows as it collects dust from the atmosphere.

attacks.name: Mining
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Trainer card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. If that card is a Pokémon Tool card, you may attach it to 1 of your Pokémon instead. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Bite Off
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Pokémon-ex, this attack does 20 damage plus 30 more damage.

name: Charjabug

attacks.name: Shocking Jaws
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: From the food it digests, it generates electricity, and it stores this energy in its electric sac.

name: Guzma & Hala
rules: Search your deck for a Stadium card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
When you play this card, you may discard 2 other cards from your hand. If you do, you may also search for a Pokémon Tool card and a Special Energy card in this way.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

name: Shiinotic

abilities.name: Effect Spore
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Dream's Touch
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Asleep, your opponent shuffles all Energy from it into their deck.

flavorText: It emits flickering spores that cause drowsiness. When its prey succumb to sleep, this Pokémon feeds on them by sucking in their energy.

attacks.name: Scorpion Grapple
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Cross Poison
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads. If 2 or more of them are heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Derail
attacks.text: Discard all Special Energy cards attached to the Defending Pokémon.

name: Larvitar

abilities.name: Submerge
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).

flavorText: Born deep underground, it comes aboveground and becomes a pupa once it has finished eating the surrounding soil.

name: Passimian

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Rock Hurl
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

flavorText: Displaying amazing teamwork, they follow the orders of their boss as they all help out in the search for their favorite berries.

name: Cubone

attacks.name: Sharpshooting
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: The skull it wears on its head is that of its dead mother. According to some, it will evolve when it comes to terms with the pain of her death.

name: Poké Healer +
rules: You may play 2 Poké Healer + at the same time. If you play 1 Poké Healer +, remove 1 damage counter and a Special Condition from 1 of your Active Pokémon. If you play 2 Poké Healer +, remove 8 damage counters and all Special Conditions from 1 of your Active Pokémon.

name: Blue's Tactics
rules: At the end of this turn, draw cards until you have 8 cards in your hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

name: Eevee
flavorText: Because its genetic makeup is irregular, it quickly changes its form due to a variety of causes.

name: Beldum

attacks.name: Single Smash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: With magnetic traction, it pulls its opponents in close. When they're in range, it slashes them with its rear claws.

name: Clefairy

attacks.name: Shining Fingers
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

flavorText: It is said that happiness will come to those who see a gathering of Clefairy dancing under a full moon.

abilities.name: Auxiliary Light
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a basic Energy card from your hand to Team Aqua's Lanturn. Put 2 damage counters on Team Aqua's Lanturn. This power can't be used if Team Aqua's Lanturn is affected by a Special Condition.

name: Ultra Space
rules: Once during each player's turn, that player may search their deck for an Ultra Beast card, reveal it, put it into their hand, and shuffle their deck.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

name: Salandit

attacks.name: Singe
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

flavorText: It burns its bodily fluids to create a poisonous gas. When its enemies become disoriented from inhaling the gas, it attacks them.

attacks.name: Random ESP
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused. If tails, this attack does no damage and Sabrina's Psyduck is now Confused.

name: Taillow
flavorText: It has a gutsy spirit that makes it bravely take on tough foes. It flies in search of warm climates.

name: Indeedee V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Watch Over
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may heal 20 damage from your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: This attack does 60 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

name: Croagunk

attacks.name: Swagger
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

flavorText: Inflating its poison sacs, it fills the area with an odd sound and hits flinching opponents with a poison jab.

attacks.name: Paralyzing Gaze
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Multi Technical Machine 01
rules: Attach this card to 1 of your Pokémon in play. That Pokémon may use this card's attack instead of its own. At the end of your turn, discard Multi Technical Machine 01.

attacks.name: Paralyzing Gaze
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Cottonee
flavorText: Perhaps because they feel more at ease in a group, they stick to others they find. They end up looking like a cloud.

attacks.name: Kindle
attacks.text: Discard 1 Energy card attached to Blaine's Charmander in order to use this attack. If the Defending Pokémon has any Energy cards attached to it, choose 1 of them and discard it.

attacks.name: Bone Smash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Rattata
flavorText: Bites anything when it attacks. Small and very quick, it is a common sight in many places.

name: Ilima
rules: Each player shuffles their hand into their deck and flips a coin. If heads, that player draws 6 cards. If tails, they draw 3 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

name: Rattata
flavorText: Bites anything when it attacks. Small and very quick, it is a common sight in many places.

name: Illumise

abilities.name: Scent Conduct
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Grass Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Illumise is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Firefly Scent
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Poké-Bodies, that Pokémon is now Asleep.

flavorText: With its sweet aroma, it guides VOLBEAT to draw signs with light in the night sky.

name: Energy Retrieval
rules: Trade 1 of the other cards in your hand for up to 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile.

name: Machoke

attacks.name: Pummel
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 70 more damage.

flavorText: Its muscular body is so powerful, it must wear a power-save belt to be able to regulate its motions.

name: Teddiursa
flavorText: Before food becomes scarce in wintertime, its habit is to hoard food in many hidden locations.

name: Minccino

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

flavorText: These Pokémon prefer a tidy habitat. They are always sweeping and dusting, using their tails as brooms.

name: Unown F

abilities.name: FAKE
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Unown F is on your Bench, you may use this power. Put a coin next to your Active Pokémon without showing your opponent and cover it with your hand. Your opponent guesses if the coin is heads or tails. If he or she is wrong, draw a card.

attacks.name: Hidden Power
attacks.text: You may flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, this attack's base damage is 30.

flavorText: Shaped like ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or UNOWN came first.

name: Raticate

attacks.name: Gnaw Through
attacks.text: Discard a Pokémon Tool card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Super Fang
attacks.text: Put damage counters on the Defending Pokémon until its remaining HP is 10.

flavorText: With its long fangs, this surprisingly violent Pokémon can gnaw away even thick concrete with ease.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Blaine's Ponyta.

name: Rhyhorn
flavorText: Strong, but not too bright, this Pokémon can shatter even a skyscraper with its charging Tackles.

name: Seadra
flavorText: It is capable of swimming backwards by rapidly flapping its winglike pectoral fins and stout tail.

name: Team Aqua Belt
rules: Attach Team Aqua Belt to 1 of your Pokémon with Team Aqua in its name that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it. If that Pokémon is Knocked Out, discard this card.

At any time between turns, if the Pokémon Team Aqua Belt is attached to is your Active Pokémon, search your deck for a card that evolves from that Pokémon and put it on that Pokémon. (This counts as evolving that Pokémon.) Shuffle your deck aftrerward, then discard Team Aqua Belt.

name: Binacle

attacks.name: Sand Attack
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

flavorText: Two Binacle live together on one rock. When they fight, one of them will move to a different rock.

attacks.name: Pickup Power
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. For each heads, search your discard pile for a basic Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand.

name: Fraxure

attacks.name: Dragon Slayer
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Dragon Pokémon, this attack does 40 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

flavorText: A broken tusk will not grow back, so it diligently sharpens its tusks on river rocks after the end of a battle.

name: Magnemite

attacks.name: Mirror Shot
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack doesn't happen.

flavorText: It's frequently the cause of power outages, which is why some power plants send out electrical signals that it can't stand.

name: Riolu
flavorText: It knows how people and Pokémon feel by looking at their auras. It doesn't approach dangerous opponents.

name: Togedemaru

attacks.name: Defense Curl
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Discharge
attacks.text: Discard all Lightning Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

flavorText: The long hairs on its back act as lightning rods. The bolts of lightning it attracts are stored as energy in its electric sac.

abilities.name: Dark Lift
abilities.text: If Team Aqua's Carvanha has any Darkness Energy attached to it, the Retreat Cost for Team Aqua's Carvanha is 0.

attacks.name: Slow-Acting Poison
attacks.text: At the end of your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

name: Pokémon Fan Club
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Search your deck for up to 2 Baby Pokémon and/or Basic Pokémon cards and put them onto your bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Gible
flavorText: Gible prefers to stay in narrow holes in the sides of caves heated by geothermal energy. This way, Gible can stay warm even during a blizzard.

name: Mysterious Treasure
rules: Discard a card from your hand. If you do, search your deck for a Psychic or Dragon Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

abilities.name: Exoskeleton
abilities.text: Any damage done to Shelgon by attacks is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Joltik

attacks.name: Leech Life
attacks.text: Heal from this Pokémon the same amount of damage you did to the Defending Pokémon.

flavorText: They attach themselves to large-bodied Pokémon and absorb static electricity, which they store in an electric pouch.

name: Poké Ball
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Pokémon, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Magikarp

attacks.name: Flail Around
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: A Magikarp living for many years can leap a mountain using Splash. The move remains useless, though.

name: Shuppet

attacks.name: Haunt
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

flavorText: There's a proverb that says, "Shun the house where Shuppet gather in the growing dusk."

name: Nuzleaf

attacks.name: Dirty Trick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Razor Wind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: The sound of its grass flute makes its listeners uneasy. It lives deep in forests.

name: Mawile

attacks.name: Pick Out
attacks.text: Choose 1 face-down Prize card (yours or your opponent's) and put it face up. If that card is a Supporter card, use the effect of that card as the effect of this attack. (That card remains face up for the rest of the game.)

attacks.name: Jaw Bite
attacks.text: During your next turn, if an attack does damage to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), that attack does 20 more damage.

flavorText: Attached to its head is a huge set of jaws formed by horns. It can chew through iron beams.

name: Audino Spirit Link
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
Your turn does not end if the Pokémon this card is attached to becomes M Audino-EX.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Cosmoem

attacks.name: Teleport
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

flavorText: There's something accumulating around the black core within its hard shell. People think this Pokémon may come from another world.

name: Cubone

attacks.name: Sharpshooting
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: The skull it wears on its head is that of its dead mother. According to some, it will evolve when it comes to terms with the pain of her death.

attacks.name: Foresight
attacks.text: Look at the top 3 cards of either player's deck and rearrange them as you like.

attacks.name: Removal Beam
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Energy cards attached to it, flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of those Energy cards and discard it.

name: Whirlipede

attacks.name: Venoshock
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Poisoned, this attack does 60 more damage.

attacks.name: Steamroller
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

flavorText: It is usually motionless, but when attacked, it rotates at high speed and then crashes into its opponent.

name: Tapu Bulu

attacks.name: Heavy Punch
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Wild Tackle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.

flavorText: The guardian deity of Ula'ula is a lazy Pokémon. It commands plants to immobilize its foes and then deals them a savage blow with its horns.

name: Magmar

attacks.name: Controlled Burn
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

flavorText: When angered, it spouts brilliant fire from all over its body. It doesn't calm down until its opponent has burned to ash.

attacks.name: Growth
attacks.text: Attach a Grass Energy card from your hand to Bulbasaur.

name: Onix

attacks.name: Bedrock Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 20 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

flavorText: Burrows at high speed in search of food. The tunnels it leaves are used as homes by Diglett.

name: Lt. Surge's Secret Plan
rules: Put 1 card from your hand face down onto your Bench. (You can't play this card if your Bench is full.) Treat that card as a Basic Pokémon as long as it's face down. Flip the card if either player needs to know what it is in order to use an attack, a Pokémon Power, or a Trainer card. Flip the card if it ever uses an attack or Pokémon Power, evolves, retreats, is damaged by an attack, or is otherwise affected by an attack. At any time during your turn, you may flip the card over. When you flip that card over, if it isn't a Basic Pokémon, discard it and all cards attached to it.

name: Treecko

attacks.name: Energy Ball
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to Treecko but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Absorb
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from Treecko.

flavorText: The soles of its feet are covered by countless tiny spikes, enabling it to walk on walls and ceilings.

name: Pokémon Breeder
rules: Draw 2 cards and heal 20 damage from your Active Pokémon. If you have no cards in your deck, you can't play this card.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

name: Snivy

attacks.name: Blot
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

flavorText: They photosynthesize by bathing their tails in sunlight. When they are not feeling well, their tails droop.

name: Lillipup

attacks.name: Lead
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Supporter card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

flavorText: This Pokémon is popular with beginners because it’s intelligent, obedient to its Trainer’s commands, and easy to raise.

name: Shuppet
flavorText: It loves vengeful emotions and hangs in rows under the eaves of houses where vengeful people live.

attacks.name: Invigorate
attacks.text: Choose 1 Basic Pokémon in any player's discard pile. Put it onto that player's Bench. Put a number of damage counters on that Pokémon equal to half its HP (rounded down to the nearest 10). (You can't put a Pokémon on a Bench that's full.)

attacks.name: Pendulum Curse
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of damage counters on the Defending Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

name: Buizel

attacks.name: Muddy Water
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: It inflates its flotation sac, keeping its face above water in order to watch for prey movement.

name: Riolu

attacks.name: Steady Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage.

flavorText: It has the peculiar power of being able to see emotions such as joy and rage in the form of waves.

name: Multi Switch
rules: Move an Energy from 1 of your Benched Pokémon to your Active Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Pidgey

attacks.name: Messenger
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Pokémon, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle Pidgey and all cards attached to it back into your deck.

flavorText: Common in grassy areas and forests, it is very docile and will chase off enemies by flapping up sand.

name: Bounce Energy
rules: This card provides ColorlessColorless Energy. You can attach this card to your Pokémon that has basic Energy cards attached to it. When you play this card from your hand and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon, return a basic Energy card attached to that Pokémon to your hand.

name: Bergmite

attacks.name: Break Open
attacks.text: If your opponent has a Stadium card in play, discard it. If you do, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: Using air of -150 degrees Fahrenheit, they freeze opponents solid. They live in herds above the snow line on mountains.

name: Doduo

attacks.name: Double Stab
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Doduo Delivery
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

flavorText: The brains in its two heads appear to communicate emotions to each other with a telepathic power.

attacks.name: Fidget
attacks.text: Shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Karate Chop
attacks.text: Does 40 damage minus 10 damage for each damage counter on Brock's Mankey.

name: Meowth

attacks.name: Pay Day
attacks.text: Draw a card.

flavorText: It washes its face regularly to keep the coin on its forehead spotless. It doesn’t get along with Galarian Meowth.

name: Rattata

attacks.name: Dangerous Suspicion
attacks.text: Draw a card. Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

flavorText: Its fangs are long and very sharp. They grow continuously, so it gnaws on hard things to whittle them down.

name: Fennekin

attacks.name: Tail Whip
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

flavorText: As it walks, it munches on a twig in place of a snack. It intimidates opponents by puffing hot air out of its ears.

name: Eevee
flavorText: Because its genetic makeup is irregular, it quickly changes its form due to a variety of causes.

name: Mr. Briney's Compassion
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Choose 1 of your Pokémon in play (excluding Pokémon-ex). Return that Pokémon and all cards attached to it to your hand.

attacks.name: Spontaneous Explosion
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 30 more damage and Koga's Weezing does 30 damage to itself; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.

attacks.name: Toxic Cloud
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. It now takes 20 Poison damage instead of 10 after each player's turn (even if it was already Poisoned).

name: Sentret

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: A very cautious Pokémon, it raises itself up using its tail to get a better view of its surroundings.

name: Rolycoly
flavorText: Most of its body has the same composition as coal. Fittingly, this Pokémon was first discovered in coal mines about 400 years ago.

abilities.name: Duplicate
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for another Ditto and switch it with Ditto. (Any cards attached to Ditto, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) If you do, put Ditto on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Duplicate Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Fireworks
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard a Fire Energy card attached to Ditto.

name: Cyrus's Conspiracy
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.

Search your deck for a Supporter card, a basic Energy card, and a Trainer card that has Team Galactic's Invention in its name, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Vulpix

attacks.name: Singe
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard a Fire Energy attached to Vulpix.

flavorText: If it is attacked by an enemy that is stronger than itself, it feigns injury to fool the enemy and escapes.

attacks.name: Shadow Crush
attacks.text: You may discard 1 Psychic Energy card attached to Shuppet. If you do, your opponent discards 1 Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

name: Timburr
flavorText: These Pokémon appear at building sites and help out with construction. They always carry squared logs.

name: Yamask

attacks.name: Perplex
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

flavorText: Each of them carries a mask that used to be its face when it was human. Sometimes they look at it and cry.

name: Stantler

attacks.name: Mystifying Horns
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Big Charge
attacks.text: If you have any Mega Evolution Pokémon on your Bench, this attack does 50 more damage.

flavorText: The curved antlers subtly change the flow of air to create a strange space where reality is distorted.

name: Boss's Orders
rules: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Battle Tower
rules: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.
Whenever any player plays any Pokémon from his or her hand to Level-Up 1 of his or her Pokémon, remove 4 damage counters from that Pokémon.

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Pikachu from your hand onto Pichu (this counts as evolving Pichu) and remove all damage counters from Pichu.

attacks.name: Paste
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for an Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon that has δ on its card.

abilities.name: Duplicate
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for another Ditto and switch it with Ditto. (Any cards attached to Ditto, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) If you do, put Ditto on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Duplicate Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Copy
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. Copy copies that attack. This attack does nothing if Ditto doesn't have the Energy necessary to use that attack. (You must still do anything else required for that attack.) Ditto performs that attack.

name: Cufant
flavorText: It digs up the ground with its trunk. It's also very strong, being able to carry loads of over five tons without any problem at all.

name: Diglett

attacks.name: Sand Veil
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Diglett during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Mini Earthquake
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: If a Diglett digs through a field, it leaves the soil perfectly tilled and ideal for planting crops.

name: Gorebyss

attacks.name: Sweet Temptation
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to the new Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psychic Snap
attacks.text: If Gorebyss has any Psychic Energy attached to it, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

flavorText: It lives at the bottom of the sea. In the springtime, its pink body turns more vivid for some reason.

name: Trapinch

attacks.name: Mountain Munch
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

flavorText: It lives in arid deserts. It makes a sloping pit trap in sand where it patiently awaits prey.

name: Electivire

attacks.name: Plasma
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to Electivire.

attacks.name: Thunder Shot
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon that has any Energy cards attached to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: As its electric charge amplifies, blue sparks begin to crackle between its horns.

name: Larvitar
flavorText: It is born deep underground. It can't emerge until it has entirely consumed the soil around it.

name: Woobat

attacks.name: Nasal Suction
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Air Cutter
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: Its habitat is dark forests and caves. It emits ultrasonic waves from its nose to learn about its surroundings.

name: Froakie

abilities.name: Frubbles
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has any Water Energy attached to it, it has no Retreat Cost.

flavorText: It protects its skin by covering its body in delicate bubbles. Beneath its happy-go-lucky air, it keeps a watchful eye on its surroundings.

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

name: Judge Whistle
rules: Choose 1: Draw a card or put a Judge card from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Call for Friends
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Wobbuffet from your hand onto Wynaut (this counts as evolving Wynaut), and remove all damage counters from Wynaut.

attacks.name: Alluring Smile
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon card or Evolution card for each Energy attached to Wynaut, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Croagunk

attacks.name: Frog Hop
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

flavorText: Its cheeks hold poison sacs. It tries to catch foes off guard to jab them with toxic fingers.

attacks.name: Eggsplosion
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Energy attached to Erika's Exeggcute. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

name: Pikachu
flavorText: Its nature is to store up electricity. Forests where nests of Pikachu live are dangerous, since the trees are so often struck by lightning.

name: Fraxure

attacks.name: Dragon Slayer
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Dragon Pokémon, this attack does 40 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

flavorText: A broken tusk will not grow back, so it diligently sharpens its tusks on river rocks after the end of a battle.

name: Gligar
flavorText: It flies straight at its target's face then clamps down on the startled victim to inject poison.

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy card attached to Ponyta.

name: Axew

attacks.name: Dual Chop
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: They use their tusks to crush the berries they eat. Repeated regrowth makes their tusks strong and sharp.

name: Cacnea

attacks.name: Sneaky Attack
attacks.text: If Cacnea has any Darkness Energy attached to it, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

attacks.name: Shoot Needle
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon and this attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) (You can choose the same Pokémon more than once, but you can't do more than 10 damage to that Pokémon in this way.)

flavorText: By storing water in its body, this desert dweller can survive 30 days without water.

name: Starmie

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Core Stream
attacks.text: Choose an Energy type other than Colorless. This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon with any Energy cards of that type attached to it. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.

flavorText: The center section of its body is called the core. It glows in a different color each time it is seen.

attacks.name: Energy Call
attacks.text: Attach 1 Energy card from your discard pile to your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Cannonball
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to Delcatty but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost.

attacks.name: Sand Attack
attacks.text: If the Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Shake
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Fire Tackle
attacks.text: Blaine's Growlithe does 10 damage to itself.

name: Zubat
flavorText: Lives in dark caves. Can occasionally be seen at night, when it flies in search of food.

name: Dark Forretress

attacks.name: Armor Up
attacks.text: Until the end of your next turn, if Dark Forretress would be Knocked Out by damage from an attack, flip a coin. If heads, Dark Forretress is not Knocked Out and its remaining HP become 10 instead.

attacks.name: Explosion
attacks.text: Dark Forretress does 60 damage to itself.

flavorText: It stays motionless in trees, driving away with flying armored shards from its hard shell any who come close.

name: Dark Rapidash

attacks.name: Flame Pillar
attacks.text: You may discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Dark Rapidash when you use this attack. If you do and if your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 10 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: A wild, uncontrollable Pokémon. When running, it looks like a comet streaking through the sky.

name: Doduo

attacks.name: Fury Attack
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: A bird that makes up for its poor flying with its fast foot speed. Leaves giant footprints.

name: Rubber Gloves
rules: The attacks of the Pokémon this card is attached to do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Lightning Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
Item rule: You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.
Pokémon Tool rule: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn’t already have a Pokémon Tool attached.

name: Golduck

attacks.name: Encore
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can use only that attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Break Beam
attacks.text: You may do 40 damage plus 20 more damage. If you do, Golduck is now Confused.

flavorText: A Pokémon that lives in lakes. It swims faster than any human swimming champion.

name: Ponyta
flavorText: Its body is light, and its legs are incredibly powerful. It can clear Ayers Rock in one leap.

name: Surskit

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: When this Pokémon senses danger, a sweet fluid oozes from the tip of its head. The taste of it disgusts bird Pokémon.

name: Swadloon

attacks.name: Protect
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

flavorText: Forests where Swadloon live have superb foliage because the nutrients they make from fallen leaves nourish the plant life.

abilities.name: Carefree
abilities.text: Grumpig can't be Confused.

attacks.name: Hypnoblast
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Extra Ball
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Pokémon-ex, this attack does 50 damage plus 30 more damage.

name: Alolan Geodude

attacks.name: Rock Polish
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon has no Retreat Cost.

flavorText: Its body is a magnetic stone. Iron sand attaches firmly to the portions of its body that are particularly magnetic.

name: Roselia

attacks.name: Petal Dance
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads. Roselia is now Confused.

flavorText: Roselia that drink nutritionally rich springwater are said to reveal rare coloration when they bloom.

name: Espurr

attacks.name: Focused Wish
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

flavorText: There's enough psychic power in Espurr to send a wrestler flying, but because this power can't be controlled, Espurr finds it troublesome.

attacks.name: Clutch
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat until the end of your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Quick Dive
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 50 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

name: Venonat

attacks.name: Stun Spore
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: Its big eyes are actually clusters of tiny eyes. At night, its kind is drawn by light.

name: Pansage

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

flavorText: This Pokémon dwells deep in the forest. Eating a leaf from its head whisks weariness away as if by magic.

name: Spewpa

attacks.name: String Shot
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: The beaks of birds can't begin to scratch its stalwart body. To defend itself, it spews powder.

name: Devoured Field
rules: The attacks of Darkness Pokémon and Dragon Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) do 10 more damage to the opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

name: Gible

attacks.name: Never Enough
attacks.text: Discard a card from your hand. If you do, draw 2 cards.

flavorText: It nests in small, horizontal holes in cave walls. It pounces to catch prey that stray too close.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Metal Ball
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

name: Paras

attacks.name: Spore
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

flavorText: Burrows to suck tree roots. The mushrooms on its back grow by drawing nutrients from the bug host.

name: Carkol
flavorText: It forms coal inside its body. Coal dropped by this Pokémon once helped fuel the lives of people in the Galar region.

name: Vullaby

attacks.name: Leer
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: Their wings are too tiny to allow them to fly. They guard their posteriors with bones that were gathered by Mandibuzz.

name: Hiker
rules: Look at the top 5 cards of either player's deck and choose 1 of them. That player shuffles the other cards back into their deck. Then, put the card you chose on top of that deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

name: Gabite

attacks.name: Ascension
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

flavorText: Shiny objects are its passion. It can be found in its cave, scarcely moving, its gaze fixed on the jewels it's amassed or Carbink it has caught.

name: Silent Lab
rules: Each Basic Pokémon in play, in each player's hand, and in each player's discard pile has no Abilities.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

name: Cherubi
flavorText: It evolves by sucking the energy out of the small ball where it had been storing nutrients.

name: Magnemite

attacks.name: Thunder Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Selfdestruct
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each Pokémon on each player's Bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Magnemite does 40 damage to itself.

flavorText: Uses anti-gravity to stay suspended. Appears without warning and uses attacks like Thunder Wave.

name: Arrokuda

attacks.name: Flock
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Arrokuda and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

flavorText: If it sees any movement around it, this Pokémon charges for it straightaway, leading with its sharply pointed jaw. It's very proud of that jaw.

name: Spoink

attacks.name: Flail Around
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: Using its tail like a spring, it keeps its heart beating by bouncing constantly. If it stops, it dies.

name: Dedenne

attacks.name: Tail Trickery
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

flavorText: Its upper whiskers are sensors that survey its surroundings. Its lower whiskers are organs that shoot electricity.

name: Eevee
flavorText: It has the ability to alter the composition of its body to suit its surrounding environment.

name: Claydol

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Explosion
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 120 damage to itself.

flavorText: This mysterious Pokémon started life as an ancient clay figurine made over 20,000 years ago.

name: Fast Ball
rules: Reveal cards from your deck until you reveal an Evolution card. Show that card to your opponent and put it into your hand. Shuffle the other revealed cards into your deck. (If you don't reveal an Evolution card, shuffle all the revealed cards back into your deck.)

name: Ducklett

attacks.name: Aerial Ace
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

flavorText: When attacked, it uses its feathers to splash water, escaping under cover of the spray.

name: Psychic's Third Eye
rules: Your opponent reveals his or her hand.
Discard as many cards as you like from your hand. Then, draw that many cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

name: Ninjask

abilities.name: Cast-off Shell
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you play Ninjask from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon and if your Bench isn't full, you may put Shedinja onto your Bench as a Basic Pokémon from your hand or your discard pile.

attacks.name: Chip Off
attacks.text: If your opponent has 6 or more cards in his or her hand, discard a number of cards without looking until your opponent has 5 cards left in his or her hand.

flavorText: Because it moves so quickly, it sometimes becomes unseeable. It congregates around tree sap.

name: Scrafty

attacks.name: Dangerous Head
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Basic Pokémon, this attack does 50 more damage.

flavorText: It pulls up its shed skin to protect itself while it kicks. The bigger the crest, the more respected it is.

name: Staravia
flavorText: They maintain huge flocks, although fierce scuffles break out between various flocks.

name: Weezing

attacks.name: Balloon Bomb
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, discard 2 cards from the top of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Thick Liquid
attacks.text: Both Active Pokémon are now Confused and Poisoned.

flavorText: Very rarely, a sudden mutation can result in two small Koffing twins becoming conjoined as a Weezing.

name: Doublade

attacks.name: Curse of the Blade
attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on each of your opponent's Pokémon that has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it.

flavorText: The complex attack patterns of its two swords are unstoppable, even for an opponent greatly accomplished at swordplay.

name: Energy Pickup
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, search your discard pile for a basic Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon.

name: Trevenant

attacks.name: Eerie Wave
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Wood Hammer
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

flavorText: It can control trees at will. It will trap people who harm the forest, so they can never leave.

attacks.name: Wreck
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage. Discard that Stadium card.

attacks.name: Flames of Rage
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy attached to Primeape. This attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage for each damage counter on Primeape.

name: Tirtouga
rules: Put this card onto your Bench only with the effect of Cover Fossil

abilities.name: Prehistoric Call
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is in your discard pile, you may put this Pokémon on the bottom of your deck.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: This Pokémon was restored from a fossil. It swam skillfully and dove to depths beyond half a mile.

name: Sabrina's Suggestion
rules: Your opponent reveals their hand. You may choose a Supporter card you find there and use the effect of that card as the effect of this card.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

abilities.name: Scram
abilities.text: If Brock's Primeape ever has exactly 10 HP left, shuffle it and all cards attached to it into your deck. This power stops working while Brock's Primeape is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Mega Thrash
attacks.text: Brock's Primeape does 20 damage to itself. If there is a Stadium card in play, discard it.

name: Flaaffy

attacks.name: Discharge
attacks.text: Discard all Lightning Energy cards attached to Flaaffy in order to use this attack. Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Lightning Energy cards you discarded. This attack does 30 damage times then number of heads.

attacks.name: Electric Current
attacks.text: Take 1 Lightning Energy cards attached to Flaaffy and attach it to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If you have no Benched Pokémon, discard that Energy card.

flavorText: As a result of storing too much electricity, it developed patches where even downy wool won't grow.

name: Meowth

attacks.name: Exhausted Tackle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon. If tails, this Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.

flavorText: Adores round objects. It wanders the streets on a nightly basis to look for dropped loose change.

name: Emboar

abilities.name: Inferno Fandango
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Fire Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

flavorText: It can throw a fire punch by setting its fists on fire with its fiery chin. It cares deeply about its friends.

attacks.name: Paralyzing Gaze
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Fireworks
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard a Fire Energy card attached to Cyndaquil.

attacks.name: Sleep Inducer
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch the Defending Pokémon with it. The new Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

name: Grimer

attacks.name: Sticky Liquid
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon's Retreat Cost is Colorless more.

flavorText: Wherever Grimer has passed, so many germs are left behind that no plants will ever grow again.

name: Dewgong

attacks.name: Freezing Breath
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

flavorText: Its streamlined body has little drag in water. The colder the temperature, the friskier it gets.

name: Warp Energy
rules: Warp Energy provides Colorless Energy. When you attach this card from your hand to your Active Pokémon, switch that Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

name: Vulpix

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

flavorText: At the time of birth, it has just one tail. Its tail splits from the tip as it grows older.

attacks.name: Defense Curl
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Brock's Sandshrew during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

name: Plume Fossil
rules: Look at the bottom 7 cards of your deck. You may reveal an Archen you find there and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Chinchou
flavorText: On the dark ocean floor, its only means of communication is its constantly flashing lights.

name: Shroomish

attacks.name: Worry Seed
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

flavorText: I wonder if I would look a little cuter with a beautiful flower?

name: Arceus VSTAR
rules: VSTAR rule: When your Pokémon VSTAR is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Starbirth
abilities.text: During your turn, you may search your deck for up to 2 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck. (You can't use more than 1 VSTAR Power in a game.)

attacks.name: Trinity Nova
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 basic Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon V in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Bulbasaur

attacks.name: Leech Seed
attacks.text: Unless all damage from this attack is prevented, you may remove 1 damage counter from Bulbasaur.

flavorText: A strange seed was planted on its back at birth. Thus, a plant sprouted and now grows with this Pokémon.

name: Butterfree

attacks.name: Magic Dust
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now either Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned (your choice).

attacks.name: Hyper Reverse
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon. After doing damage, remove a number of damage counters from Butterfree equal to the amount of damage done to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

flavorText: It collects honey every day. It rubs honey onto the hairs on its legs to carry it back to its nest.

name: Burmy Plant Cloak

abilities.name: Wear Cloak
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Burmy Plant Cloak is your Active Pokémon, you may search your discard pile for a basic Grass Energy card and attach it to Burmy Plant Cloak.

attacks.name: Plant Cloak Tackle
attacks.text: If Burmy Plant Cloak has any Grass Energy attached to it, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

flavorText: To shelter itself from cold, wintry winds, it covers itself with a cloak made of twigs and leaves.

attacks.name: Scary Face
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, until the end of your opponent's next turn the Defending Pokémon can't attack or retreat.

name: Clefairy

attacks.name: Mini-Metronome
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks and use it as this attack.

flavorText: It is said that happiness will come to those who see a gathering of Clefairy dancing under a full moon.

name: Oricorio

abilities.name: Lesson in Zeal
abilities.text: All of your Fusion Strike Pokémon take 20 less damage from attacks from your opponent's Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance). You can't apply more than 1 Lesson in Zeal Ability at a time.

attacks.name: Glistening Droplets
attacks.text: Put 5 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

flavorText: This Oricorio has drunk red nectar. If its Trainer gives the wrong order, this passionate Pokémon becomes fiercely angry.

name: Crystal Beach
rules: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.
Each Special Energy card that provides 2 or more Energy (both yours and your opponent's) now provides only 1 Colorless Energy. This isn't affected by any Poké-Powers or Poké-Bodies.

name: Magnemite

attacks.name: Magnetic Catch
attacks.text: Shuffle up to 3 Metal Energy cards from your discard pile into your deck.

flavorText: A bizarre Pokémon with but a single eye embedded in an iron sphere. I suspect this creature levitates due to the magnetism it emits from its arms, which resemble horseshoe-shaped magnets.

name: Machoke

attacks.name: Karate Chop
attacks.text: Does 50 damage minus 10 damage for each damage counter on Machoke.

attacks.name: Submission
attacks.text: Machoke does 20 damage to itself.

flavorText: Its muscular body is so powerful that it must wear a power-save belt to help regulate its motions.

name: Fearow

attacks.name: Fly
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

flavorText: With its huge and magnificent wings, it can keep aloft without ever having to land or rest.

name: Axew
flavorText: They mark their territory by leaving gashes in trees with their tusks. If a tusk breaks, a new one grows in quickly.

name: Bisharp

attacks.name: Vengeful Cut
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each damage counter on all of your Benched Pawniard.

flavorText: It's accompanied by a large retinue of Pawniard. Bisharp keeps a keen eye on its minions, ensuring none of them even think of double-crossing it.

attacks.name: Poison Fang
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Thunder Jolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Charmeleon does 10 damage to itself.

abilities.name: Ice Wall
abilities.text: Any damage done to Glalie by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon with any Special Energy cards attached to it is reduced by 40 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Heavy Blizzard
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

name: Krokorok

attacks.name: Knock Off
attacks.text: Discard a random card from your opponent's hand.

flavorText: They move in groups of a few individuals. A female is often the leader of the group, and the males will gather food.

name: Probopass

attacks.name: Magnetic Tension
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to the new Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Iron Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 20 damage to itself.

flavorText: It uses three small units to catch prey and battle enemies. The main body mostly just gives orders.

name: Skwovet

attacks.name: Scrounge
attacks.text: Put a Pokémon Tool card from your discard pile into your hand.

flavorText: It eats berries nonstop—a habit that has made it more resilient than it looks. It'll show up on farms, searching for yet more berries.

name: Magikarp

attacks.name: Epic Splash
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If either of them is tails, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: In the distant past, it was somewhat stronger than the horribly weak descendants that exist today.

name: Pikachu

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

attacks.name: Volt Tackle
attacks.text: Pikachu does 10 damage to itself.

flavorText: If it looses crackling power from the electric pouches on its cheeks, it is being wary.

name: Salandit

attacks.name: Venoshock
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Poisoned, this attack does 40 more damage.

flavorText: It burns its bodily fluids to create a poisonous gas. When its enemies become disoriented from inhaling the gas, it attacks them.

name: Ariados

abilities.name: Spider Net
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Evolution Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: It spews threads from its mouth to catch its prey. When night falls, it leaves its web to go hunt aggressively.

name: Drowzee

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

flavorText: A descendant of the legendary animal baku, which is said to eat dreams. It is skilled at hypnotism.

name: Fire Crystal
rules: Put 3 Fire Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Drilbur

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: By spinning its body, it can dig straight through the ground at a speed of 30 mph.

name: Altaria

attacks.name: Dragonbreath
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Cotton Cloud
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Altaria by attacks from your opponent's Evolved Pokémon is reduced by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

flavorText: It looks like a fluffy cloud when it is in flight. It hums with its soprano voice.

name: Suspicious Food Tin
rules: Heal 80 damage from 1 of your Pokémon that has at least 1 Psychic Energy attached. If you healed any damage in this way, discard a Psychic Energy from it.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Hawlucha

attacks.name: Flying Stomp
attacks.text: Discard a Special Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

flavorText: It always strikes a pose before going for its finishing move. Sometimes opponents take advantage of that time to counterattack.

name: Sentret

attacks.name: Grope
attacks.text: Look at the top 2 cards of your deck, choose 1 of them, and put it into your hand. Put the other card on the bottom of your deck.

flavorText: It has a very nervous nature. It stands up high on its tail so it can scan wide areas.

name: Mallow
rules: Search your deck for 2 cards, shuffle your deck, and put those cards on top of your deck in any order.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

name: Clefable

attacks.name: Moon Barrier
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon by Dragon Pokémon.

attacks.name: Tumbling Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

flavorText: A timid fairy Pokémon that is rarely seen, it will run and hide the moment it senses people.

name: Galarian Linoone
flavorText: This very aggressive Pokémon will recklessly challenge opponents stronger than itself.

name: Hippopotas

attacks.name: Double Headbutt
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: It shuts its nostrils tight then travels through sand as if walking. They form colonies of around ten.

name: Watchog

attacks.name: Hypnoblast
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Psych Up
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Psych Up attack does 30 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

flavorText: Using luminescent matter, it makes its eyes and body glow and stuns attacking opponents.

name: Lopunny
flavorText: It’s notably wary and has a dislike of fighting, but at the same time, it can deliver powerful kicks with its lithe legs.

name: Dunsparce

attacks.name: Return
attacks.text: Draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand.

flavorText: When spotted, this Pokémon escapes backward by furiously boring into the ground with its tail.

name: Beldum

attacks.name: Calculate
attacks.text: Look at the top 4 cards of your deck and put them back on top of your deck in any order.

flavorText: Its cells are all magnetic, and it communicates with others by using magnetic pulses.

name: Haunter

attacks.name: Smog
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Hoodwink
attacks.text: You may search your opponent's discard pile for up to 3 in any combination of Trainer, Supporter, or Stadium cards and put them into your opponent's hand.

flavorText: It can slip through any obstacle. It lurks inside walls to keep an eye on its foes.

name: Spearow
flavorText: Its reckless nature leads it to stand up to others—even large Pokémon—if it has to protect its territory.

attacks.name: Lightning Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Magmar

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

flavorText: Found near the mouth of a volcano. This fire-breather's body temperature is nearly 2,200 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: N's Resolve
rules: Discard the top 6 cards of your deck. If any of those cards are basic Energy cards, attach them to 1 of your Benched Dragon Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

name: Numel

attacks.name: Continuous Headbutt
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

flavorText: Its humped back stores intensely hot magma. In rain, the magma cools, slowing its movement.

name: Unfezant

attacks.name: Fly
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

flavorText: Males swing their head plumage to threaten opponents. The females' flying abilities surpass those of the males.

name: Dratini

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

flavorText: It's still weak, so it lurks on the floor of bodies of water, eating whatever food sinks down and living a quiet life.

name: Magnemite

attacks.name: Thunder Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Self-Destruct
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 50 damage to itself.

flavorText: It moves while constantly hovering. It discharges Thunder Wave and so on from the units at its sides.

name: Houndour

attacks.name: Corner
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: When night falls, the air fills with the eerie cries of this Pokémon as it stakes out its territory.

name: Persian

attacks.name: Pay Day
attacks.text: Draw a card.

flavorText: Its elegant and refined behavior clashes with that of the barbaric Perrserker. The relationship between the two is one of mutual disdain.

name: Pikachu
flavorText: Its nature is to store up electricity. Forests where nests of Pikachu live are dangerous, since the trees are so often struck by lightning.

name: Town Map
rules: Turn all of your Prize cards face up. (Those Prize cards remain face up for the rest of the game.)
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Team Magma's Mightyena

attacks.name: Hostile Fang
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Team Aqua Pokémon, this attack does 40 more damage.

flavorText: This Pokémon is loyal to its master. It will protect its partner to the end, no matter what.

name: Single Strike Scroll of the Fanged Dragon
rules: The Single Strike Pokémon this card is attached to can use the attack on this card. (You still need the necessary Energy to use this attack.) FightingMetalMetalColorlessColorless Superstrong Slash 300 Discard all Energy from this Pokémon.
Item rule: You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.
Pokémon Tool rule: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn’t already have a Pokémon Tool attached.

name: Sealeo
flavorText: Be it Spheal or a Poké Ball, it will spin any round object on its nose with the greatest of ease.

name: Bruxish

attacks.name: Vivid Charge
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 basic Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Psychic Fangs
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

flavorText: It stuns its prey with psychokinesis and then grinds them to mush with its strong teeth. Even Shellder's shell is no match for it.

name: Galactic HQ
rules: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.
Whenever any player plays any Pokémon from his or her hand to evolve his or her Pokémon, put 2 damage counters on that Pokémon.

abilities.name: Prismatic Body
abilities.text: Each basic Energy card attached to Ditto provides every type of Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time.

attacks.name: Copy
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. Copy copies that attack. This attack does nothing if Ditto doesn't have the Energy necessary to use that attack. (You must still do anything else required in order to use that attack.)

attacks.name: Extra Ball
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Pokémon-ex, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage.

name: Cramorant

attacks.name: Dive
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

flavorText: It's so strong that it can knock out some opponents in a single hit, but it also may forget what it's battling midfight.

name: Friend Ball
rules: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. Search your deck for a Baby Pokémon, Basic Pokémon, or Evolution card of the same type (color), show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

abilities.name: Poison Payback
abilities.text: If Kakuna is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Kakuna is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokémon is now Poisoned.

name: Joltik

attacks.name: Leech Life
attacks.text: Heal from this Pokémon the same amount of damage you did to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

flavorText: They attach themselves to large-bodied Pokémon and absorb static electricity, which they store in an electric pouch.

name: Piplup

attacks.name: Water Splash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage.

flavorText: Because it is very proud, it hates accepting food from people. Its thick down guards it from cold.

name: Team Galactic's Invention G-105 Poké Turn
rules: Return 1 of your Pokémon SP and all cards attached to it to your hand.

name: Vulpix

attacks.name: Reheat
attacks.text: Discard up to 2 Energy cards from your hand. For each card you discarded, draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

flavorText: It controls balls of fire. As it grows, its six tails split from their tips to make more tails.

name: Mantine

attacks.name: Undulate
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Mantine.

flavorText: Swimming freely in open seas, it may fly out of the water and over the waves if it builds up enough speed.

attacks.name: Signs of Evolution
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Metapod and a Butterfree card, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: String Shot
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

abilities.name: Bad Sleeping Habits
abilities.text: As long as Snorlax is Asleep, your opponent's Active Pokémon can't retreat.

attacks.name: Toss and Turn
attacks.text: If Snorlax is Asleep, this attack does 20 damage plus 30 more damage. (This attack can be used even if Snorlax is Asleep.)

attacks.name: Heavy Press
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 40 more damage. If tails, Snorlax is now Asleep.

name: Blacksmith
rules: Attach 2 Fire Energy cards from your discard pile to 1 of your Fire Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

name: Palpitoad

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

flavorText: When they vibrate the bumps on their heads, the can make wave in water or earthquake-like vibrations on land.

attacks.name: Mysterious Powder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

name: Bunnelby

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

flavorText: It has ears like shovels. Digging holes strengthens its ears so much that they can sever thick roots effortlessly.

attacks.name: Sleep Inducer
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Defending Pokémon to switch. The new Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Quick Blow
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

name: Flabébé

attacks.name: Hypnotic Gaze
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

flavorText: Flabébé wears a crown made from pollen it’s collected from its flower. The crown has hidden healing properties.

name: Omanyte

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Tickle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: A Pokémon that was resurrected from a fossil using modern science. It swam in ancient seas.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Tauros.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: Tauros does 10 damage to itself.

name: Arctovish

attacks.name: Hard Face
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 60 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Cold Breath
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

flavorText: Though it's able to capture prey by freezing its surroundings, it has trouble eating the prey afterward because its mouth is on top of its head.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

name: Sail Fossil
rules: Look at the bottom 7 cards of your deck. You may reveal an Amaura you find there and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Pikipek
flavorText: It may look spindly, but its neck muscles are heavy-duty. It can peck at a tree 16 times per second!

name: Sentret

attacks.name: Grope
attacks.text: Look at the top 2 cards of your deck, choose 1 of them, and put it into your hand. Put the other card on the bottom of your deck.

flavorText: It has a very nervous nature. It stands up high on its tail so it can scan wide areas.

name: Team Magma's Aron
flavorText: Aron, which even devour metal, can eat and destroy enemy ships in an instant.

name: Timburr
flavorText: Timburr that have started carrying logs that are about three times their size are nearly ready to evolve.

name: Schoolboy
rules: Draw 2 cards. If your opponent has exactly 1, 3, or 5 Prize cards remaining, draw 2 more cards.
Supporter rule: You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Siebold
rules: Choose up to 2 of your Rapid Strike Pokémon and heal 60 damage from each of them.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Pikachu
rules: Oran Berry: Remove 1 damage counter from Pikachu at the end of your turn.

attacks.name: Spark
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Chatot

attacks.name: Me First
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Tone-Deaf
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

flavorText: It can learn and speak human words. If they gather, they all learn the same saying.

attacks.name: Super Speed
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Doduo.

name: Shuppet

attacks.name: Gossip
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

flavorText: It loves vengeful emotions and hangs in rows under the eaves of houses where vengeful people live.

name: Poliwag

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Poliwag but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. Extra Water Energy after the 2nd don't count.

flavorText: Its newly grown legs prevent it from running. It appears to prefer swimming over trying to stand.

name: Electrode
