attacks.name: Continuous Tumble
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Energy Bomb
attacks.text: You may move all Energy from this Pokémon to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like.

flavorText: It stores an overflowing amount of electric energy inside its body. Even a small shock makes it explode.

name: Trubbish

attacks.name: Poison Gas
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: Inhaling the gas they belch will make you sleep for a week. They prefer unsanitary places.

name: Electrode
flavorText: It is known to drift on winds if it is bloated to bursting with stored electricity.

name: Dark Magneton

attacks.name: Sonicboom
attacks.text: Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.)

attacks.name: Magnetic Lines
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any basic Energy cards attached to it, choose 1 of them. If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and attach that Energy card to it.

flavorText: The number of incidents of hackers using Magnetons to damage computer systems is steadily increasing.

name: Alolan Grimer

attacks.name: Chemical Breath
attacks.text: This attack does 50 more damage for each Special Condition affecting your opponent's Active Pokémon.

flavorText: The crystals on Grimer's body are lumps of toxins. If one falls off, lethal poisons leak out.

name: Dewpider

attacks.name: Spider Web
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

flavorText: When it comes across enemies or potential prey, this Pokémon smashes its water-bubble-covered head into them.

name: Holon Ruins
rules: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.
Each player that has any Pokémon in play that has δ on its card may draw a card once during his or her turn. If the player does, he or she discards a card from his or her hand.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

name: Magnemite

attacks.name: Mirror Shot
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack doesn't happen.

flavorText: It's frequently the cause of power outages, which is why some power plants send out electrical signals that it can't stand.

attacks.name: Double Headbutt
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Ice Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Nap
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from Jigglypuff.

attacks.name: Lullaby
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

name: Murkrow

attacks.name: Switcheroo
attacks.text: Move a Pokémon Tool card attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon to another of your opponent's Pokémon (excluding Pokémon that already has a Pokémon Tool attached to it). (If an effect of this attack is prevented, this attack does nothing.)

flavorText: If spotted, it will lure an unwary person into chasing it, then lose the pursuer on mountain trails.

name: Chinchou
flavorText: It discharges positive and negative electricity from its antenna tips to shock its foes.

attacks.name: Smash Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Fling
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon, if any. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

name: Clamperl
flavorText: Clamperl’s pearls are exceedingly precious. They can be more than 10 times as costly as Shellder’s pearls.

name: Grotle

attacks.name: Sleep Powder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

flavorText: A Grotle that lives in the forest is said to have its own secret springwater.

name: Starmie

attacks.name: Recover
attacks.text: Discard 1 Water Energy card attached to Starmie in order to use this attack. Remove all damage counters from Starmie.

attacks.name: Star Freeze
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: Its central core glows with the seven colors of the rainbow. Some people value this core as a gem.

name: Krokorok

attacks.name: Corner
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

flavorText: Krokorok really hates it when its body gets cold. On nights when the temperature drops, it digs deep into the desert sands.

name: Hoppip

abilities.name: Cottonweed
abilities.text: If Hoppip has any Grass Energy attached to it, the Retreat Cost for Hoppip is 0.

attacks.name: Hover Heal
attacks.text: Remove all Special Conditions from Hoppip.

flavorText: It drifts on winds. It is said that when HOPPIP gather in fields and mountains, spring is on the way.

name: Kirlia

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

flavorText: If its Trainer becomes happy, it overflows with energy, dancing joyously while spinning about.

attacks.name: Dragon Crush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each Defending Pokémon. Discard an Energy card from each Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Aqua Sonic
attacks.text: This attack's damage is not affected by Resistance.

name: Minccino

attacks.name: Cleaning Up
attacks.text: Discard a Pokémon Tool card attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

flavorText: These Pokémon prefer a tidy habitat. They are always sweeping and dusting, using their tails as brooms.

name: Weedle

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: Often found in forests and grasslands. It has a sharp, toxic barb of around two inches on top of its head.

name: Dodrio

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Endeavor
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

flavorText: An enemy that takes its eyes off any of the three heads—even for a second—will get pecked severely.

name: Slowbro

attacks.name: Yawn
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Three Strikes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 100 damage for each heads. If all of them are tails, you lose this game.

flavorText: Spacing out is basically all it does. It turns back into Slowpoke if its tail, along with Shellder, breaks off.

name: Slurpuff

attacks.name: Follow the Scent
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. Put a number of cards up to the number of heads from your discard pile into your hand.

flavorText: Slurpuff's fur contains a lot of air, making it soft to the touch and lighter than it looks.

name: Chikorita

attacks.name: Deflector
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, whenever Chikorita takes damage, divide that damage in half (rounded down to the nearest 10). (Any other effects still happen.)

flavorText: A sweet aroma gently wafts from the leaf on its head. It is docile and loves to soak up the sun's rays.

name: Stufful

attacks.name: Baby-Doll Eyes
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

flavorText: Despite its adorable appearance, when it gets angry and flails about, its arms and legs could knock a pro wrestler sprawling.

name: Vulpix

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

flavorText: While young, it has six gorgeous tails. When it grows, several new tails are sprouted.

name: Slugma

abilities.name: Active Volcano
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard the top card of your deck. If that card is a Fire Energy card, attach it to Slugma. This power can't be used if Slugma is affected by a Special Condition.

flavorText: A common sight in volcanic areas, it slowly slithers around in a constant search for warm places.

name: Venipede

abilities.name: Poison Point
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: Using the feelers on its head and tail, it picks up vibrations in the air to determine its prey's location and state.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

name: Togepi

abilities.name: Touch of Happiness
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may heal 10 damage from your Active Pokémon.

flavorText: This ovate creature is frequently mistaken for a moving egg when encountered out in the fields or in the mountains. Its guileless smile soothes the soul.

name: Nita
rules: You can play this card only if your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Basic Pokémon.
Put an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon on top of their deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

name: Whismur

attacks.name: Round
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage times the number of your Pokémon that have the Round attack.

flavorText: If it senses danger, it scares the foe by crying out with the volume of a jet-plane engine.

name: Magikarp

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on this Pokémon.

flavorText: It is virtually worthless in terms of both power and speed. It is the most weak and pathetic Pokémon in the world.

name: Rhydon

attacks.name: Rock Tumble
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Megahorn
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: Protected by an armor-like hide, it is capable of living in molten lava of 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: Lopunny

abilities.name: Big Jump
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may return this Pokémon and all cards attached to it to your hand.

attacks.name: Sitdown Bounce
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

flavorText: Extremely cautious, it quickly bounds off when it senses danger.

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Razor Wind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Diglett
flavorText: If a Diglett digs through a field, it leaves the soil perfectly tilled and ideal for planting crops.

name: Buneary

attacks.name: Bounce
attacks.text: Switch Buneary with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Mini Drain
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from Buneary.

flavorText: Its ears are always rolled up. They can be forcefully extended to shatter even a large boulder.

name: Battle Frontier
rules: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play.
Each player's Colorless Evolved Pokémon, Darkness Evolved Pokémon, and Metal Evolved Pokémon can't use any Poké-Powers or Poké-Bodies.

name: Hawlucha

attacks.name: Backflip
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Wicked Jab
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: With its wings, it controls its position in the air. It likes to attack from above, a maneuver that is difficult to defend against.

name: Acro Bike
rules: Look at the top 2 cards of your deck and put 1 of them into your hand. Discard the other card.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Lampent

attacks.name: Cursed Drop
attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Night March
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage times the number of Pokémon in your discard pile that have the Night March attack.

flavorText: The spirits it absorbs fuel its baleful fire. It hangs around hospitals waiting for people to pass on.

name: Hyper Potion
rules: Choose 1 of your Pokémon. Discard 1 or 2 basic Energy cards attached to that Pokémon. If you discarded 1 Energy card, remove up to 3 damage counters from that Pokémon. If you discarded 2 Energy cards, remove up to 5 damage counters from that Pokémon.

name: Petilil

attacks.name: Stun Spore
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: The leaves on its head are very bitter. Eating one of these leaves is known to refresh a tired body.

name: Pyroar

attacks.name: Swirling Inferno
attacks.text: Discard all Pokémon Tool cards and Special Energy from each of your opponent's Pokémon.

flavorText: The males are usually lazy, but when attacked by a strong foe, a male will protect its friends with no regard for its own safety.

attacks.name: Aerial Ace
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

name: Musharna

attacks.name: Rest Well
attacks.text: Both Active Pokémon are now Asleep. During your next turn, this Pokémon's attacks do 100 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

flavorText: The mist emanating from their foreheads is packed with the dreams of people and Pokémon.

attacks.name: Horn Charge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Overrun
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads and if your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 20 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Yawn
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

name: Deino

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

flavorText: Because it can’t see, this Pokémon is constantly biting at everything it touches, trying to keep track of its surroundings.

name: Beldum

abilities.name: Conductive Body
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, its Retreat Cost is Colorless less for each Beldum on your Bench.

flavorText: With magnetic traction, it pulls its opponents in close. When they're in range, it slashes them with its rear claws.

name: Skorupi

attacks.name: Pin Missile
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: It burrows under the sand to lie in wait for prey. Its tail claws can inject its prey with a savage poison.

name: Servine

attacks.name: Wring Out
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed and discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

flavorText: They avoid attacks by sinking into the shadows of thick foliage. They retaliate with masterful whipping techniques.

abilities.name: Exoskeleton
abilities.text: Any damage done to Kabuto by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Team Assembly
attacks.text: Search your deck for Omanyte, Kabuto, or any Basic Pokémon and put as many of them as you like onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. Treat the new Benched Pokémon as Basic Pokémon.

name: Cranidos
flavorText: In rock layers where Cranidos fossils are found, the fossilized trunks of trees snapped in two are also often found.

name: Rocket's Hideout
rules: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play.
Each Pokémon in play with Dark in its name (even your opponent's) gets +20 HP.

name: Beartic

attacks.name: Sheer Cold
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't attack.

flavorText: It swims through frigid seas, searching for prey. From its frozen breath, it forms icy fangs that are harder than steel.

attacks.name: Second Strike
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has at least 2 damage counters on it, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Land Crush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard an Energy card attached to Team Magma's Rhydon.

abilities.name: Emerge
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for an Evolution card named Koga's Beedrill and put it on Koga's Kakuna. (This counts as evolving Koga's Kakuna.) Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Koga's Kakuna is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Toxic Secretion
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. It now takes 20 Poison damage instead of 10 after each player's turn (even if it was already Poisoned).

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

name: Electrike

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

flavorText: It stores static electricity in its fur for discharging. It gives off sparks if a storm approaches.

name: Copycat
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, count the number of cards in your opponent's hand and draw that many cards.

name: Joltik

attacks.name: Jump On
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

flavorText: Since it can't generate its own electricity, it sticks onto large-bodied Pokémon and absorbs static electricity.

name: Unown [E]
rules: You may have up to 4 Basic Pokémon cards in your deck with Unown in their names.

abilities.name: [Engage]
abilities.text: When you play Unown [E] from your hand, your opponent may shuffle his or her hand into his or her deck and then draw 4 cards. Either way, you may shuffle your hand into your deck and draw 4 cards.

flavorText: Their shapes look like hieroglyphs on ancient tablets. It is said that the two are somehow related.

name: Tynamo
flavorText: One alone can emit only a trickle of electricity, so a group of them gathers to unleash a powerful electric shock.

attacks.name: Firebreathing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage.

name: Woobat

attacks.name: Unamplified Soundwave
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) If you have any cards in your hand, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: While inside a cave, if you look up and see lots of heart-shaped marks lining the walls, it's evidence that Woobat live there.

name: Sobble
flavorText: When scared, this Pokémon cries. Its tears pack the chemical punch of 100 onions, and attackers won't be able to resist weeping.

name: Electabuzz

attacks.name: Thunder
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.

flavorText: Electricity leaks from it in amounts far greater than the amount of electricity it eats.

name: Houndour

attacks.name: Smog
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Collect Fire
attacks.text: If there are any Fire Energy cards in your discard pile, choose 1 of them and attach it to Houndour.

flavorText: To corner prey, they check each other's location using barks that only they can understand.

name: Professor's Letter
rules: Search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Electrode

attacks.name: Continuous Tumble
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Energy Bomb
attacks.text: You may move all Energy from this Pokémon to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like.

flavorText: It stores an overflowing amount of electric energy inside its body. Even a small shock makes it explode.

name: Ultra Ball
rules: Discard 2 cards from your hand. (If you can't discard 2 cards, you can't play this card.) Search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Morpeko

attacks.name: Famished
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Thunder Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: As it eats the seeds stored up in its pocket-like pouches, this Pokémon is not just satisfying its constant hunger. It's also generating electricity.

name: Carnivine

attacks.name: Chomp Chomp
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Loom Over
attacks.text: This attack does 10 less damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

flavorText: It binds itself to trees in marshes. It attracts prey with its sweet-smelling drool and gulps them down.

name: Pidgey

attacks.name: Growl
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 20 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

flavorText: It is docile and prefers to avoid conflict. If disturbed, however, it can ferociously strike back.

abilities.name: Duplicate
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for another Ditto and switch it with Ditto. (Any cards attached to Ditto, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) If you do, put Ditto on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Duplicate Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Spiral Drain
attacks.text: Remove 3 damage counter from Ditto (all if there are less than 3).

name: Mew VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Cross Fusion Strike
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your Benched Fusion Strike Pokémon's attacks and use it as this attack.

attacks.name: Max Miracle
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

name: Furfrou

attacks.name: Find a Friend
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Fur Attack
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 20 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

flavorText: Left alone, its fur will grow longer and longer, but it will only allow someone it trusts to cut it.

name: The Masked Royal
rules: Attach a basic Energy card from your hand to one of your Stage 2 Grass, Fire, or Water Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

name: Flareon

attacks.name: Vengeance
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each Pokémon in your discard pile.

attacks.name: Heat Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

flavorText: Inhaled air is carried to its flame sac, heated, and exhaled as fire that reaches over 3,000 degrees F.

name: Cyclone Energy
rules: Cyclone Energy provides Colorless Energy. When you attach this card from your hand to your Active Pokémon, switch 1 of the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Benched Pokémon to switch.

name: Silicobra

attacks.name: Sand Attack
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if the Defending Pokémon tries to attack, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack doesn't happen.

flavorText: It spews sand from its nostrils. While the enemy is blinded, it burrows into the ground to hide.

name: Sewaddle
flavorText: This Pokémon makes clothes for itself. It chews up leaves and sews them with sticky thread extruded from its mouth.

abilities.name: Shuffle
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for another Unown and switch it with Unown. (Any cards attached to Unown, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) If you do, put Unown on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Shuffle Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Hidden Power
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, put damage counters on the Defending Pokémon until it is 10 HP away from being Knocked Out.

name: Multi Energy
rules: Attach Multi Energy to 1 of your Pokémon. While in play, Multi Energy provides every type of Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time. (Has no effect other than providing Energy.) Multi Energy provides Colorless Energy when attached to a Pokémon that already has Special Energy cards attached to it.

name: Shellos West Sea

attacks.name: Recover
attacks.text: Discard a Water Energy attached to Shellos West Sea and remove all damage counters from Shellos West Sea.

flavorText: Its colors and shapes differ from region to region. In the Sinnoh region, two types are confirmed.

name: Seel
flavorText: It has always been supposed that Seel live only in cold seas. Their having shown up in Alola is a mystery.

name: Swinub
flavorText: It rubs its snout on the ground to find and dig up food. It sometimes discovers hot springs.

name: Sea of Nothingness
rules: Special Conditions are not removed when Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) evolve or devolve.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

name: Chatot

attacks.name: Me First
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Tone-Deaf
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

flavorText: It can learn and speak human words. If they gather, they all learn the same saying.

name: Shinx
flavorText: All of its fur dazzles if danger is sensed. It flees while the foe is momentarily blinded.

name: Riolu
flavorText: It's exceedingly energetic, with enough stamina to keep running all through the night. Taking it for walks can be a challenging experience.

name: Machop
flavorText: It loves working out. As it gazes at its muscles, which continue to swell day by day, it becomes more and more dedicated to its training.

name: Ralts

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

flavorText: If its horns capture the warm feelings of people or Pokémon, its body warms up slightly.

attacks.name: Baby Outing
attacks.text: Look at the top 3 cards of your deck, and then choose 1 of those cards and put it into your hand. Shuffle the rest into your deck afterward.

name: Joltik
flavorText: Joltik can be found clinging to other Pokémon. It's soaking up static electricity because it can't produce a charge on its own.

name: Exeggcute
flavorText: Though it may look like it's just a bunch of eggs, it's a proper Pokémon. Exeggcute communicates with others of its kind via telepathy, apparently.

name: Pumpkaboo

attacks.name: Night March
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage times the number of Pokémon in your discard pile that have the Night March attack.

flavorText: The pumpkin body is inhabited by a spirit trapped in this world. As the sun sets, it becomes restless and active.

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Super Singe
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

name: Weedle

attacks.name: Rescue String
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for up to 5 Pokémon, show them to your opponent, and shuffle them into your deck.

attacks.name: Needling Sting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

flavorText: It eats its weight in leaves every day. It fends off attackers with the needle on its head.

name: Watchog

attacks.name: Watcheck
attacks.text: Look at the top 5 cards of your opponent's deck and put them back on top of his or her deck in any order.

attacks.name: Quick Tail Smash
attacks.text: Before doing damage, you may flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 60 more damage. If tails, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: When they see an enemy, their tails stand high, and they spit the seeds of berries stored in their cheek pouches.

name: Gastly

attacks.name: Sleeping Gas
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Destiny Bond
attacks.text: Discard 1 Psychic Energy card attached to Gastly in order to use this attack. If a Pokémon Knocks Out Gastly during your opponent's next turn, Knock Out that Pokémon.

flavorText: Almost invisible, this gaseous Pokémon cloaks the target and puts it to sleep without notice.

name: Clefairy

attacks.name: Mini-Metronome
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks and use it as this attack.

flavorText: It is said that happiness will come to those who see a gathering of Clefairy dancing under a full moon.

name: Karrablast

abilities.name: Shell On
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a Shelmet from your hand. If you do, search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

flavorText: These mysterious Pokémon evolve when they receive electrical stimulation while they are in the same place as Shelmet.

name: Max Revive
rules: Put a Pokémon from your discard pile on top of your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Dark Jolteon

attacks.name: Lightning Flash
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Thunder Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, Dark Jolteon does 10 damage to itself.

flavorText: A dangerous Pokémon when angered. It likes to playfully shock people with the electricity it stores within its body.

attacks.name: Double-edge
attacks.text: Koffing does 10 damage to itself.

name: Pokémon Reversal
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent switches 1 of his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

name: Trapinch

attacks.name: Mountain Munch
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

flavorText: It lives in arid deserts. It makes a sloping pit trap in sand where it patiently awaits prey.

name: Togedemaru

attacks.name: Electrosmash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

flavorText: The spiny fur on its back is normally at rest. When this Pokémon becomes agitated, its fur stands on end and stabs into its attackers.

name: Sudowoodo

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Sudowoodo.

attacks.name: Wood Hammer
attacks.text: Sudowoodo does 30 damage to itself.

flavorText: It stands along paths pretending to be a tree. If it starts raining, it seems to disappear.

name: Gothitelle

attacks.name: Mental Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused. If tails, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

flavorText: They can predict the future from the placement and movement of the stars. They can see Trainers' life spans.

name: Tyrogue

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Hitmonlee, Hitmonchan, or Hitmontop from your hand onto Tyrogue (this counts as evolving Tyrogue) and remove all damage counters from Tyrogue.

attacks.name: Gut Blow
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is an Evolved Pokémon, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage and Tyrogue does 10 damage to itself.

flavorText: It is famous for its eagerness to fight and always nurses injuries from challenging larger foes.

name: Alolan Meowth

attacks.name: Spoil the Fun
attacks.text: If you go second, this attack does 60 more damage during your first turn.

flavorText: When its delicate pride is wounded, or when the gold coin on its forehead is dirtied, it flies into a hysterical rage.

name: Heavy Ball
rules: Search your deck for a Pokémon with a Retreat Cost of 3 or more, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Pancham
flavorText: It follows Pangoro around like a henchman. When Pancham makes a big mistake, its leaf gets taken away.

attacks.name: Mischief
attacks.text: Shuffle your opponent's deck.

name: Dwebble

attacks.name: Sharp Claws
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

flavorText: It first tries to find a rock to live in, but if there are no suitable rocks to be found, Dwebble may move in to the ports of a Hippowdon.

abilities.name: Fluff
abilities.text: Whenever Swablu would be damaged or affected by an opponent's attack and already has at least 1 damage counter on it, flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of that attack, including damage, done to Swablu.

name: Rookidee

attacks.name: Pluck
attacks.text: Before doing damage, discard all Pokémon Tools from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

flavorText: It will bravely challenge any opponent, no matter how powerful. This Pokémon benefits from every battle—even a defeat increases its strength a bit.

name: Simisear

attacks.name: Yawn
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

flavorText: A flame burns inside its body. It scatters embers from its head and tail to sear its opponents.

name: Magmar

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

flavorText: Found near the mouth of a volcano. This fire-breather's body temperature is nearly 2,200 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: Flabébé
flavorText: It's OK. No one will take away your flower. You look cute even when you're angry.

name: Solosis

attacks.name: Cell Culture
attacks.text: Search your deck for Solosis and put it into your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

flavorText: Because their bodies are enveloped in a special liquid, they can survive in any environment.

name: Lotad

attacks.name: Surprise
attacks.text: Choose a random card from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals that card and shuffles it into their deck.

flavorText: It searches about for clean water. If it does not drink water for too long, the leaf on its head wilts.

name: Swirlix

attacks.name: Cotton Guard
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 10 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

flavorText: To entangle its opponents in battle, it extrudes white threads as sweet and sticky as cotton candy.

name: Scyther

attacks.name: Slashing Strike
attacks.text: During your next turn, Scyther can't use Slashing Strike.

flavorText: It slashes through grass with its sharp scythes, moving too fast for the human eye to track.

name: Unown [V]
rules: You may have up to 4 Basic Pokémon cards in your deck with Unown in their names.

abilities.name: [Vanish]
abilities.text: When you play Unown [V] from your hand, you may flip a coin. If heads, return 1 of your Pokémon with Unown in its name (other than Unown [V]) to your hand. (Discard all cards attached to that card.)

flavorText: It is believed that the variety of types of this Pokémon were created by evolutionary adaptation, as each possesses a different ability.

name: Snivy
flavorText: It is very intelligent and calm. Being exposed to lots of sunlight makes its movements swifter.

name: Medicham

attacks.name: Force Palm
attacks.text: Count the number of damage counters on Medicham. Put that many damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Spinning Kick
attacks.text: Medicham does 20 damage to itself.

flavorText: Through yoga training, it has honed its sixth sense. Its movements are elegant.

name: Beldum

attacks.name: Pit Search
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Stadium card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

flavorText: It converses with others by using magnetic pulses. In a swarm, they move in perfect unison.

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Cyndaquil.

name: Bellelba & Brycen-Man
rules: Discard 3 cards from the top of each player's deck.
When you play this card, you may discard 3 other cards from your hand. If you do, each player discards their Benched Pokémon until they have 3 Benched Pokémon. Your opponent discards first.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

name: Gastly

attacks.name: Sleep Poison
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned.

flavorText: Born from gases, anyone would faint if engulfed by its gaseous body, which contains poison.

name: Arcanine

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

flavorText: Its proud and regal appearance has captured the hearts of people since long ago.

name: Arbok

abilities.name: Intimidating Pattern
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks do 30 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Venomous Fang
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: The pattern on its belly appears to be a frightening face. Weak foes will flee just at the sight of the pattern.

name: Onix

attacks.name: Harden
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, whenever 30 or less damage is done to Onix (after applying Weakness and Resistance), prevent that damage. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

flavorText: As it grows, the stone portions of its body harden to become similar to a diamond, though colored black.

attacks.name: Rising Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage.

name: Seedot
flavorText: When it dangles from a tree branch, it looks just like an acorn. It enjoys scaring other Pokémon.

name: Sewaddle

abilities.name: Swaddling Leaves
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 10 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: This Pokémon makes clothes for itself. It chews up leaves and sews them with sticky thread extruded from its mouth.

attacks.name: Thrust
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, discard 1 Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Rising Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage.

attacks.name: Tight Jaw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Audino

attacks.name: Do the Wave
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of your Benched Pokémon.

flavorText: It touches others with the feelers on its ears, using the sound of their heartbeats to tell how they are feeling.

name: Kamado
rules: Choose a card in your hand, and discard the other cards. If you do, draw 4 cards. (If you have no other cards in your hand, you can't use this card.)
Supporter rule: You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Abomasnow

attacks.name: Bang Heads
attacks.text: Both this Pokémon and the Defending Pokémon are now Confused.

flavorText: They appear when the snow flowers bloom. When the petals fall, they retreat to places unknown again.

attacks.name: Whiny Voice
attacks.text: Choose a random card from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals that card and shuffles it into their deck.

attacks.name: Bubblebeam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Cloyster

attacks.name: Clamp Crush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed and discard an Energy attached to that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Spike Cannon
attacks.text: Flip 5 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: Cloyster that live in seas with harsh tidal currents grow large, sharp spikes on their shells.

name: Trapinch

abilities.name: Gather Sand
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Trapinch is your Active Pokémon, you may search your discard pile for a basic Fighting card and attach it to Trapinch.

attacks.name: Grind
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the amount of Energy attached to Trapinch.

flavorText: It makes a conical pit in desert sand and lies in wait at the bottom for prey to come tumbling down.

attacks.name: Dazzle Blast
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Healing Wave
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from each of your Active Pokémon.

name: Shrine of Memories
rules: Each player's evolved Pokémon can use any attack from its previous Evolutions. (That player still needs the necessary Energy to use each attack.)
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

name: Bergmite
flavorText: Lives on mountains blanketed in perennial snow. It freezes water vapor in the air to make the ice helmet that it dons for defense.

name: Pidgey

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

flavorText: A common sight in forests and woods. It flaps its wings at ground level to kick up blinding sand.

name: Surprise Box
rules: Put a card from your opponent's discard pile into their hand.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Acro Bike
rules: Look at the top 2 cards of your deck and put 1 of them into your hand. Discard the other card.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

attacks.name: Mug
attacks.text: Before doing damage, discard all Trainer cards attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Mankey.

name: Spewpa

attacks.name: Grass Cocooning
attacks.text: Heal 40 damage from this Pokémon.

flavorText: The beaks of birds can't begin to scratch its stalwart body. To defend itself, it spews powder.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Iron Buster
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

name: Steelix

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Metal Slash
attacks.text: Steelix can't attack during your next turn.

flavorText: Tempered underground under high pressure and heat, its body is harder than any metal.

name: Reversal Trigger
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
When the Team Plasma Pokémon this card is attached to is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

abilities.name: Duplicate
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for another Ditto and switch it with Ditto. (Any cards attached to Ditto, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) If you do, put Ditto on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Duplicate Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Ditto.

name: Challenge!
rules: Ask your opponent if he or she accepts your challenge. If your opponent declines (or if both Benches are full), draw 2 cards. If your opponent accepts, each of you searches your decks for any number of Basic Pokémon cards and puts them face down onto your Benches. (A player can't do this if his or her Bench is full.) When you both have finished, shuffle your decks and turn those cards face up.

abilities.name: Solid Shell
abilities.text: Any damage done to Anorith by attacks is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Fury Cutter
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. If 1 of them is heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage. If 2 of them are heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 30 more damage. If all of them are heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 50 more damage.

name: Shadow Rider Calyrex VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Underworld Door
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may attach a Psychic Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Benched Psychic Pokémon. If you attached Energy to a Pokémon in this way, draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Max Geist
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Psychic Energy attached to all of your Pokémon.

name: Charjabug
flavorText: Its digestive processes convert the leaves it eats into electricity. An electric sac in its belly stores the electricity for later use.

name: Spinarak

attacks.name: Spider Scram
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned. Put this Pokémon and all cards attached to it in the Lost Zone.

flavorText: Some fishermen weave its sturdy thread into nets to catch fish Pokémon.

name: Spinarak

attacks.name: Scary Face
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, until the end of your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't attack or retreat.

attacks.name: String Shot
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: It lies still in the same pose for days in its web, waiting for its unsuspecting prey to wander close.

name: Dewpider
flavorText: When two Dewpider meet, they display their water bubbles to each other. Then the one with the smaller bubble gets out of the other's way.

name: Golisopod-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: First Impression
attacks.text: If this Pokémon was on the Bench and became your Active Pokémon this turn, this attack does 90 more damage.

attacks.name: Armor Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 20 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Crossing Cut-GX
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Pikachu
rules: Oran Berry: Remove 1 damage counter from Pikachu at the end of your turn.

attacks.name: Spark
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Smoochum
rules: If your Active Pokémon is a Baby Pokémon and your opponent announces an attack, your opponent flips a coin (before doing anything else). If tails, your opponent's turn ends.

attacks.name: Energy Kiss
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Energy cards attached to the Defending Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

name: Magneton

attacks.name: Static Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Electro Ball
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

flavorText: Generates strange radio signals. It raises the temperature by 3.6 degrees Fahrenheit within 3,300 feet.

name: Bede
rules: Attach a basic Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Joltik
flavorText: They attach themselves to large-bodied Pokémon and absorb static electricity, which they store in an electric pouch.

name: Skull Fossil
rules: Play Skull Fossil as if it were a Colorless Basic Pokémon. (Skull Fossil counts as a Trainer card as well, but if Skull Fossil is Knocked Out, this counts as a Knocked Out Pokémon.) Skull Fossil can't be affected by any Special Conditions and can't retreat. At any time during your turn before your attack, you may discard Skull Fossil from play. (This doesn't count as a Knocked Out Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Skull Stone
abilities.text: During your opponent's turn, if Skull Fossil would be Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, put 1 damage counter on the Attacking Pokémon.

name: Woobat

attacks.name: Unamplified Soundwave
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) If you have any cards in your hand, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: While inside a cave, if you look up and see lots of heart-shaped marks lining the walls, it's evidence that Woobat live there.

name: Charmeleon

attacks.name: Call for Support
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Supporter card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

flavorText: My precious friend who is always with me. I have so many things I want to tell you.

abilities.name: Duplicate
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for another Ditto and switch it with Ditto. (Any cards attached to Ditto, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) If you do, put Ditto on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Duplicate Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

name: Beheeyem

attacks.name: Mysterious Noise
attacks.text: Shuffle this Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your deck. Your opponent can't play any Item cards from their hand during their next turn.

flavorText: With its psychic powers, it rewrites its opponents' memories. You, too, may have already had your memories rewritten.

name: Granbull

attacks.name: Daunt
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 20 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: Does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Granbull.

flavorText: It is timid in spite of its looks. If it becomes enraged, however, it will strike with its huge fangs.

name: Shinx

attacks.name: Jump On
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

flavorText: The extension and contraction of its muscles generates electricity. It glows when in trouble.

name: Lopunny

attacks.name: Ice Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: The ears appear to be delicate. If they are touched roughly, it kicks with its graceful legs.

name: Castform Rainy Form

abilities.name: Weather Reading
abilities.text: If you have 8 or more Stadium cards in your discard pile, ignore all Energy in this Pokémon's attack costs.

attacks.name: Rainfall
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: This is Castform's form when pelted by rain. In an experiment where it was placed in a shower, this Pokémon didn't change to this form.

name: Natu

attacks.name: Future Sight
attacks.text: Look at the top 4 cards of either player's deck and put them back in any order.

flavorText: Although it still can't fly, its jumping power is outstanding. It jumps way up into trees and plucks the buds from the branches.

name: Paras
flavorText: Whether it's due to a lack of moisture or a lack of nutrients, in Alola the mushrooms on Paras don't grow up quite right.

name: Cufant
flavorText: It digs up the ground with its trunk. It's also very strong, being able to carry loads of over five tons without any problem at all.

name: Woobat

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

flavorText: It emits ultrasonic waves as it flutters about, searching for its prey—bug Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sand Pit
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat until the end of your opponent's next turn.

name: Psyduck
flavorText: It has mystical powers but doesn't recall that it has used them. That is why it always looks puzzled.

name: Pichu

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Pikachu from your hand onto Pichu (this counts as evolving Pichu) and remove all damage counters from Pichu.

attacks.name: Chupi
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: The electric pouches on its cheeks are still small. They cannot store much electricity yet.

name: Treasure Energy
rules: As long as this card is attached to a Pokémon, it provides Colorless Energy. If you took this card as a face-down Prize card during your turn, before you put it into your hand, you may attach this card to 1 of your Pokémon.

name: Roselia

attacks.name: Petal Dance
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads. Roselia is now Confused.

flavorText: Roselia that drink nutritionally rich springwater are said to reveal rare coloration when they bloom.

attacks.name: Sudden Swipe
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, look at your opponent's hand. If he or she has any Energy cards there, choose 1 of them. Your opponent shuffles that card into his or her deck.

name: Bronzor
flavorText: Polishing Bronzor to a shine makes its surface reflect the truth, according to common lore. Be that as it may, Bronzor hates being polished.

name: Sliggoo

attacks.name: Gooey
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

flavorText: It drives away opponents by excreting a sticky liquid that can dissolve anything. Its eyes devolved, so it can't see anything.

attacks.name: Angry Horn
attacks.text: If there are 4 or more damage counters on Heracross, this attack's base damage is 50 instead of 30.

name: Seedot

attacks.name: Bide
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, if Seedot would be Knocked Out by damage from an attack, Seedot is not Knocked Out and its remaining HP becomes 10 instead.

flavorText: When it dangles from a tree branch, it looks just like an acorn. It enjoys scaring other Pokémon.

name: Glameow

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Rip Claw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

flavorText: With its sharp glare, it puts foes in a mild hypnotic state. It is a very fickle Pokémon.

name: Floette

attacks.name: Aromatherapy
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from each of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Magical Leaf
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage and heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

flavorText: When the flowers of a well-tended flower bed bloom, it appears and celebrates with an elegant dance.

name: Numel

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

flavorText: The magma in its body reaches 2,200 degrees F. Its hump gets smaller when it uses Fire-type moves.

name: Growlithe
flavorText: A Pokémon with a loyal nature, it will remain motionless until it is given an order by its Trainer.

name: Skarmory

attacks.name: Steel Wing
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

flavorText: Its body is draped in steel armor. It looks heavy, but it can fly at speeds of up to 185 miles an hour!

name: Buizel
rules: Chesto Berry: If Buizel is Asleep, remove the Special Condition Asleep from Buizel at the end of each player's turn.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 30 more damage.

name: Bellossom

attacks.name: Windmill
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Flower Tornado
attacks.text: Move as many Grass Energy attached to your Pokémon to your other Pokémon in any way you like.

flavorText: When the heavy rainfall season ends, it is drawn out by warm sunlight to dance in the open.

name: Onix

attacks.name: Rocky Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 60 damage to itself.

flavorText: It rapidly bores through the ground at 50 mph by squirming and twisting its massive, rugged body.

name: Carvanha

attacks.name: Gnaw Through
attacks.text: Discard all Pokémon Tool cards from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

flavorText: If they scent the faintest trace of blood, they rush to attack en masse. When alone, they're rather cowardly.

attacks.name: Fling
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon, if any. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

name: Dreepy

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

flavorText: After being reborn as a ghost Pokémon, Dreepy wanders the areas it used to inhabit back when it was alive in prehistoric seas.

name: Mantine

attacks.name: Borne Ashore
attacks.text: Put a Basic Pokémon from either player's discard pile onto that player's Bench.

flavorText: This calm and gentle Pokémon swims gracefully through the sea. After building speed, it can leap out of the water. It is often misidentified as a bird Pokémon due to this behavior.

name: Natu
flavorText: It picks food from cactus plants, deftly avoiding buds and spines. It seems to skip about to move.

name: Wooper

attacks.name: Yawn
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Splatter
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

flavorText: It lives in cold water, half burying itself in mud at the bottom to sleep.

name: Crawdaunt

attacks.name: Crab Impact
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

flavorText: A rough customer that wildly flails its giant claws. It is said to be extremely hard to raise.

attacks.name: Lightning Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Double Chop
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Amnesia
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

name: Riolu

attacks.name: Best Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: It's exceedingly energetic, with enough stamina to keep running all through the night. Taking it for walks can be a challenging experience.

name: Pokémon Retriever
rules: Search your discard pile for Basic Pokémon and Evolution cards. You may either show 1 Basic Pokémon or Evolution card to your opponent and put it into your hand, or show a combination of 3 Basic Pokémon or Evolution cards to your opponent and shuffle them into your deck.

name: Mime Jr.

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Mr. Mime from your hand onto Mime Jr. (this counts as evolving Mime Jr.) and remove all damage counters from Mime Jr.

attacks.name: Encore
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can use only that attack during your opponent's next turn.

flavorText: It mimics the expressions and motions of those it sees to understand the feelings of others.

name: Dark Gloom

abilities.name: Pollen Stench
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused; if tails, your Active Pokémon is now Confused. This power can't be used if Dark Gloom is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: Its pollen has such a strong smell that it even confuses itself at times.

attacks.name: Stun Spore
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Trip Over
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

name: Pokémon Center
rules: Remove all damage counters from all of your own Pokémon with damage counters on them, then discard all Energy cards attached to those Pokémon.

name: Heliolisk

attacks.name: Electrobullet
attacks.text: This attack also does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: One Heliolisk basking in the sun with its frill outspread is all it would take to produce enough electricity to power a city.

name: Mightyena

attacks.name: Ferocious Bellow
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon's attacks do 50 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

flavorText: It chases down prey in a pack of around ten. They defeat foes with perfectly coordinated teamwork.

name: Dreepy

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

flavorText: After being reborn as a ghost Pokémon, Dreepy wanders the areas it used to inhabit back when it was alive in prehistoric seas.

name: Desert Shaman
rules: You can play only 1 Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Shuffle your hand into your deck and draw up to 4 cards. Your opponent does the same.

name: Houndour

attacks.name: Roar
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Ambush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

flavorText: It is smart enough to hunt in packs. It uses a variety of cries for communicating with others.

name: Snorunt
flavorText: What a delicious-looking snowman! I think I'll sneak a bite. It's OK…no one's looking, right?

name: Hitmontop

attacks.name: Spinning Draw
attacks.text: Draw a card.

flavorText: It launches kicks while spinning. If it spins at high speed, it may bore its way into the ground.

name: Dusclops

attacks.name: Dark One-eye
attacks.text: You may discard a card from your hand. If you do, your opponent discards a card from his or her hand.

attacks.name: Ambush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage.

flavorText: Its body is hollow. It is said that those who look into its body are sucked into the void.

name: Kricketune

attacks.name: Improvisational Performance
attacks.text: If you have exactly 1 card in your hand, this attack does 100 more damage. If you have exactly 3 cards in your hand, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused. If you have exactly 6 cards in your hand, this attack does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: It crosses its knifelike arms in front of its chest when it cries. It can compose melodies ad lib.

attacks.name: Recover
attacks.text: Discard a Psychic Energy attached to Alakazam E4 and remove 4 damage counters from Alakazam E4.

attacks.name: Mysterious Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

name: Xatu

attacks.name: Fortunate Draw
attacks.text: You and your opponent play Rock-Paper-Scissors. The player who wins draws 3 cards. The player who loses discards the top 3 cards of his or her deck.

attacks.name: Miracle Wing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

flavorText: This odd Pokémon can see both the past and the future. It eyes the sun's movement all day.

name: Totodile

attacks.name: Shining Fang
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

flavorText: It has the habit of biting anything with its developed jaws. Even its Trainer need to be careful.

name: Psyduck

attacks.name: Delusion
attacks.text: If Psyduck is Confused, draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Migraine
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused. If tails, Psyduck is now Confused.

flavorText: If its usual headache worsens, its starts exhibiting odd powers. It can't remember doing so, however.

name: Azelf LV.X
rules: Put this card onto your Active Azelf. Azelf LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

abilities.name: Psychic Aura
abilities.text: Each of your Psychic Pokémon has no Weakness.

attacks.name: Deep Balance
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. Put 1 damage counter on that Pokémon for each Energy attached to all of your opponent's Pokémon.

name: Kecleon

abilities.name: Camouflage
abilities.text: If any basic Energy card attached to Kecleon is the same as the Attacking Pokémon's type, any damage done by attacks from the Pokémon to Kecleon is reduced by 40 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Blind Scratch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does no damage to the Defending Pokémon. Instead, this attack does 20 damage to 1 of your Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: It can freely change its body's color. The zigzag pattern on its belly doesn't change, however.

attacks.name: Granite Head
attacks.text: Damage done to Shelgon by an opponent's attack is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance) during your opponent's next turn.

name: Rare Candy
rules: Choose 1 of your Basic Pokémon in play. If you have a Stage 1 or Stage 2 card that evolves from that Pokémon in your hand, put that card on the Basic Pokémon. (This counts as evolving that Pokémon.)

name: Wingull
flavorText: It makes its nest on steep sea cliffs. Riding updrafts, it soars to great heights.

name: Lillipup

attacks.name: Work Up
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's attacks do 20 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

flavorText: Because it doesn't yelp, it's extremely popular with Trainers who live in apartment buildings.

name: Sidney's Stadium
rules: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.
Each player's Darkness Pokémon can't be Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

name: Applin

attacks.name: Withdraw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks.

flavorText: It spends its entire life inside an apple. It hides from its natural enemies, bird Pokémon, by pretending it's just an apple and nothing more.

name: Potion
rules: Remove 2 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon (1 if that Pokémon has only 1).

name: Energy Restore
rules: Flip 3 coins. For each heads, put a basic Energy card from your discard pile into your hand. If you don't have that many basic Energy cards in your discard pile, put all of them into your hand.

attacks.name: Alert
attacks.text: Draw a card. Then, switch Brock's Zubat with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. You can't use this attack if your Bench is empty.

name: Cubone

attacks.name: Whimsy Tackle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: It always wears the skull of its dead mother, so no one has any idea what its hidden face looks like.

name: Unown W

abilities.name: WALL
abilities.text: As long as Unown W is your Active Pokémon, any damage done to your Pokémon by an opponent's attack is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Hidden Power
attacks.text: Draw a card.

flavorText: Shaped like an ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or Unown came first.

attacks.name: Rest
attacks.text: Remove all Special Conditions and 5 damage counters (all if there are less than 5) from Lairon. Lairon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Sableye

attacks.name: Tight Jaw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: It hides in the darkness of caves. Its diet of gems has transformed its eyes into gemstones.

attacks.name: Nightmare
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Mind Shock
attacks.text: Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.

attacks.name: Spark
attacks.text: Choose 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to each of those Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Dusclops

attacks.name: Fade to Black
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

flavorText: Its body is entirely hollow. When it opens its mouth, it sucks everything in as if it were a black hole.

name: Rookidee

attacks.name: Pluck
attacks.text: Before doing damage, discard all Pokémon Tools from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

flavorText: It will bravely challenge any opponent, no matter how powerful. This Pokémon benefits from every battle—even a defeat increases its strength a bit.

name: Growlithe
flavorText: While it's quite friendly toward humans once it's grown used to them, in the wild it must be quite fierce to defend its territory from Rockruff.

name: Simipour

attacks.name: Scald
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: The high-pressure water expelled from its tail is so powerful, it can destroy a concrete wall.

name: Zubat

attacks.name: Spiral Drain
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

flavorText: It does not need eyes, because it emits ultrasonic waves to check its surrounding while it flies.

name: Tauros

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Berserker Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

flavorText: They live in groups. The one with the longest, thickest, and most-scarred horns is the boss of the herd.

name: Magikarp

attacks.name: Epic Splash
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If either of them is tails, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: In the distant past, it was somewhat stronger than the horribly weak descendants that exist today.

name: M Audino-EX
rules: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.
Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Magical Symphony
attacks.text: If you played a Supporter card from your hand during this turn, this attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Full Heal
rules: Remove all Special Conditions from your Active Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Tympole

attacks.name: Flail Around
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

flavorText: By vibrating its cheeks, it emits sound waves imperceptible to humans and warns others of danger.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

name: Professor Rowan
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Choose 1 card in your hand and shuffle the rest of your cards into your deck. Then, draw 4 cards. (If this is the only card in your hand, you can't play this card.)

name: Kricketot

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

flavorText: It chats with others using the sounds of its colliding antennae. These sounds are fall hallmarks.

name: Pokémon Catcher
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with his or her Active Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Silcoon

attacks.name: String Shot
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: It drinks dew that collects on its silk and waits for evolution. Its hard cocoon repels attacks.

name: Prof. Oak's Research
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Shuffle your hand into your deck, then draw 5 cards.

name: Kangaskhan

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Comet Punch
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: It raises its offspring in its belly pouch. It lets the baby play only when it feels safe.

name: Mystery Plate δ
rules: Attach this card to 1 of your Pokémon in play. That Pokémon may use this card's attack instead of its own. At the end of your turn, discard Mystery Plate δ.

attacks.name: Healing Oasis
attacks.text: If your opponent has 5 or more Prizes, search your deck for up to 3 basic Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. If your opponent has exactly 2 Prizes, remove all damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon.

name: Pawniard

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

flavorText: It uses river stones to maintain the cutting edges of the blades covering its body. These sharpened blades allow it to bring down opponents.

name: Ursaring

attacks.name: Drag Off
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with his or her Active Pokémon. This attack does 50 damage to the new Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Swing Around
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 more damage for each heads.

flavorText: Although it has a large body, it is quite skilled at climbing trees. It eats and sleeps in the treetops.

name: Pikachu

attacks.name: Thunder Jolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Pikachu does 10 damage to itself.

flavorText: When several of these Pokémon gather, their electricity can cause lightning storms.

name: Lillipup

attacks.name: Work Up
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's attacks do 20 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

flavorText: Because it doesn't yelp, it's extremely popular with Trainers who live in apartment buildings.

name: Garbodor

attacks.name: Poison Gas
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: The toxic liquid it launches from its right arm is so virulent that it can kill a weakened creature instantly.

attacks.name: Self Charge
attacks.text: Attach an Energy card from your hand to Team Aqua's Electrike.

name: N
rules: Each player shuffles his or her hand into his or her deck. Then, each player draws a card for each of his or her remaining Prize cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

name: Slakoth

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Slakoth.

attacks.name: Slack Off
attacks.text: Remove all damage counters from Slakoth. Slakoth can't attack during your next turn.

flavorText: It spends nearly all its time in a day sprawled out. Just seeing it makes one drowsy.

attacks.name: Double Stab
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: Rhyhorn does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Sound Waves
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Flitter
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.)

name: Tepig
flavorText: It loves to eat roasted berries, but sometimes it gets too excited and burns them to a crisp.

name: Ivysaur

abilities.name: Evolutionary Pollen
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you play Ivysaur from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may use this power. Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

flavorText: When the bud on its back starts swelling, a sweet aroma wafts to indicate the flower's coming bloom.

name: Timer Ball
rules: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, search your deck for an Evolution Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Pikachu

attacks.name: Growl
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 20 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Numb
attacks.text: If Pikachu evolved from Pichu during this turn, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: If it looses crackling power from the electric pouches on its cheeks, it is being wary.

name: Magneton

attacks.name: Thunder Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Removal Pulse
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

flavorText: It is actually three Magnemite linked by magnetism. A group can set off a magnetic storm.

name: Eevee

attacks.name: Growl
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 20 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

flavorText: Thanks to its unstable genetic makeup, this special Pokémon conceals many different possible evolutions.

name: Kabuto

abilities.name: Revive Friends
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a card named Kabuto and put it on your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. Treat the new Kabuto as a Basic Pokémon. This power can't be used if Kabuto is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed (or if your Bench is full).

attacks.name: Work Together
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Omanyte, Omastar, Kabuto, and Kabutops on your Bench.

flavorText: On rare occasions, some have been found as fossils which they became while hiding on the ocean floor.

name: Golett

attacks.name: Rock Smash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

flavorText: The energy that burns inside it enables it to move, but no one has yet been able to identify this energy.

name: Bronzor

attacks.name: Dull Light
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

flavorText: Implements shaped like it were discovered in ancient tombs. It is unknown if they are related.

name: Geodude

attacks.name: Stone Barrage
