attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: At rest, it looks just like a rock. Carelessly stepping on it will make it swing its fists angrily.

name: Palpitoad

attacks.name: Suspicious Soundwave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

flavorText: It lives in the water and on land. It uses its long, sticky tongue to immobilize its opponents.

name: Bergmite

attacks.name: Ice Block
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

flavorText: Using air of -150 degrees Fahrenheit, they freeze opponents solid. They live in herds above the snow line on mountains.

name: Cubchoo
flavorText: When this Pokémon is in good health, its snot becomes thicker and stickier. It will smear its snot on anyone it doesn't like.

name: Minun

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Tag Team Boost
attacks.text: If Plusle is on your Bench, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

flavorText: Exposure to electricity from Minun and Plusle promotes blood circulation and relaxes muscles.

name: Bunnelby
flavorText: They use their large ears to dig burrows. They will dig the whole night through.

name: Professor Elm's Training Method
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Search your deck for an Evolution card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Poison Fang
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

name: Poké Ball
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, you may search your deck for any Basic Pokémon or Evolution card. Show that card to your opponent, then put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

name: Thievul

abilities.name: Baffling
abilities.text: If your opponent has 2 or fewer Prize cards remaining, whenever your opponent plays a Supporter card from their hand, prevent all effects of that card done to your Benched Pokémon V.

flavorText: It secretly marks potential targets with a scent. By following the scent, it stalks its targets and steals from them when they least expect it.

name: Drifloon
flavorText: Its round body is stuffed with souls and expands each time it leads someone away.

name: Caterpie

attacks.name: Flock
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Caterpie and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

flavorText: Its short feet are tipped with suction pads that enable it to tirelessly climb slopes and walls.

name: Poliwhirl

attacks.name: Finishing Blow
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 50 more damage.

flavorText: It can live in or out of water. When out of water, it constantly sweats to keep its body slimy.

name: Torracat

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

flavorText: At its throat, it bears a bell of fire. The bell rings brightly whenever this Pokémon spits fire.

name: Hitmontop

attacks.name: Spinning Draw
attacks.text: Draw a card.

flavorText: It launches kicks while spinning. If it spins at high speed, it may bore its way into the ground.

name: Spearow

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: It flaps its small wings busily to fly. Using its beak, it searches in grass for prey.

name: Metapod

attacks.name: Stiffen
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Metapod during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

attacks.name: Stun Spore
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: It is vulnerable to attack because its shell is soft, exposing its weak and tender body.

name: Pikachu

attacks.name: Thunder Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: A plan was recently announced to gather many Pikachu and make an electric power plant.

abilities.name: Clear Body
abilities.text: Regirock can't be affected by any Special Conditions.

attacks.name: Rock Slide
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Dark Electrode

attacks.name: Energy Bomb
attacks.text: Take all Energy cards attached to Dark Electrode and attach them to your Benched Pokémon (in any way you choose). If you have no Benched Pokémon, discard all Energy cards attached to Dark Electrode.

flavorText: Some researchers hypothesize that Electrode may actually be a form of energy instead of having an actual body.

name: Koffing

attacks.name: Foul Odor
attacks.text: Both Active Pokémon are now Confused.

flavorText: Its thin, balloon-like body is inflated by horribly toxic gases. It reeks when it is nearby.

name: Alolan Rattata
flavorText: When the sun goes down, it becomes active. It runs around town on a chase for good food for the boss of its nest—Raticate.

abilities.name: Dense Body
abilities.text: Any damage done to Slowbro by attacks from Basic Pokémon (excluding Baby Pokémon) is reduced by 20.

attacks.name: Energy Cannon
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage plus 10 damage for each Energy attached to Slowbro but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

name: Galarian Ponyta

attacks.name: Psy Bolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: This Pokémon will look into your eyes and read the contents of your heart. If it finds evil there, it promptly hides away.

name: Devolution Spray
rules: Devolve 1 of your evolved Pokémon and put the highest Stage Evolution card on it into your hand. (That Pokémon can't evolve this turn.)
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Sneasel

attacks.name: Double Slap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Feint Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokémon.

flavorText: It feeds on eggs stolen from nests. Its sharply hooked claws rip vulnerable spots on prey.

name: Baltoy
flavorText: It moves while spinning around on its single foot. Some Baltoy have been seen spinning on their heads.

name: Turtwig

attacks.name: Nap
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

flavorText: The shell on its back is made of soil. On a very healthy Turtwig, the shell should feel moist.

name: Chansey

attacks.name: Nap
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Lucky Punch
attacks.text: If you don't have exactly 7 cards in your hand, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: It is said to deliver happiness. Being compassionate, it shares its egg with injured people.

name: Growlithe

attacks.name: Stoke
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Fire Energy card and attach it to Growlithe. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: Growlithe does 10 damage to itself.

flavorText: A Pokémon with a loyal nature. It will remain motionless until it is given an order by its Trainer.

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Tremor
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your own Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Honedge

attacks.name: Cut Down
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

flavorText: If anyone dares to grab its hilt, it wraps a blue cloth around that person's arm and drains that person's life energy completely.

attacks.name: Evil Eye
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. Put a damage counter on that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Blindside
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon that has a damage counter on it. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.

attacks.name: Nap
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters from Seedot.

attacks.name: Double Spin
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 times the number of heads.

name: Zygarde

attacks.name: Rumble
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Raging Blade
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any damage counters on it, this attack does 60 more damage.

flavorText: It's thought to be monitoring the ecosystem. There are rumors that even greater power lies hidden within it.

name: Hitmonlee

attacks.name: Gut Kick
attacks.text: If Tyrogue is anywhere under Hitmonlee, you may do 30 damage to any 1 Benched Pokémon instead. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: Its legs can stretch double. First-time foes are startled by its extensible reach.

name: Minccino
flavorText: The way it brushes away grime with its tail can be helpful when cleaning. But its focus on spotlessness can make cleaning more of a hassle.

name: Skitty

attacks.name: Double Slap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: It shows its cute side by chasing its own tail until it gets dizzy.

attacks.name: Long Tongue
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon in play. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Cherubi
flavorText: The deeper a Cherubi's red, the more nutrients it has stockpiled in its body. And the sweeter and tastier its small ball!

name: Cherubi

attacks.name: Leech Seed
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

flavorText: The small ball is not only filled with nutrients, it is also tasty. Starly try to peck it off.

name: Swinub

attacks.name: Double Headbutt
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: Rooting the tip of its snout into the ground, it searches for food. Sometimes, it even digs up a hot spring.

name: Energy Flow
rules: For each of your Pokémon, you may return any number of Energy cards attached to it to your hand.

name: Pikachu

attacks.name: Mega Shot
attacks.text: Discard all Lightning Energy attached to Pikachu and then choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: It occasionally uses an electric shock to recharge a fellow Pikachu that is in a weakened state.

name: Shellder

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Hide in Shell
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Shellder during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

flavorText: Its hard shell repels any kind of attack. It is vulnerable only when its shell is open.

name: Twin Energy
rules: As long as this card is attached to a Pokémon that isn't a Pokémon V or a Pokémon-GX, it provides ColorlessColorless Energy.
If this card is attached to a Pokémon V or a Pokémon-GX, it provides Colorless Energy instead.

name: Oranguru

abilities.name: Instruct
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may draw cards until you have 3 cards in your hand.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage times the amount of Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

flavorText: Deep in the jungle, high in the lofty canopy, this Pokémon abides. On rare occasions, it shows up at the beach to match wits with Slowking.

name: Impostor Professor Oak
rules: Your opponent shuffles his or her hand into his or her deck, then draws 7 cards.

name: Galvantula

attacks.name: Electroweb
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Leech Life
attacks.text: Heal from this Pokémon the same amount of damage you did to the Defending Pokémon.

flavorText: They employ an electrically charged web to trap their prey. While it is immobilized by shock, they leisurely consume it.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

name: Polteageist

abilities.name: Tea Break
abilities.text: You must discard a Pokémon that has the Mad Party attack from your hand in order to use this Ability. Once during your turn, you may draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Mad Party
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each Pokémon in your discard pile that has the Mad Party attack.

flavorText: This species lives in antique teapots. Most pots are forgeries, but on rare occasions, an authentic work is found.

name: Metal Energy
rules: Damage done by attacks to the Pokémon that Metal Energy attached to is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). Ignore this effect if the Pokémon that Metal Energy is attached to isn't Metal. Metal Energy provides Metal Energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

name: Hisuian Basculin

attacks.name: Gather the Crew
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

flavorText: Though it differs from other Basculin in several respects, including demeanor—this one is gentle—I have categorized it as a regional form given the vast array of shared qualities.

name: Twist Mountain
rules: Once during each player's turn, that player may flip a coin. If heads, that player may play a Restored Pokémon from their hand onto their Bench.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

attacks.name: 3-Pronged Tail
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Full Speed Charge
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads to the Defending Pokémon and 20 damage times the number of tails to Blaine's Tauros.

name: Treecko

attacks.name: Tail Crush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage.

flavorText: The soles of its feet are covered by countless tiny spikes, enabling it to walk on walls and ceilings.

name: Unown

abilities.name: DARK
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you put Unown from your hand onto your Bench, you may search your deck for a Darkness Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

flavorText: Their shapes look like hieroglyphs on ancient tablets. It is said that the two are somehow related.

name: Wishiwashi

abilities.name: Schooling
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may switch this Pokémon with a Wishiwashi-GX in your hand. Any attached cards, damage counters, Special Conditions, turns in play, and any other effects remain on the new Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sharpshooting
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: When it's in trouble, its eyes moisten and begin to shine. The shining light attracts its comrades, and they stand together against their enemies.

name: Ambipom

attacks.name: Furry Chance
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck. If that card is an Energy card, this attack does 60 more damage.

attacks.name: Double Hit
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: To eat, it deftly shucks nuts with its two tails. It rarely uses its arms now.

name: Blastoise-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Rapid Spin
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. Then, your opponent switches his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Splash Bomb
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Disable
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

name: Energy Search
rules: Search your deck for a basic Energy card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Squirtle

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Withdraw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Squirtle during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of opponent's attacks still happen.)

flavorText: After birth, its back swells and hardens into a shell. It powerfully sprays foam from its mouth.

name: Amulet Coin
rules: Attach Amulet Coin to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it. If that Pokémon is Knocked Out, discard this card.
If the Pokémon Amulet Coin is attached to is your Active Pokémon at the end of your turn, draw a card.

name: Piplup

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: Because it is very proud, it hates accepting food from people. Its thick down guards it from cold.

name: Weezing

abilities.name: Detention Gas
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Basic Pokémon between turns.

attacks.name: Splattering Sludge
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: If one of the twin Koffing inflates, the other one deflates. It constantly mixes its poisonous gases.

name: Gossifleur
flavorText: It whirls around in the wind while singing a joyous song. This delightful display has charmed many into raising this Pokémon.

name: Clefable

attacks.name: Metronome
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. Metronome copies that attack except for its Energy costs and anything else required in order to use that attack, such as discarding Energy cards. (No matter what type the Defending Pokémon is, Clefable's type is still Colorless.)

attacks.name: Minimize
attacks.text: All damage done by attacks to Clefable during your opponent's next turn is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

flavorText: A timid Fairy Pokémon that is rarely seen. It will run and hide the moment it senses people.

attacks.name: Razor Wind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Dig Deep
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for an Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand.

name: Pokémon Center Lady
rules: Heal 60 damage and remove all Special Conditions from 1 of your Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Corphish.

name: Rare Candy
rules: Choose 1 of your Basic Pokémon in play. If you have a Stage 1 or Stage 2 card that evolves from that Pokémon in your hand, put that card on the Basic Pokémon. (This counts as evolving that Pokémon.) If you choose a Stage 2 Pokémon in your hand, put that Pokémon on the Basic Pokémon instead of on a Stage 1 Pokémon.

name: Honchkrow

attacks.name: Hypnoblast
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Nightmare Mambo
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Asleep, this attack does 60 more damage.

flavorText: If one utters a deep cry, many Murkrow gather quickly. For this, it is called "Summoner of Night."

name: Dewott

attacks.name: Razor Shell
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

flavorText: As a result of strict training, each Dewott learns different forms for using the scalchops.

attacks.name: Poison Sludge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

name: Scorbunny
flavorText: A warm-up of running around gets fire energy coursing through this Pokémon's body. Once that happens, it's ready to fight at full power.

name: Hoppip

abilities.name: Cottonweed
abilities.text: If Hoppip has any Grass Energy attached to it, the Retreat Cost for Hoppip is 0.

attacks.name: Hover Heal
attacks.text: Remove all Special Conditions from Hoppip.

flavorText: It drifts on winds. It is said that when HOPPIP gather in fields and mountains, spring is on the way.

name: Pikachu

attacks.name: Double Voltage
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: It occasionally uses an electric shock to recharge a fellow Pikachu that is in a weakened state.

name: Gligar

attacks.name: Stun Poison
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned.

flavorText: It flies straight at its target's face then clamps down on the startled victim to inject poison.

name: Kahili
rules: Draw 2 cards. Then, flip a coin. If heads, if you played this Kahili from your hand, put this card into your hand instead of the discard pile. If you have no cards in your deck, you can't play this card.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

name: Impostor Professor Oak
rules: Your opponent shuffles his or her hand into his or her deck, then draws 7 cards.

name: Trubbish

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Super Poison Breath
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: This Pokémon was born from a bag stuffed with trash. Galarian Weezing relish the fumes belched by Trubbish.

name: Indeedee V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Watch Over
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may heal 20 damage from your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: This attack does 60 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Nap
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from Jigglypuff.

attacks.name: Lullaby
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Burrow
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done by attacks to Diglett during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

name: Cosmog
flavorText: Even though its helpless, gaseous body can be blown away by the slightest breeze, it doesn't seem to care.

name: Noctowl

attacks.name: Hypnoblast
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Night Raid
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand. Discard a Pokémon from it.

flavorText: Its eyes are specially adapted. They concentrate even faint light and enable it to see in the dark.

name: Bastiodon

abilities.name: Protective Wall
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to your Benched Pokémon by your opponent's attacks.

attacks.name: Anger Revenge
attacks.text: If Bastiodon was damaged by an attack during your opponent's last turn, this attack does 40 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: Any frontal attack is repulsed. It is a docile Pokémon that feeds on grass and berries.

attacks.name: Aqua Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage.

name: Memory Energy
rules: This card provides Colorless Energy.
The Pokémon this card is attached to can use any attack from its previous Evolutions. (You still need the necessary Energy to use each attack.)

name: Golett
flavorText: Ancient science fashioned this Pokémon from clay. It's been active for thousands of years.

name: Tag Switch
rules: Move up to 2 Energy from 1 of your TAG TEAM Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Gust of Wind
rules: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch it with his or her Active Pokémon.

name: PlusPower
rules: Attach PlusPower to 1 of your Pokémon. Discard this card at the end of your turn.
If the Pokémon PlusPower is attached to attacks, the attack does 10 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Scrafty

attacks.name: Dangerous Head
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Basic Pokémon, this attack does 50 more damage.

flavorText: It pulls up its shed skin to protect itself while it kicks. The bigger the crest, the more respected it is.

name: Amoonguss

attacks.name: Astonish
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose a random card from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals that cards and shuffles it into his or her deck.

attacks.name: Miracle Powder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose a Special Condition. The Defending Pokémon is now affected by that Special Condition.

flavorText: It moves the caps on both arms and does a dance to lure prey. It prefers damp places.

name: Turtwig
flavorText: Made from soil, the shell on its back hardens when it drinks water. It lives along lakes.

name: Pikipek

attacks.name: Send Back
attacks.text: Your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

flavorText: This Pokémon feeds on berries, whose leftover seeds become the ammunition for attacks it fires off from its mouth.

name: Arcanine

abilities.name: Warming Up
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has a Burning Scarf attached, it gets +100 HP.

flavorText: The sight of it running over 6,200 miles in a single day and night has captivated many people.

name: Primeape

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Tantrum
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Primeape is now Confused (after doing damage).

flavorText: Always furious and tenacious to boot. It will not abandon chasing its quarry until its quarry is caught.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Surskit during your opponent's next turn.

name: Pachirisu

attacks.name: Snuggly Generator
attacks.text: For each of your Benched Pokémon that has the Nuzzle attack, search your deck for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to that Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Nuzzle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: A pair may be seen rubbing their cheek pouches together in an effort to share stored electricity.

name: Golett
flavorText: Ancient science fashioned this Pokémon from clay. It's been active for thousands of years.

attacks.name: Leech Seed
attacks.text: If this attack damages the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), remove 1 damage counter from Venusaur, if it has any.

attacks.name: Fury Strikes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

name: Collapsed Stadium
rules: Each player can't have more than 4 Benched Pokémon. If a player has 5 or more Benched Pokémon, they discard Benched Pokémon until they have 4 Pokémon on the Bench. The player who played this card discards first. If more than one effect changes the number of Benched Pokémon allowed, use the smaller number.

name: Gossifleur

attacks.name: Blot
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

flavorText: It whirls around in the wind while singing a joyous song. This delightful display has charmed many into raising this Pokémon.

name: Surskit

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: When this Pokémon senses danger, a sweet fluid oozes from the tip of its head. The taste of it disgusts bird Pokémon.

name: Revitalizer
rules: Put 2 Grass Pokémon from your discard pile into your hand.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Helioptile
flavorText: The frills on either side of its head have cells that generate electricity when exposed to sunlight.

name: Welcoming Lantern
rules: Put a Single Strike Supporter card from your discard pile into your hand.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Venture Bomb
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, put 1 damage counter on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. If tails, put 1 damage counter on 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Bind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Rock Smash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Spark
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Floatzel GL LV.X
rules: Put this card onto your Active Floatzel GL. Floatzel GL LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

abilities.name: Water Rescue
abilities.text: Whenever any of your Water Pokémon (excluding any Floatzel GL) is Knocked Out by damage from your opponent's attack, you may put that Pokémon and all cards that were attached to it from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Energy Cyclone
attacks.text: Choose as many Energy cards from your hand as you like and show them to your opponent. This attack does 20 damage times the number of Energy cards you chose. Put those Energy cards on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Mothim

abilities.name: Wormadam First
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your Wormadam to another of your Pokémon.

flavorText: It flutters around at night and steals honey from the Combee hive.

name: Zoroark

attacks.name: Corner
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Night Claw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard 2 Energy attached to this Pokémon.

flavorText: Each has the ability to fool a large group of people simultaneously. They protect their lair with illusory scenery.

attacks.name: Tail Whip
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

name: Honedge

attacks.name: Metal Sound
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

flavorText: If anyone dares to grab its hilt, it wraps a blue cloth around that person's arm and drains that person's life energy completely.

name: Crossceiver
rules: You must play 2 Crossceiver cards at once. (This effect works one time for 2 cards.)
Put a Pokémon or a Supporter card from your discard pile into your hand.
Item rule: You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Natu

ancientTrait.name: Δ Plus
ancientTrait.text: If your opponent's Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from an attack of this Pokémon, take 1 more Prize card.

attacks.name: Psywave
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage times the amount of Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

flavorText: It usually forages for food on the ground but may, on rare occasions, hop onto branches to peck at shoots.

attacks.name: Mischief
attacks.text: Shuffle your opponent's deck.

name: Sandile

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

flavorText: It submerges itself in sand and moves as if swimming. This wise behavior keeps its enemies from finding it and maintains its temperature.

name: Combee

attacks.name: Sting Missile
attacks.text: Shuffle this Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your deck.

flavorText: This Pokémon is a set of three. When they sleep, they gather up and form a giant hive of 100 Combee.

name: Gastly

attacks.name: Fade Out
attacks.text: Put this Pokémon and all attached cards into your hand.

flavorText: Born from gases, anyone would faint if engulfed by its gaseous body, which contains poison.

name: Cubone

attacks.name: Burdensome Bone
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

flavorText: The skull it wears on its head is that of its dead mother. According to some, it will evolve when it comes to terms with the pain of her death.

name: Unidentified Fossil
rules: Play this card as if it were a 60-HP Colorless Basic Pokémon. At any time during your turn (before your attack), you may discard this card from play.
This card can't retreat.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Energy Search
rules: Search your deck for a basic Energy card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Sigilyph

attacks.name: Joust
attacks.text: Before doing damage, discard all Pokémon Tools from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Reflect Energy
attacks.text: Move an Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

flavorText: A discovery was made in the desert where Sigilyph fly. The ruins of what may have been an ancient city were found beneath the sands.

name: Poliwag

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

flavorText: The direction of its belly spiral differs by area. The equator is thought to have an effect on this.

name: Team Flare Grunt
rules: Discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

name: Recover Energy
rules: Recover Energy provides Colorless Energy. When you attach this card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon, remove all Special Conditions from that Pokémon.

name: Sparkling Robe
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
The Pokémon this card is attached to can't be affected by any Special Conditions. (Remove any Special Conditions affecting that Pokémon.)
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Electabuzz from your hand onto Elekid (this counts as evolving Elekid) and remove all damage counters from Elekid.

attacks.name: Thunder Spear
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Cyclone Energy
rules: This card provides Colorless Energy. When you play this card from your hand and attach it to your Active Pokémon, your opponent switches his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

name: Bellsprout

attacks.name: Vine Bind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't use any Poké-Powers during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Careless Tackle
attacks.text: Bellsprout does 10 damage to itself.

flavorText: It prefers hot and humid environments. It is quick at capturing prey with its vines.

name: Hoppip

attacks.name: Multiply
attacks.text: Search your deck for Hoppip and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

flavorText: It drifts on winds. It is said that when Hoppip gather in fields and mountains, spring is on the way.

name: Pikipek

attacks.name: Send Back
attacks.text: Your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

flavorText: This Pokémon feeds on berries, whose leftover seeds become the ammunition for attacks it fires off from its mouth.

name: Meowth

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: It is nocturnal in nature. If it spots something shiny, its eyes glitter brightly.

name: Staryu

attacks.name: Bubblebeam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: At night, the center of its body slowly flickers with the same rhythm as a human heartbeat.

name: Venonat

attacks.name: Stun Spore
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Signal Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

flavorText: Its big eyes are actually clusters of tiny eyes. At nights, its kind is drawn by light.

name: Magneton

attacks.name: Zap Cannon
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Zap Cannon during your next turn.

flavorText: It has about three times the electrical power of Magnemite. For some reason, outbreaks of this Pokémon happen when lots of sunspots appear.

attacks.name: Thunder Spear
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Magnetic Tackle
attacks.text: You may do 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each Lightning Energy attached to Manetric. If you do, Manetric does 10 damage to itself.

name: Seadra

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Seadra but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Seadra.

flavorText: Capable of swimming backward by rapidly flapping its wing-like pectoral fins and stout tail.

name: Crystal Shard
rules: Attach Crystal Shard to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it. If that Pokémon is Knocked Out, discard this card.
As long as this card is attached to a Pokémon, that Pokémon's type (color) is Colorless. If that Pokémon attacks, discard this card at the end of the turn.

name: Dwebble
flavorText: It makes a hole in a suitable rock. If that rock breaks, the Pokémon remains agitated until it locates a replacement.

name: Luxray

attacks.name: Snarl
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

flavorText: Luxray's ability to see through objects comes in handy when it's scouting for danger.

name: Farfetch'd

attacks.name: Leek Slap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. Either way, you can't use this attack again as long as Farfetch'd stays in play (even putting Farfetch'd on the Bench won't let you use it again).

flavorText: The sprig of green onions it holds is its weapon. This sprig is used much like a metal sword.

name: Vitality Band
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached.
The attacks of the Pokémon this card is attached to do 10 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Cursed Stone
rules: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.
At any time between turns, each player puts 1 damage counter on his or her Pokémon that has a Poké-Power.

name: Sewaddle

abilities.name: Swaddling Leaves
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 10 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: This Pokémon makes clothes for itself. It chews up leaves and sews them with sticky thread extruded from its mouth.

name: Timburr

attacks.name: Pummel
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

flavorText: It fights by swinging a piece of lumber around. It is close to evolving when it can handle the lumber without difficulty.

name: Scatterbug
flavorText: When under attack from bird Pokémon, it spews a poisonous black powder that causes paralysis on contact.

attacks.name: Mid-air Crush
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent discards 1 Energy card, if any, attached to that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Nosedive
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Swellow does 10 damage to itself.

name: Hyper Potion
rules: Heal 120 damage from 1 of your Pokémon that has at least 2 Energy attached. If you healed any damage in this way, discard 2 Energy from it.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Weedle

attacks.name: Rescue String
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for up to 5 Pokémon, show them to your opponent, and shuffle them into your deck.

attacks.name: Needling Sting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

flavorText: It eats its weight in leaves every day. It fends off attackers with the needle on its head.

name: Exp. Share
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
When your Active Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, you may move 1 basic Energy card that was attached to that Pokémon to the Pokémon this card is attached to.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Pichu

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Pikachu from your hand onto Pichu (this counts as evolving Pichu) and remove all damage counters from Pichu.

attacks.name: Electric Circuit
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for up to 4 Lightning Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand.

flavorText: The electric pouches on its cheeks are still small. They cannot store much electricity yet.

name: Vaporeon

attacks.name: Spiral Drain
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters from Vaporeon.

attacks.name: Dual Splash
attacks.text: Choose 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: When Vaporeon's fins begin to vibrate, it is a sign that rain will come within a few hours.

attacks.name: Double Damage
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Horn Rush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Jolteon V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Thunder Spear
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Pin Missile
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 60 damage for each heads.

name: Energy Switch
rules: Move a basic Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.

name: Drowzee

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

flavorText: It can tell what people are dreaming by sniffing with its big nose. It loves fun dreams.

name: Drednaw

attacks.name: Vise Wave
attacks.text: If you played Nessa from your hand during this turn, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: With jaws that can shear through steel rods, this highly aggressive Pokémon chomps down on its unfortunate prey.

name: Crustle

attacks.name: Heavy Bullet
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: It possesses legs of enormous strength, enabling it to carry heavy slabs for many days, even when crossing arid land.

name: Fieldworker
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Draw 3 cards. Your opponent may also draw a card.

abilities.name: Temperamental Weather
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for Sunny Castform, Rain Castform, or Snow-cloud Castform and switch it with Castform. (Any cards attached to Castform, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) Shuffle Castform back into your deck. You can't use more than 1 Temperamental Weather Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Forecast
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Stadium card and play it. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Extra Ball
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Pokémon-ex, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

name: Bulbasaur
flavorText: For some time after its birth, it grows by gaining nourishment from the seed on its back.

attacks.name: Thunder Jolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Charmeleon does 10 damage to itself.

name: Watchog

attacks.name: Hypnoblast
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Psych Up
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Psych Up attack does 30 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

flavorText: Using luminescent matter, it makes its eyes and body glow and stuns attacking opponents.

name: Larvitar
flavorText: Born deep underground, it comes aboveground and becomes a pupa once it has finished eating the surrounding soil.

name: Trubbish

attacks.name: Venoshock
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Poisoned, this attack does 50 more damage.

flavorText: Its favorite places are unsanitary ones. If you leave trash lying around, you could even find one of these Pokémon living in your room.

name: Rowlet
flavorText: This wary Pokémon uses photosynthesis to store up energy during the day, while becoming active at night.

name: PlusPower
rules: Attach PlusPower to 1 of your Pokémon. Discard this card at the end of your turn.
If the Pokémon PlusPower is attached to attacks, the attack does 10 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Meowth

attacks.name: Pay Day
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, draw a card.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: It is nocturnal in nature. If it spots something shiny, its eyes glitter brightly.

name: Energy Removal
rules: Choose 1 Energy card attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon and discard it.

name: Gligar

attacks.name: Double Shot
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: It usually clings to cliffs. When it spots its prey, it spreads its wings and glides down to attack.

name: Pikachu

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Pikachu.

flavorText: It raises its tail to check its surroundings. The tail is sometimes struck by lightning in this pose.

attacks.name: Split Bomb
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Cacnea

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: By storing water in its body, this desert dweller can survive for 30 days without water.

name: Avery
rules: Draw 3 cards. If you drew any cards in this way, your opponent discards Pokémon from their Bench until they have 3.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Reset Stamp
rules: Your opponent shuffles their hand into their deck and draws a card for each of their remaining Prize cards.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Revive
rules: Put a Basic Pokémon from your discard pile onto your Bench.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Silver Bangle
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
The attacks of the Pokémon this card is attached to (excluding Pokémon-EX) do 30 more damage to Active Pokémon-EX (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

attacks.name: Good Night
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Good Morning
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon was Asleep, it is no longer Asleep.

name: Deino

attacks.name: Gnaw Off
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

flavorText: They cannot see, so they tackle and bite to learn about their surroundings. Their bodies are covered in wounds.

name: Sobble

attacks.name: Keep Calling
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Basic Rapid Strike Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Double Spin
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

flavorText: When it gets wet, its skin changes color, and this Pokémon becomes invisible as if it were camouflaged.

name: Carvanha

attacks.name: Focus Energy
attacks.text: During your next turn, Carvanha's Bite attack's base damage is 40.

flavorText: They form packs to attack boats and rip out their hulls to sink them. They live in rivers in the jungle.

name: Arcanine

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

flavorText: Its magnificent bark conveys a sense of majesty. Anyone hearing it can't help but grovel before it.

name: Energy Search
rules: Search your deck for a basic Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Murkrow
flavorText: It has a weakness for shiny things. It's been known to sneak into the nests of Gabite—noted collectors of jewels—in search of treasure.

name: Super Scoop Up
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, put 1 of your Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your hand.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Paras
flavorText: No matter how much it eats, the mushrooms growing on its back steal away most of the nutrients it consumes.

name: Dratini

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: It is called the "Mirage Pokémon" because so few have seen it. Its shed skin has been found.

name: Lanturn

attacks.name: Energy Split
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon that has any Energy cards attached to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Aqua Bolt
attacks.text: Does 60 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Lanturn.

flavorText: Lanturn's light can shine up from great depths. It is nicknamed "The Deep-Sea Star."

name: Snover

attacks.name: Ice Shard
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Fighting Pokémon, this attack does 40 more damage.

flavorText: In the spring, it grows berries with the texture of frozen treats around its belly.

name: Pikachu

attacks.name: Mega Shot
attacks.text: Discard all Lightning Energy attached to Pikachu and then choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: It occasionally uses an electric shock to recharge a fellow Pikachu that is in a weakened state.

name: Weakness Guard Energy
rules: This card provides Colorless Energy.
The Pokémon this card is attached to has no Weakness.

name: Eevee

attacks.name: Palette of Friends
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage for each different type of Pokémon on your Bench.

flavorText: Possessing an unbalanced and unstable genetic makeup, it conceals many possible evolutions.

name: Zorua

attacks.name: Ascension
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon. (This counts as evolving this Pokémon.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

flavorText: It changes into the forms of others to surprise them. Apparently, it often transforms into a silent child.

name: Tool Scrapper
rules: Choose up to 2 Pokémon Tools attached to Pokémon (yours or your opponent's) and discard them.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Stunfisk

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Thunder Blast
attacks.text: Discard a Lightning Energy from this Pokémon.

flavorText: It conceals itself in the mud of the seashore. Then it waits. When prey touch it, it delivers a jolt of electricity.

name: Mawile

attacks.name: Find a Friend
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

flavorText: It chomps with its gaping mouth. Its huge jaws are actually steel horns that have been transformed.

name: Poliwhirl

attacks.name: Hypnoblast
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

flavorText: The skin on most of its body is moist. However, the skin on its belly spiral feels smooth.

name: Jynx

abilities.name: Victory Kiss
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is on your Bench, you may heal 10 damage from your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hug
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

flavorText: It wiggles its hips as it walks. It can cause people to dance in unison with it.

name: Max Revive
rules: Put a Pokémon from your discard pile on top of your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Girafarig

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Girafarig.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

flavorText: Its tail has a small brain of its own. Beware! If you get close, it may react to your scent and bite.

attacks.name: Influence
attacks.text: Search your deck for Omanyte, Kabuto, Aerodactyl, Lileep, or Anorith and put up to 2 of them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. Treat the new Benched Pokémon as Basic Pokémon.

attacks.name: Stretch Claws
attacks.text: If Anorith has any React Energy cards attached to it, this attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Vullaby

attacks.name: Rear Guard
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

flavorText: They tend to guard their posteriors with suitable bones they have found. They pursue weak Pokémon.

name: Bunnelby

attacks.name: Burrow
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

flavorText: It excels at digging holes. Using its ears, it can dig a nest 33 feet deep in one night.

name: Grubbin

attacks.name: Energize
attacks.text: Attach a Lightning Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: It uses its big jaws to dig nests into the forest floor, and it loves to feed on sweet tree sap.

name: Pancham
flavorText: It follows Pangoro around like a henchman. When Pancham makes a big mistake, its leaf gets taken away.

name: Rainbow Energy
rules: This card provides Colorless Energy. While in play, this card provides every type of Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time. When you attach this card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon, put 1 damage counter on that Pokémon.

name: Donphan

attacks.name: Spinning Turn
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Wreck
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 60 more damage. Discard the Stadium card.

flavorText: It attacks by curling up, then rolling into its foe. It can blow apart a house in one hit.

name: Kadabra

attacks.name: Recover
attacks.text: Discard 1 Psychic Energy card attached to Kadabra or this attack does nothing. Remove all damage counters from Kadabra.

flavorText: It emits special alpha waves from its body that induce headaches even to those just nearby.

name: Gabite

attacks.name: Ascension
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

flavorText: Shiny objects are its passion. It can be found in its cave, scarcely moving, its gaze fixed on the jewels it's amassed or Carbink it has caught.

name: Mantine

attacks.name: Bounce
attacks.text: You may switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

flavorText: As it majestically swims, it doesn’t care if Remoraid attach to it to scavenge for its leftovers.

name: Sandshrew

attacks.name: Double Scratch
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Sand Tomb
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

flavorText: Disliking water, it lives in deep burrows in arid areas. It can roll itself instantly into a ball.

abilities.name: Duplicate
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for another Ditto and switch it with Ditto. (Any cards attached to Ditto, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) If you do, put Ditto on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Duplicate Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Linear Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Shinx
flavorText: This Pokémon generates electricity by contracting its muscles. Excited trembling is a sign that Shinx is generating a tremendous amount of electricity.

name: Double Full Heal
rules: Remove all Special Conditions from each of your Active Pokémon.

name: Zangoose

attacks.name: Cutting Claw
attacks.text: If your opponent has Seviper in play, this attack does 40 damage plus 50 more damage.

flavorText: It has feuded with SEVIPER for many generations. Its sharp claws are its biggest weapons.

abilities.name: Exoskeleton
abilities.text: Any damage done to Pineco by attacks is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Doduo

attacks.name: Fury Attack
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: A bird that makes up for its poor flying with its fast foot speed. Leaves giant footprints.

name: Wooper

attacks.name: Yawn
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Splatter
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

flavorText: It lives in cold water, half burying itself in mud at the bottom to sleep.

name: Moomoo Milk
rules: Choose 1 of your Pokémon, and then flip 2 coins. For each heads, heal 30 damage from that Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Recall
rules: For your attack this turn, your Active Pokémon can use any attack from its Basic Pokémon card or any Evolution card attached to it. (You still have to pay for that attack's Energy cost.)

name: Krokorok

attacks.name: Knock Off
attacks.text: Discard a random card from your opponent's hand.

flavorText: They move in groups of a few individuals. A female is often the leader of the group, and the males will gather food.

name: Team Galactic's Invention G-101 Energy Gain
rules: Attach Team Galactic's Invention G-101 Energy Gain to 1 of your Pokémon SP that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it. If that Pokémon is Knocked Out, discard this card. When the Pokémon this card is attached to is no longer a Pokémon SP, discard this card.
As long as Team Galactic's Invention G-101 Energy Gain is attached to a Pokémon, the attack cost of that Pokémon's attacks is Colorless less.

name: Burmy Trash Cloak

abilities.name: Wear Cloak
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Burmy Trash Cloak is your Active Pokémon, you may search your discard for a basic Metal Energy card and attach it to Burmy Trash Cloak.

attacks.name: Trash Cloak Tackle
attacks.text: If Burmy Trash Cloak has any Metal Energy attached to it, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

flavorText: To shelter itself from cold, wintry winds, it covers itself with a cloak made of twigs and leaves.

name: Regice Star
rules: You can't have more than 1 Pokémon Star in your deck.

attacks.name: Ice Barrier
attacks.text: Prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Regice Star by your opponent's Pokémon-ex during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Final Blizzard
attacks.text: If your opponent has only 1 Prize card left and Regice Star is the only Pokémon you have in play, this attack does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Maractus

attacks.name: Ditch and Shake
attacks.text: Discard any number of Pokémon Tool cards from your hand. This attack does 50 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

flavorText: Once each year, this Pokémon scatters its seeds. They’re jam-packed with nutrients, making them a precious food source out in the desert.

name: Remoraid
flavorText: Using its dorsal fin as a suction pad, it clings to a Mantine's underside to scavenge for leftovers.

name: Pidove

attacks.name: Chirp
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Pokémon with Fighting Resistance, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

flavorText: Where people go, these Pokémon follow. If you're scattering food for them, be careful—several hundred of them can gather at once.

name: Abomasnow

abilities.name: Toughness Boost
abilities.text: Your Single Strike Pokémon in play, except any Abomasnow, get +50 HP. You can't apply more than 1 Toughness Boost Ability at a time.

flavorText: This Pokémon is known to bring blizzards. A shake of its massive body is enough to cause whiteout conditions.

name: Maractus

attacks.name: Stun Needle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Reinforced Needle
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it, this attack does 40 more damage.

flavorText: Arid regions are their habitat. They move rhythmically, making a sound similar to maracas.

name: Whirlipede

abilities.name: Poison Point
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), this Attacking Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: Storing energy for evolution, it sits. But, when predators approach, it moves to stab them with poison spikes.

name: Shopping Center
rules: Once during each player's turn, that player may put a Pokémon Tool attached to 1 of their Pokémon into their hand.

name: Dratini
flavorText: Long considered a mythical Pokémon until recently, when a small colony was found living underwater.

name: Return Label
rules: Put a card from your opponent's discard pile on the bottom of their deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Smeargle

attacks.name: Sketching Trash
attacks.text: Put up to 2 Fusion Strike Trainer cards from your discard pile into your hand.

flavorText: It draws symbols with the fluid that oozes from the tip of its tail. Depending on the symbol, Smeargle fanatics will pay big money for them.

name: Slowpoke

attacks.name: Whismy Tackle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: It lazes vacantly near water. If something bites its tail, it won't even notice for a whole day.

name: Tangela

attacks.name: Tangle Drag
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.

flavorText: Many writhing vines cover it, so its true identity remains unknown. The blue vines grow its whole life long.

attacks.name: Summoning Aroma
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Phanpy

abilities.name: Ultra-Thick Skin
abilities.text: As long as Phanpy has Energy attached to it, any damage done to Phanpy by attacks is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Rock Smash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage.

flavorText: As a sign of affection, it bumps with its snout. However, it is so strong, it may send you flying.

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Dream Ball
rules: You can play this card only if you took it as a face-down Prize card, before you put it into your hand. Search your deck for a Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.
Item rule: You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Torkoal

attacks.name: Flame Cloak
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, attach a Fire Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

flavorText: It burns coal inside its shell for energy. It blows out black soot if it is endangered.

name: Cherubi

attacks.name: Nap
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters from Cherubi.

attacks.name: Bullet Seed
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: The small ball holds the nutrients needed for evolution. Apparently, it is very sweet and tasty.

name: Tangela

attacks.name: Bind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Poison Powder
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: Blue plant vines cloak the Pokémon's identity in a tangled mass. It entangles anything that gets close.

name: Froakie

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

flavorText: It secretes flexible bubbles from its chest and back. The bubbles reduce the damage it would otherwise take when attacked.

name: Skarmory

attacks.name: Metal Arms
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool attached, this attack does 40 more damage.

flavorText: Its body is draped in steel armor. It looks heavy, but it can fly at speeds of up to 185 miles an hour!

name: Alolan Grimer

attacks.name: Nasty Goo
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: There are a hundred or so of them living in Alola's waste-disposal site. They're all hard workers who eat a lot of trash.

name: Scatterbug

attacks.name: Ultra Evolution
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for Vivillon and put it onto this Scatterbug to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

flavorText: The powder that covers its body regulates its temperature, so it can live in any region or climate.

attacks.name: Feint Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokémon.

name: Mom's Kindness
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Draw 2 cards.

name: Wartortle

attacks.name: Withdraw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Wartortle during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

flavorText: Often hides in water to stalk unweary prey. When swimming quickly, it moves its ears to maintain balance.

name: Dancer
rules: Draw 2 cards. If you go second and it's your first turn, draw 3 more cards.
Supporter rule: You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Articuno

attacks.name: Sharp Beak
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage.

attacks.name: Ice Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: A legendary bird Pokémon. It can create blizzards by freezing moisture in the air.

name: Dartrix
flavorText: It throws one knifelike feather after another at its enemies, and each one precisely strikes a weak point. These feathers are known as blade quills.

name: Floral Crown
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
At the end of your opponent's turn, heal 20 damage from the Basic Pokémon this card is attached to.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Fearow

attacks.name: Fly
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

flavorText: With its huge and magnificent wings, it can keep aloft without ever having to land or rest.

name: Clobbopus
flavorText: It's very curious, but its means of investigating things is to try to punch them with its tentacles. The search for food is what brings it onto land.

name: TV Reporter
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Draw 3 cards. Then discard any 1 card from your hand.

name: Opal
rules: Flip 2 coins. Search your deck for a number of cards up to the number of heads, put them into your hand, and shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Double Colorless Energy
rules: Double Colorless Energy provides ColorlessColorless Energy.

name: Alolan Rattata
flavorText: When the sun goes down, it becomes active. It runs around town on a chase for good food for the boss of its nest—Raticate.

name: Lanturn

attacks.name: Dive
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

flavorText: It blinds prey with an intense burst of light. With the prey incapacitated, the Pokémon swallows it in a single gulp.

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Cross Chop
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

name: Pansear

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: This Pokémon lives in caves in volcanoes. The fire within the tuft on its head can reach 600 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: Charmander

attacks.name: Playful
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage times the number of damage counters on this Pokémon.

flavorText: My Charmander is so rambunctious! I wonder if we can become good friends?

name: Voltorb
flavorText: Usually seen only in power plants, it is sometimes seen in towns, apparently using the power lines to travel.

name: Pupitar

abilities.name: Boost Gas
abilities.text: If Pupitar has any Energy attached to it, the Retreat Cost of Pupitar is 0.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Pupitar.

flavorText: Its shell is as hard as sheet rock, and it is also very strong. Its thrashing can topple a mountain.

name: Blaine's Gamble
rules: Discard any number of other cards from your hand, then flip a coin. If heads, draw twice that many cards.

attacks.name: Energy Draw
attacks.text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card and attach it to Electabuzz. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Reflect Energy
attacks.text: If you have any Benched Pokémon and if there are any basic Energy cards attached to Electabuzz, take 1 of those Energy cards and attach it to 1 of those Pokémon.

abilities.name: Plunge
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Poliwrath is on your Bench, you may flip a coin. If heads, take all Energy cards attached to your Active Pokémon, if any, and attach them to Poliwrath. Then switch Poliwrath with your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Water Punch
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the amount of Water Energy attached to Poliwrath. This attack does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each heads.

name: Shelgon

attacks.name: Hard Roll
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from and effects of attacks done to this Pokémon.

flavorText: Shelgon lives deep within caves. It stays shut up in its hard shell, dreaming of the day it will be able to fly.

attacks.name: Buddy Bolt
attacks.text: If you played a Supporter card from your hand during this turn, this attack does 30 more damage.

name: Ralts

attacks.name: Nap
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

flavorText: It is highly attuned to the emotions of people and Pokémon. It hides if it senses hostility.

name: Meowth VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: G-Max Gold Rush
attacks.text: Draw 3 cards.

name: Floatzel
flavorText: It is a common sight around fishing ports. It is known to rescue people and carry off prey.

name: Ducklett

attacks.name: Aerial Ace
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

flavorText: When attacked, it uses its feathers to splash water, escaping under cover of the spray.

name: Purrloin

attacks.name: Tail Rap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

flavorText: Its cute act is a ruse. When victims let down their guard, they find their items taken. It attacks with sharp claws.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

name: Tranquill

attacks.name: Air Slash
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

flavorText: Many people believe that, deep in the forest where Tranquill live, there is a peaceful place where there is no war.

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy card attached to Ponyta.

attacks.name: Sleepy Ball
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

name: Mars
rules: Draw 2 cards. If you do, discard a random card from your opponent's hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

name: Falinks

attacks.name: Cliff Edge Formation
attacks.text: If your opponent has exactly 1 Prize card remaining, this attack does 160 more damage.

flavorText: The six of them work together as one Pokémon. Teamwork is also their battle strategy, and they constantly change their formation as they fight.

name: Graveler

attacks.name: Harden
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, whenever 30 or less damage is done to Graveler (after applying Weakness and Resistance), prevent that damage. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

flavorText: Rolls down slopes to move. It rolls over any obstacle without slowing or changing its direction.

name: Geodude
flavorText: Geodude that have lived a long life have had all their edges smoothed out until they're totally round. They also have a calm, quiet disposition.

name: Oran Berry
rules: Attach Oran Berry to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it. If that Pokémon is Knocked Out, discard this card.
At any time between turns, if the Pokémon this card is attached to has at least 2 damage counters on it, remove 2 damage counters from it. Then discard Oran Berry.

name: Energy Retrieval
rules: Put 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Mienfoo
flavorText: It takes pride in the speed at which it can use moves. What it loses in power, it makes up for in quantity.

name: Lairon

attacks.name: Wreak Havoc
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

flavorText: For food, it digs up iron ore. It smashes it steely body against others to fight over territory.

name: Magmar

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

flavorText: Found near the mouth of a volcano. This fire-breather's body temperature is nearly 2,200 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: Escape Rope
rules: Each player switches his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon. (Your opponent switches first. If a player does not have a Benched Pokémon, he or she doesn't switch Pokémon.)
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Nincada

attacks.name: Dig
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

flavorText: It grows underground, sensing its surroundings using antennae instead of its virtually blind eyes.

name: Beautifly

attacks.name: Skill Dive
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Butterfly Edge
attacks.text: If your opponent's Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from this attack, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

flavorText: It has an aggressive nature. It stabs prey with its long, narrow mouth to drain the prey's fluids.

name: Riolu

attacks.name: Feint
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

flavorText: It knows how people and Pokémon feel by looking at their auras. It doesn't approach dangerous opponents.

name: Kiawe
rules: Search your deck for up to 4 Fire Energy cards and attach them to 1 of your Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck. Your turn ends.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

name: Professor's Letter
rules: Search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Minior

abilities.name: Falling Star
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is in your hand and your Bench isn't full, you may move your Active Pokémon to your Bench and play this Pokémon as your new Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Swift
