attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, or any other effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

flavorText: Strong impacts can knock it out of its shell. This Pokémon was born from mutated nanoparticles.

name: Articuno

attacks.name: Freeze Dry
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. If tails, this attack does 10 damage to each of your own Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: A legendary bird Pokémon that is said to appear to doomed people who are lost in icy mountains.

abilities.name: Galactic Switch
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may move an Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon SP to another of your Pokémon. Then, put 2 damage counters on Bronzong G. This power can't be used if Bronzong G is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Psychic Pulse
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Meowstic

attacks.name: Ear Influence
attacks.text: Move as many damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon as you like to any of your opponent's other Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

flavorText: Intense silence. Two lamplights. Keep waiting for night to end.

name: Rhydon

attacks.name: Storm Up
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage. Discard that Stadium card.

attacks.name: Crash Impact
attacks.text: Rhydon does 10 damage to itself. Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon, if any.

flavorText: Its brain developed after it stood up on its hind legs. Its drill horn bores tunnels through solid rock.

name: Vulpix
flavorText: While young, it has six gorgeous tails. When it grows, several new tails are sprouted.

abilities.name: Magnetic Search
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Lightning or Metal Pokémon, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Magnezone is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Speed Shot
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Crush Volt
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to Magnezone.

attacks.name: Sleepy Song
attacks.text: Each Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

name: Amaura

attacks.name: Powder Snow
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

flavorText: This calm Pokémon lived in a cold land where there were no violent predators like Tyrantrum.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

attacks.name: Blot
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters from Grovyle.

attacks.name: Poison Claws
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

name: Relicanth

attacks.name: Primal Calling
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Trainer Cards that have Fossil in their names, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Sleep Swirl
attacks.text: Both Relicanth and the Defending Pokémon are now Asleep.

flavorText: A rare Pokémon discovered during a deep-sea exploration. It has not changed in over 100 million years.

name: Galarian Chestplate
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached.
If the Pokémon this card is attached to has "Galarian" in its name, it takes 30 less damage from attacks from your opponent's Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Shroomish
flavorText: It prefers damp places. By day it remains still in the forest shade. It releases toxic powder from its head.

name: Vulpix

attacks.name: Singe
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

flavorText: It controls balls of fire. As it grows, its six tails split from their tips to make more tails.

name: Chewtle
flavorText: It starts off battles by attacking with its rock-hard horn, but as soon as the opponent flinches, this Pokémon bites down and never lets go.

name: Echoing Horn
rules: Put a Basic Pokémon from your opponent's discard pile onto their Bench.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Sandshrew

attacks.name: Sand Attack
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

flavorText: To protect itself from attackers, it curls up into a ball. It lives in arid regions with minimal rainfall.

name: Vaporeon

abilities.name: Vitality Cheer
abilities.text: Your Pokémon-GX in play that evolve from Eevee get +60 HP. You can't apply more than 1 Vitality Cheer Ability at a time.

attacks.name: Refreshing Rain
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from each of your Pokémon.

flavorText: Clean, clear waters are its usual habitat. When it's about to be attacked by an invading enemy, it dives into the water to hide.

name: Larvitar

abilities.name: Submerge
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).

flavorText: Born deep underground, it comes aboveground and becomes a pupa once it has finished eating the surrounding soil.

name: Walrein

attacks.name: Ice Entomb
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. This Pokémon can't use Ice Entomb during your next turn.

flavorText: It shatters ice with its big tusks. Its thick blubber repels not only the cold, but also enemy attacks.

name: Pawniard
flavorText: They fight at Bisharp's command. They cling to their prey and inflict damage by sinking their blades into it.

abilities.name: Submerge
abilities.text: As long as Feebas is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to Feebas by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).

attacks.name: Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Spiral Energy
rules: This card can only be attached to a Rapid Strike Pokémon. If this card is attached to anything other than a Rapid Strike Pokémon, discard this card.

As long as this card is attached to a Pokémon, it provides every type of Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time. The Pokémon this card is attached to can't be Paralyzed, and if it is already Paralyzed, it recovers from that Special Condition.

name: Beldum
flavorText: It converses with others by magnetic pulses. In a swarm, they move in perfect unison.

name: Metang

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Bullet Punch
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

flavorText: It is formed by two Beldum joining together. Its steel body won't be scratched if it collides with a jet.

name: Tangrowth

attacks.name: Giga Drain
attacks.text: Heal from this Pokémon the same amount of damage you did to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Crosswise Whip
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 50 damage for each heads.

flavorText: It ensnares prey by extending arms made of vines. Losing arms to predators does not trouble it.

attacks.name: Reverse Thrust
attacks.text: Switch Horsea with 1 of your Benched Pokémon, if any.

name: Interviewer's Questions
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Look at the top 8 cards of your deck. Choose as many Energy cards as you like, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

name: Squirtle

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Withdraw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Squirtle during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

flavorText: After birth, its back swells and hardens into a shell. It powerfully sprays foam from its mouth.

name: Moomoo Cheese
rules: Heal 30 damage from up to 2 of your Pokémon that have Energy attached.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Vigoroth

attacks.name: Shatter
attacks.text: Discard a Stadium in play.

flavorText: Its stress level rises if it cannot keep moving constantly. Too much stress makes it feel sick.

name: Pokémon Breeder
rules: Draw 2 cards and heal 20 damage from your Active Pokémon. If you have no cards in your deck, you can't play this card.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

name: Hoothoot

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Kick Shot
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: It always stands on one foot. Even when attacked, it does not brace itself using both feet.

name: Energy Flow
rules: For each of your Pokémon, you may return any number of Energy cards attached to it to your hand.

name: Yanma
flavorText: Its frail wings are so thin that one can see clear through them. However, during flight these wings exhibit the power to churn air with force enough to launch a house skyward.

attacks.name: Rising Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage.

name: Mr. Mime

attacks.name: Trick
attacks.text: Move a Pokémon Tool card attached to 1 of either player's Pokémon to another of that player's Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it. If there is no Pokémon to move the Pokémon Tool card to, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Lock Up
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

flavorText: It is adept at conning people. It is said to be able to create walls out of thin air by miming.

name: Larvitar

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

flavorText: Born deep underground, it comes aboveground and becomes a pupa once it has finished eating the surrounding soil.

name: Caterpie

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: When attacked by bird Pokémon, it resists by releasing a terrifically strong odor from its antennae, but it often becomes their prey.

name: Phantump
flavorText: With a voice like a human child’s, it cries out to lure adults deep into the forest, getting them lost among the trees.

name: Sobble
flavorText: When scared, this Pokémon cries. Its tears pack the chemical punch of 100 onions, and attackers won't be able to resist weeping.

name: Magnemite

attacks.name: Metal Sound
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

flavorText: The electromagnetic waves emitted by the units at the sides of its head expel antigravity, which allows it to float.

name: Omanyte

abilities.name: Call Up
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, search your discard pile for Helix Fossil, Dome Fossil, or Old Amber and put it onto your Bench. This power can't be used if Omanyte is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Wash Over
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: A Pokémon that was resurrected from a fossil using modern science. It swam in ancient seas.

name: Xtransceiver
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Supporter card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Druddigon

attacks.name: Big Swing
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If either of them is tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Shred
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on the Defending Pokémon.

flavorText: It runs through the narrow tunnels formed by Excadrill and Onix. It uses its sharp claws to catch prey.

name: Mallow & Lana
rules: Switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
When you play this card, you may discard 2 other cards from your hand. If you do, heal 120 damage from the Pokémon you moved to your Bench.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

name: Chinchou

attacks.name: Electripult
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: It discharges positive and negative electricity from its antenna tips to shock its foes.

name: Kleavor

attacks.name: Timber Cleave
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is Knocked Out.

attacks.name: Berserker Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

flavorText: A violent creature that fells towering trees with its crude axes and shields itself with hard stone. If one should chance upon this Pokémon in the wilds, one's only recourse is to flee.

name: Electrocharger
rules: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, shuffle an Electropower card from your discard pile into your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

abilities.name: Deep Sleep
abilities.text: As long as Misdreavus is your Active Pokémon, each player flips 2 coins for his or her Pokémon that is Asleep between turns. If either coin is tails, that Pokémon is still Asleep.

attacks.name: Return Trance
attacks.text: Return an Energy card attached to Misdreavus to your hand. The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Dream Eater
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is not Asleep, this attack does nothing.

name: Fletchling
flavorText: While it's an amiable Pokémon, if you touch it unexpectedly, it will heat up its body in an instant, and you'll be burned.

name: Gloom

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Foul Odor
attacks.text: Both the Defending Pokémon and Gloom are now Confused (after doing damage).

flavorText: The fluid that oozes from its mouth isn't drool; it is a nectar that is used to attract prey.

name: Sprout Tower
rules: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play.
All damage done by Colorless Pokémon's attacks is reduced by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Pumpkaboo

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

flavorText: The pumpkin body is inhabited by a spirit trapped in this world. As the sun sets, it becomes restless and active.

attacks.name: Energy Ball
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to Poliwhirl but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

name: Duskull

attacks.name: Silhouette
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on the Defending Pokémon. If the Defending Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, put 2 damage counters on that Pokémon instead.

flavorText: It doggedly pursues its prey wherever it goes. However, the chase is abandoned at sunrise.

name: Electrike

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

flavorText: It stores static electricity in its fur for discharging. It gives off sparks if a storm approaches.

name: Poliwrath

attacks.name: Submission
attacks.text: Poliwrath does 20 damage to itself.

flavorText: Although an energetic, skilled swimmer that uses all of its muscles, it lives on dry land.

name: Shuppet
flavorText: It loves vengeful emotions and hangs in rows under the eaves of houses where vengeful people live.

name: Old PC
rules: Flip 2 coins. If both are heads, put a card from your discard pile into your hand.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Red & Blue
rules: Search your deck for a Pokémon-GX that evolves from 1 of your Pokémon and put it onto that Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck. (You can't use this card during your first turn or on a Pokémon that was put into play this turn.)
When you play this card, you may discard 2 other cards from your hand. If you do, search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards and attach them to the Pokémon you evolved in this way.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

name: Clobbopus

attacks.name: Bind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: It's very curious, but its means of investigating things is to try to punch them with its tentacles. The search for food is what brings it onto land.

name: Lickitung

attacks.name: Continuous Lick
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

flavorText: It checks out whatever's around it by licking everything. If you don't clean off a spot where it's licked you, you'll break out in a rash!

name: Rhyhorn

attacks.name: Dig Out
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your deck. If that card is a Fighting Energy, attach it to this Pokémon.

flavorText: Strong, but not too bright, this Pokémon can shatter even a skyscraper with its charging Tackles.

name: Granbull

attacks.name: Daunt
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 20 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: Does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Granbull.

flavorText: It is timid in spite of its looks. If it becomes enraged, however, it will strike with its huge fangs.

name: Vigoroth

attacks.name: Shatter
attacks.text: Discard a Stadium in play.

flavorText: Its stress level rises if it cannot keep moving constantly. Too much stress makes it feel sick.

name: Team Aqua's Poochyena

attacks.name: Roar
attacks.text: Your opponent switches his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

flavorText: Poochyena can easily detect invading foes with its acute sense of smell. It's an excellent lookout!

name: Smoochum
rules: If your Active Pokémon is a Baby Pokémon and your opponent announces an attack, your opponent flips a coin (before doing anything else). If tails, your opponent's turn ends.

attacks.name: Energy Kiss
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Energy cards attached to the Defending Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

name: Flabébé
flavorText: It's OK. No one will take away your flower. You look cute even when you're angry.

name: Solosis

attacks.name: Mini Link
attacks.text: If Solosis is on your Bench, this attack does 30 more damage.

flavorText: They drive away attackers by unleashing psychic power. They can use telepathy to talk with others.

name: Cacturne

attacks.name: Pull
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Spiny Punch
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Darkness Energy attached, this attack does 70 more damage.

flavorText: Packs of them follow travelers through the desert until the travelers can no longer move.

abilities.name: Energy Evolution
abilities.text: Whenever you attach an Energy card from your hand to Eevee, you may search your deck for a card that evolves from Eevee that is the same type as the Energy card you attached to Eevee. Put that card onto Eevee. (This counts as evolving Eevee.) Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used when you attach an Energy card to Eevee as part of an attack's effect.

attacks.name: Growth
attacks.text: Attach a Grass Energy card from your hand to Bulbasaur.

name: Drilbur
flavorText: It makes its way swiftly through the soil by putting both claws together and rotating at high speed.

name: Tangela

attacks.name: Bind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Poison Powder
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: Blue plant vines cloak the Pokémon's identity in a tangled mass. It entangles anything that gets close.

abilities.name: Psychoflow
abilities.text: As long as there is a Psychic Energy card attached to Abra, its Retreat Cost is 0.

name: Mareep
flavorText: Its soft wool coat captures air, allowing it to remain cool during the summer and warm in the winter.

name: Energy Search
rules: Search your deck for a basic Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Shellos
flavorText: Its shape and coloration vary, depending on its habitat.

name: Koffing

attacks.name: Smokescreen
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

flavorText: Its thin, filmy body is filled with gases that cause constant sniffles, coughs and teary eyes.

name: Sharpedo

abilities.name: Rough Skin
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 2 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hard Bite
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

flavorText: Its fangs rip through sheet iron. It swims at 75 mph and is known as

name: Dragonair

attacks.name: Dragon Tail
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 60 damage for each heads.

flavorText: From time immemorial, it has been venerated by agricultural peoples as an entity able to control the weather.

name: Mareanie

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: It plunges the poison spike on its head into its prey. When the prey has weakened, Mareanie deals the finishing blow with its 10 tentacles.

name: Patrat

attacks.name: Hyper Fang
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: Extremely cautious, they take shifts to maintain a constant watch of their nest. They feel insecure without a lookout.

name: Beastite
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
The attacks of the Ultra Beast this card is attached to do 10 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon for each Prize card you have taken (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Anorith
rules: Put this card onto your Bench only with the effect of Claw Fossil Anorith

abilities.name: Restored Barrier
abilities.text: Each of your Restored Pokémon has no Weakness.

attacks.name: X-Scissor
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

flavorText: A Pokémon ancestor that was reanimated from a fossil. It lived in the sea and hunted with claws.

attacks.name: Energy Stream
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for a basic Energy card and attach it to Poliwhirl.

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Onix

attacks.name: Swing Around
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 60 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: Opening its large mouth, it ingests massive amounts of soil and creates long tunnels.

name: Shieldon

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

flavorText: This Pokémon lived in primeval jungles. Few enemies would have been willing to square off against its heavily armored face, so it's thought.

name: Chinchou

attacks.name: Luring Glow
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.

flavorText: Its antennae, which evolved from a fin, have both positive and negative charges flowing through them.

name: Ekans
flavorText: The eggs of bird Pokémon are its favorite food. It swallows eggs whole, so sometimes an egg gets stuck, and Ekans faints.

name: Lillipup

attacks.name: Knock Away
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

flavorText: It faces strong opponents with great courage. But, when at a disadvantage in a fight, this intelligent Pokémon flees.

attacks.name: Linear Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Celadon City Gym
rules: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play.

During each player's turn, that player may choose to discard an Energy card attached to 1 of his or her Pokémon with Erika in its name. If that player does so, that Pokémon is no longer Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned.

name: Sawk

attacks.name: Five Fierce Chops
attacks.text: Flip 5 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads. This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

flavorText: Tying their belts gets them pumped and makes their punches more destructive. Disturbing their training angers them.

attacks.name: Mach Punch
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Poison Spurt
attacks.text: Discard a Grass Energy card attached to Grimer. The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

name: Purugly

attacks.name: Swagger
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: It is a brazen brute that barges its way into another Pokémon's nest and claims it as its own.

name: Karrablast

attacks.name: Continuous Headbutt
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

flavorText: Its strange physiology reacts to electrical energy in interesting ways. The presence of a Shelmet will cause this Pokémon to evolve.

attacks.name: Iron Defense
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Clamperl during your opponent's next turn.

name: Gible
flavorText: It attacks using its huge mouth. While its attacks are powerful, it hurts itself out of clumsiness, too.

name: Bertha's Warmth
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Remove 5 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon SP.

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

name: Sandshrew

attacks.name: Defense Curl
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Sandshrew by attacks during your opponent's next turn.

flavorText: Disliking water, it lives in deep burrows in arid areas. It can roll itself instantly into a ball.

name: Fairy Charm Lightning
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
Prevent all damage done to the Fairy Pokémon this card is attached to by attacks from your opponent's Lightning Pokémon-GX and Lightning Pokémon-EX.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Croagunk
flavorText: Once diluted, its poison becomes medicinal. This Pokémon came into popularity after a pharmaceutical company chose it as a mascot.

name: Candela
rules: Draw 2 cards. If you drew any cards in this way, flip a coin. If heads, attach a Fire Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
Supporter rule: You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Golett

attacks.name: Nap
attacks.text: Heal 40 damage from this Pokémon.

flavorText: The energy that burns inside it enables it to move, but no one has yet been able to identify this energy.

name: Pidove

attacks.name: Homing Pidove
attacks.text: Look at the top card of your deck. Then, you may shuffle your deck.

flavorText: These Pokémon live in cities. They are accustomed to people. Flocks often gather in parks and plazas.

name: Deino
flavorText: When it encounters something, its first urge is usually to bite it. If it likes what it tastes, it will commit the associated scent to memory.

attacks.name: Telekinesis
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Morpeko

attacks.name: Gather Food
attacks.text: Put an Item card from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Hangry Tackle
attacks.text: If you have no cards in your hand, this attack does 90 more damage.

flavorText: Hunger hormones affect its temperament. Until its hunger is appeased, it gets up to all manner of evil deeds.

name: Flabébé

attacks.name: Hypnotic Gaze
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

flavorText: Flabébé wears a crown made from pollen it’s collected from its flower. The crown has hidden healing properties.

name: Yanma

abilities.name: Free Flight
abilities.text: If Yanma has no Energy attached to it, Yanma's Retreat Cost is 0.

flavorText: Its large eyes can scan 360 degrees. It looks in all directions to seek out insects as its prey.

name: Trapinch
flavorText: It makes an inescapable conical pit and lies in wait at the bottom for prey to come tumbling down.

abilities.name: Chain of Events
abilities.text: As long as Minun is your Active Pokémon, whenever your other Active Pokémon, if any, attacks, you may use Cheer On after the first attack (you still need the necessary Energy to use Cheer On). You can't use Cheer On more than once in this way even if your other Active Pokémon has the Chain of Events Poké-Body.

attacks.name: Cheer On
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokémon (including Minun).

attacks.name: Special Circuit
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. If you choose Pokémon that has a Poké-Power or Poké-Body, this attack does 40 damage instead. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Grotle

attacks.name: Sleep Powder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

flavorText: A Grotle that lives in the forest is said to have its own secret springwater.

name: Throh
flavorText: It performs throwing moves with first-rate skill. Over the course of many battles, Throh's belt grows darker as it absorbs its wearer's sweat.

name: Plusle

attacks.name: Positive Hand
attacks.text: Discard a basic Energy card from your hand. If you do, draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Electric Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: It cheers on friends with pom-poms made of sparks. It drains power from telephone poles.

name: Remoraid

attacks.name: Water Arrow
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: It has superb accuracy. The water it shoots out can strike even moving prey from more than 300 feet.

name: Stunfisk

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Thunder Blast
attacks.text: Discard a Lightning Energy from this Pokémon.

flavorText: It conceals itself in the mud of the seashore. Then it waits. When prey touch it, it delivers a jolt of electricity.

name: Slugma

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

flavorText: Its body is made of magma. If it doesn't keep moving, its body will cool and harden.

name: Bulbasaur

attacks.name: Shake Vine
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Bullet Seed
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: For some time after its birth, it grows by gaining nourishment from the seed on its back.

name: Voltorb

attacks.name: Big Explosion
attacks.text: Voltorb does 50 damage to itself.

flavorText: It looks just like a Poké Ball. It is dangerous because it may electrocute or explode on touch.

name: Baltoy

attacks.name: Reverse Spin
attacks.text: Your opponent shuffles his or her hand into his or her deck and draws 4 cards.

flavorText: It move by spinning on its foot. It is a rare Pokémon that was discovered in ancient ruins.

name: Chikorita

attacks.name: Deflector
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, whenever Chikorita takes damage, divide that damage in half (rounded down to the nearest 10). (Any other effects still happen.)

flavorText: A sweet aroma gently wafts from the leaf on its head. It is docile and loves to soak up the sun's rays.

name: Koffing

attacks.name: Offensive Gas
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Gas Bomb
attacks.text: Koffing does 30 damage to itself, and don't apply Weakness and Resistance to this damage.

flavorText: Lighter-than-air gases in its body keep it aloft. The gases not only smell, they are also explosive.

name: Horsea

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: It makes its nest in the shade of corals. If it senses danger, it spits murky ink and flees.

name: Jynx

attacks.name: Double Draw
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Dazzle Dance
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

flavorText: Its strange cries sound like human language. There are some musicians who compose songs for Jynx to sing.

name: Trapinch

attacks.name: Land's Pulse
attacks.text: If a Stadium is in play, this attack does 10 more damage.

flavorText: Its nest is a sloped, bowl-like pit in the desert. Once something has fallen in, there is no escape.

name: Switch
rules: Switch 1 of your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Retaliation
attacks.text: You can't use this attack unless Giovanni's Nidoran ♂ has 2 or more damage counters on it.

attacks.name: Growl
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon's attacks do 20 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Mudkip
flavorText: To alert it, the fin on its head senses the flow of water. It has the strength to heft boulders.

name: Lopunny

attacks.name: Stompy Stomp
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Happy Turn
attacks.text: You may shuffle this Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your deck.

flavorText: The ears appear to be delicate. If they are touched roughly, it kicks with its graceful legs.

name: Meowth

attacks.name: Fake Out
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: It lies around all day, becoming active near dusk. At night, it wanders the city in search of loose change.

name: Koffing

attacks.name: Poison Gas
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: First discovered in a weapons factory, this Pokémon can now be found almost anywhere.

name: Clefairy

attacks.name: Follow Me
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.

flavorText: Its adorable behavior and appearance make it popular with men and women, young and old. Its numbers are few, however.

name: Inkay

attacks.name: Rip Off
attacks.text: Choose a random card from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals that card and shuffles it into his or her deck.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

flavorText: It flashes the light-emitting spots on its body, which drains its opponent's will to fight. It takes the opportunity to scuttle away and hide.

abilities.name: Unburden
abilities.text: If Drifloon has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it, Drifloon's Retreat Cost is ColorlessColorless more.

attacks.name: Big Explosion
attacks.text: Drifloon does 50 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Cracking Voice
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, each Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

name: Double Colorless Energy
rules: Double Colorless Energy provides ColorlessColorless Energy.

name: Drampa

attacks.name: Dragon Wisdom
attacks.text: Attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Dragon Pokémon.

flavorText: This Pokémon is friendly to people and loves children most of all. It comes from deep in the mountains to play with children it likes in town.

name: Special Charge
rules: Shuffle 2 Special Energy cards from your discard pile into your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Zorua

attacks.name: Moonless Madness
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Dark Edge
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

flavorText: To protect themselves from danger, they hide their true identities by transforming into people and Pokémon.

name: Marowak

attacks.name: Bonemerang
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Call for Friend
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Fighting Basic Pokémon card and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. (You can't use this attack if your Bench is full.)

flavorText: The bone it holds is its key weapon. It throws the bone skillfully like a boomerang to K.O. targets.

name: Mienshao

attacks.name: Feint
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

flavorText: It wield the fur on its arms like a whip. Its arms attacks come with such rapidity that they cannot even be seen.

name: Chinchou
flavorText: It discharges positive and negative electricity from its antenna tips to shock its foes.

name: Sky Field
rules: Each player can have 8 Pokémon on his or her Bench.
(When this card leaves play, each player discards Benched Pokémon until he or she has 5 Pokémon on the Bench. The owner of this card discards first.)
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

name: Fiery Torch
rules: Discard a Fire Energy card from your hand. (If you can't discard a Fire Energy card, you can't play this card.) Draw 2 cards.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Spewpa

attacks.name: Grass Cocooning
attacks.text: Heal 40 damage from this Pokémon.

flavorText: The beaks of birds can't begin to scratch its stalwart body. To defend itself, it spews powder.

name: Professor Oak's Hint
rules: Draw cards until you have 7 cards in your hand. Your turn ends.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

name: Tympole
flavorText: It uses sound waves to communicate with others of its kind. People and other Pokémon species can’t hear its cries of warning.

attacks.name: Threaten
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, look at your opponent's hand. If he or she has any Trainer cards there, choose 1 of them. Your opponent shuffles that card into his or her deck.

attacks.name: Antler Swipe
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage to the Defending Pokémon (don't apply Weakness or Resistance). If tails and your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 20 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Switch
rules: Switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Alolan Graveler

attacks.name: Self-Destruct
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 100 damage to itself.

flavorText: Its preferred food is dravite. After it has eaten this mineral, crystals form inside the Pokémon, rising to the surface of part of its body.

abilities.name: Saturation
abilities.text: When you attach a Water Energy card from your hand to Wooper, remove all Special Conditions and 1 damage counter from Wooper.

abilities.name: Duplicate
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for another Ditto and switch it with Ditto. (Any cards attached to Ditto, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) If you do, put Ditto on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Duplicate Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Pikachu

attacks.name: Growl
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 20 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Numb
attacks.text: If Pikachu evolved from Pichu during this turn, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: If it looses crackling power from the electric pouches on its cheeks, it is being wary.

name: Siebold
rules: Choose up to 2 of your Rapid Strike Pokémon and heal 60 damage from each of them.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Sizzlipede

attacks.name: Singe
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

flavorText: It wraps prey up with its heated body, cooking them in its coils. Once they’re well-done, it will voraciously nibble them down to the last morsel.

name: Vullaby

attacks.name: Air Slash
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

flavorText: Vullaby grow quickly. Bones that have gotten too small for older Vullaby to wear often get passed down to younger ones in the nest.

name: Buizel
flavorText: It inflates the flotation sac around its neck and pokes its head out of the water to see what is going on.

name: Golett
flavorText: This Pokémon was created from clay. It received orders from its master many thousands of years ago, and it still follows those orders to this day.

name: Durant

attacks.name: Devour
attacks.text: For each of your Durant in play, discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

flavorText: With their large mandibles, these Pokémon can crunch their way through rock. They work together to protect their eggs from Sandaconda.

name: Aron

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

flavorText: It usually lives deep in mountains. However, hunger may drive it to eat railroad tracks and cars.

name: Absol
flavorText: The elderly call it the disaster Pokémon and detest it, but interest in its power to predict disasters is on the rise.

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Nidorino
flavorText: It raises its big ears to check its surroundings. If it senses anything, it attacks immediately.

name: Cutiefly
flavorText: An opponent’s aura can tell Cutiefly what that opponent’s next move will be. Then Cutiefly can glide around the attack and strike back.

name: Dusk Stone
rules: Search your deck for a Mismagius, Honchkrow, Chandelure, or Aegislash, including Pokémon-GX, that evolves from 1 of your Pokémon in play, and put it onto that Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck. You can use this card during your first turn or on a Pokémon that was put into play this turn.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Bronzor

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

flavorText: Implements shaped like it were discovered in ancient tombs. It is unknown if they are related.

name: Marowak

attacks.name: Bonemerang
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 60 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Bone Impact
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 20 damage plus 60 more damage. Discard that Stadium card.

flavorText: It has been seen pounding boulders with the bone it carries in order to tap out messages to others.

abilities.name: Poison Structure
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Sidney's Stadium is in play, you may choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon. That Pokémon is now Poisoned. This power can't be used if Cacturne is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Pin Missile
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Firebreathing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.

attacks.name: Lava Burst
attacks.text: Discard the top 5 cards of your deck. (If there are fewer than 5 cards in your deck, discard all of them.) This attack does 20 damage for each Fire Energy card you discarded in this way.

name: Zubat

attacks.name: Poison Spray
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: While flying, it constantly emits ultrasonic waves from its mouth to check its surroundings.

attacks.name: Smokescreen
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

name: Sizzlipede

attacks.name: Singe
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

flavorText: It wraps prey up with its heated body, cooking them in its coils. Once they’re well-done, it will voraciously nibble them down to the last morsel.

attacks.name: Shadow Bind
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat until the end of your opponent's next turn.

name: Horsea

attacks.name: Splatter
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: It makes its nest in the shade of corals. If it senses danger, it spits murky ink and flees.

name: Galarian Linoone
flavorText: This very aggressive Pokémon will recklessly challenge opponents stronger than itself.

name: Druddigon

abilities.name: Rough Skin
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 2 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Clutch
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

flavorText: It races through narrow caves, using its sharp claws to catch prey. The skin on its face is harder than a rock.

name: Recycle
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, put a card in your discard pile on top of your deck.

name: Electrode

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, or any other effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

flavorText: It explodes in response to even minor stimuli. It is feared, with the nickname of "The Bomb Ball."

name: Voltorb

abilities.name: Destiny Burst
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, flip a coin. If heads, put 5 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

flavorText: It was discovered when Poké Balls were introduced. It is said that there is some connection.

attacks.name: Vital Pinchers
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

name: Sudowoodo

abilities.name: Vamoose
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has any damage counters on it, it has no Retreat Cost.

attacks.name: Double-Edge
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

flavorText: Though it pretends to be a tree, it fails to fool even children. To the touch, its body feels more like rock than tree bark. Sudowoodo's extreme aversion to water merits special note.

name: Nuzleaf

attacks.name: Razor Wind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: It lives deep in forests. With the leaf on its head, it makes a flute whose song makes listeners uneasy.

name: Swinub
flavorText: It rubs its snout on the ground to find and dig up food. It sometimes discovers hot springs.

name: Dunsparce

attacks.name: Double Draw
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Dig
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

flavorText: It creates mazes in dark locations. When spotted, it flees into the ground by digging with its tail.

name: Floatzel

attacks.name: Aqua Bomb
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.

flavorText: It floats using its well-developed flotation sac. It assists in the rescues of drowning people.

name: Double Colorless Energy
rules: Double Colorless Energy provides ColorlessColorless Energy.

abilities.name: Duplicate
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for another Ditto and switch it with Ditto. (Any cards attached to Ditto, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) If you do, put Ditto on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Duplicate Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Smash Turn
attacks.text: After your attack, you may switch Ditto with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

name: Lickitung

attacks.name: Lap Up
attacks.text: Draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 damage for each heads.

flavorText: Its tongue is twice the length of its body. It can be moved like an arm for grabbing food and attacking.

name: Wide Lens
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
Damage from the attacks of the Pokémon this card is attached to is affected by Weakness and Resistance for your opponent's Benched Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Scizor Spirit Link
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
Your turn does not end if the Pokémon this card is attached to becomes M Scizor-EX.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Carnivine

attacks.name: Return
attacks.text: You may draw cards until you have 5 cards in your hand.

attacks.name: Giga Drain
attacks.text: Heal from this Pokémon the same amount of damage you did to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

flavorText: It binds itself to trees in marshes. It attracts prey with its sweet-smelling drool and gulps them down.

name: Oshawott
flavorText: It fights using the scalchop on its stomach. In response to an attack, it retaliates immediately by slashing.

name: Steelix Spirit Link
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
Your turn does not end if the Pokémon this card is attached to becomes M Steelix-EX.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Staryu

attacks.name: Recover
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to Staryu and remove 3 damage counters from Staryu.

flavorText: Its body is virtually composed of water. It shoots strange beams from its crystal-like eyes.

name: Dusclops

attacks.name: Fade to Black
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

flavorText: Its body is entirely hollow. When it opens its mouth, it sucks everything in as if it were a black hole.

name: Spinarak

attacks.name: Spider Scram
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned. Put this Pokémon and all cards attached to it in the Lost Zone.

flavorText: Some fishermen weave its sturdy thread into nets to catch fish Pokémon.

name: Poké Ball
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Basic Pokémon or Evolution card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Luxio

attacks.name: Thunder Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: By joining its tail with that of another Luxio, this Pokémon can receive some of the other Luxio's electricity and power up its own electric blasts.

name: Minun

attacks.name: Ditch and Draw
attacks.text: You may discard any number of cards from your hand. Then, draw cards until you have 5 cards in your hand.

flavorText: It cheers on friends. If its friends are losing, its body lets off more and more sparks.

name: Shellos East Sea

attacks.name: Shell Hunting
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 in any combination of Shellos West Sea and Shellos East Sea and put them on your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

flavorText: Its colors and shapes differ from region to region. In the Sinnoh region, two types are confirmed.

name: Joltik
flavorText: They attach themselves to large-bodied Pokémon and absorb static electricity, which they store in an electric pouch.

name: Prinplup

attacks.name: Direct Dive
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 100 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: It lives alone, away from others. Apparently, every one of them believes it is the most important.

name: Hop
rules: Draw 3 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

attacks.name: Soothing Scent
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

abilities.name: Duplicate
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for another Ditto and switch it with Ditto. (Any cards attached to Ditto, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) If you do, put Ditto on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Duplicate Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Energy Link
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for an Energy card and attach it to Ditto.

name: Alolan Rattata

attacks.name: Call for the Boss
attacks.text: Search your deck for Alolan Raticate or Alolan Raticate-GX, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

flavorText: When the sun goes down, it becomes active. It runs around town on a chase for good food for the boss of its nest—Raticate.

attacks.name: Tail Wrap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Cacnea

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: By storing water in its body, this desert dweller can survive for 30 days without water.

name: Shinx

attacks.name: Jump On
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

flavorText: The extension and contraction of its muscles generates electricity. It glows when in trouble.

name: Poliwag

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

flavorText: Despite the danger, it wants to come up on land. So it does its best to waddle along, but when an enemy finds it, it rushes back to the water.

attacks.name: Sludge Grip
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch it with the Defending Pokémon. The new Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

name: Totodile

attacks.name: Shining Fang
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

flavorText: It has the habit of biting anything with its developed jaws. Even its Trainer need to be careful.

name: Scatterbug

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: The powder that covers its body regulates its temperature, so it can live in any region or climate.

attacks.name: Double Scratch
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

name: Mismagius

attacks.name: Ominous Prose
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand. If they have 4 or more cards in their hand, choose all but 3, and your opponent shuffles the chosen cards into their deck.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

flavorText: Its muttered curses can cause awful headaches or terrifying visions that torment others.

name: Reversal Trigger
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
When the Team Plasma Pokémon this card is attached to is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Wimpod

attacks.name: Sand Attack
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack doesn't happen.

flavorText: It will pick up anything it finds on the ground. Sometimes it finds coins, so Murkrow and Meowth will go after it.

name: Exploud

attacks.name: Boomburst
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: Its howls can be heard over six miles away. It emits all sorts of noises from the ports on its body.

name: Pawniard

attacks.name: Rigidify
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

flavorText: Ignoring their injuries, groups attack by sinking the blades that cover their bodies into their prey.

attacks.name: Pebble Throw
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Double Headbutt
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

name: Muscle Band
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
The attacks of the Pokémon this card is attached to do 20 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Araquanid

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Bubble Trap
attacks.text: If 1 of your Pokémon used Bubble during your last turn, this attack does 80 more damage.

flavorText: Despite what its appearance suggests, it cares for others. If it finds vulnerable, weak Pokémon, it protectively brings them into its water bubble.

name: Pokémon Breeder
rules: Draw 2 cards and heal 20 damage from your Active Pokémon. If you have no cards in your deck, you can't play this card.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

name: Wurmple

attacks.name: Needling Sting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

attacks.name: String Shot
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: It loves to eat leaves. If it is attacked by a STARLY, it will defend itself with its spiked rear.

name: Sandygast

attacks.name: Sneaky Placement
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

flavorText: If you build sand mounds when you're playing, destroy them before you go home, or they may get possessed and become Sandygast.

name: Sandile

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: It moves along below the sand's surface, except for its nose and eyes. A dark membrane shields its eyes from the sun.

attacks.name: Tunneling
attacks.text: Choose up to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Onix can't attack during your next turn.

name: Stunfisk

attacks.name: Revenge
attacks.text: If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack during his or her last turn, this attack does 80 more damage.

attacks.name: Thunder Blast
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

flavorText: It conceals itself in the mud of the seashore. Then it waits. When prey touch it, it delivers aa jolt of electricity.

name: Energy Recycler
rules: Shuffle 5 basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Porygon

attacks.name: Digicharge
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. For each heads, search your deck for an Energy card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

flavorText: This Pokémon was created using the cutting-edge science of 20 years ago, so many parts of it have since become obsolete.

name: Eevee

abilities.name: Energy Evolution
abilities.text: When you attach a basic Energy card from your hand to this Pokémon, you may search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon that is the same type as that Energy card and put it onto this Pokémon. (This counts as evolving this Pokémon.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

flavorText: A rare Pokémon that adapts to harsh environments by taking on different evolutionary forms.

name: Glalie

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Raging Floe
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any damage counters on it, this attack does 80 more damage.

flavorText: Legend says a boulder on an icy mountain absorbed the distress and regrets of a stranded mountaineer, giving rise to Glalie.

name: Rapidash

attacks.name: Overrun
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: Very competitive, this Pokémon will chase anything that moves fast in the hopes of racing it.

abilities.name: Fluff
abilities.text: Whenever Swablu would be damaged or affected by an opponent's attack and already has at least 1 damage counter on it, flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of that attack, including damage, done to Swablu.

name: Greninja

attacks.name: Shadow Stitching
attacks.text: Until the end of your opponent's next turn, each Pokémon your opponent has in play, in his or her hand, and in his or her discard pile has no Abilities. (This includes cards that come into play on that turn.)

attacks.name: Moonlight Slash
attacks.text: You may return a Water Energy from this Pokémon to your hand. If you do, this attack does 20 more damage.

flavorText: It appears and vanishes with a ninja's grace. It toys with its enemies using swift movements, while slicing them with throwing stars of sharpest water.

name: Kecleon

abilities.name: Camouflage
abilities.text: If any basic Energy card attached to Kecleon is the same as the Attacking Pokémon's type, any damage done by attacks from the Pokémon to Kecleon is reduced by 40 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Blind Scratch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does no damage to the Defending Pokémon. Instead, this attack does 20 damage to 1 of your Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: It can freely change its body's color. The zigzag pattern on its belly doesn't change, however.

name: Hitmonchan

attacks.name: Clean Hit
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is an Evolution Pokémon, this attack does 50 more damage.

attacks.name: Bullet Straight Punch
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

flavorText: Its punches slice the air. However, it seems to need a short break after fighting for three minutes.

name: Leafeon

attacks.name: Sprial Drain
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from Leafeon.

attacks.name: Leaf Blade
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage.

flavorText: Just like a plant, it uses photosynthesis. As a result, it is always enveloped in clear air.

abilities.name: Psychoflow
abilities.text: As long as there is a Psychic Energy card attached to Abra, its Retreat Cost is 0.

name: Mankey

attacks.name: Scout
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand.

flavorText: The smallest of things could cause it to lose its temper. Because it doesn't hold in its stress, this Pokémon can live a long time.

attacks.name: Rock Hurl
attacks.text: Don't apply Resistance.

attacks.name: Rock Slide
attacks.text: Choose 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon (1 if he or she has only 1). This attack does 10 damage to each of those Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Houndour

attacks.name: Team Hunt
attacks.text: Draw a card for each of your Houndour in play.

flavorText: To corner prey, they check each other's location using barks that only they can understand.

attacks.name: Growth
attacks.text: Attach a Grass Energy card from your hand to Bulbasaur.

name: Stufful

attacks.name: Jump On
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 more damage.

flavorText: Its fluffy fur is a delight to pet, but carelessly reaching out to touch this Pokémon could result in painful retaliation.

name: Shieldon

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

flavorText: This Pokémon lived in primeval jungles. Few enemies would have been willing to square off against its heavily armored face, so it's thought.

name: Candela
rules: Draw 2 cards. If you drew any cards in this way, flip a coin. If heads, attach a Fire Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
Supporter rule: You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Lampent

attacks.name: Mirror Mirror
attacks.text: Each player either draws or discards cards until that player has 4 cards in his or her hand. (Your opponent does this first.)

attacks.name: Flickering Flames
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

flavorText: It arrives near the moment of death and steals spirit from the body.

name: Skaters' Park
rules: Whenever either player's Active Pokémon retreats, put any basic Energy that would be discarded into their hand instead of the discard pile.

name: Pidgey

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

flavorText: A common sight in forests and woods. It flaps its wings at ground level to kick up blinding sand.

name: Vigoroth

attacks.name: Shatter
attacks.text: Discard a Stadium in play.

flavorText: Its stress level rises if it cannot keep moving constantly. Too much stress makes it feel sick.

name: Monferno

attacks.name: Fire Tail Slap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard a Fire Energy attached to Monferno.

attacks.name: Paralyzing Gaze
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: It skillfully control the intensity of the fire on its tail to keep its foes at an ideal distance.

name: Misdreavus

attacks.name: Ominous Eyes
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

flavorText: What gives meaning to its life is surprising others. If you set your ear against the red orbs around its neck, you can hear shrieking.

name: Shopping Center
rules: Once during each player's turn, that player may put a Pokémon Tool attached to 1 of their Pokémon into their hand.

attacks.name: Teary Eyes
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Ledyba by attacks is reduced by 20.

attacks.name: Quick Turn
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

name: Golbat

attacks.name: Screech
attacks.text: Until the end of your next turn, if an attack damages the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), that attack does 20 more damage to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Poison Bite
attacks.text: If this attack damages the Defending Pokémon, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned and you remove a number of damage counters from Golbat equal to half that damage (rounded up to the nearest 10). If Golbat has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them. Either way, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: It can drink more than 10 ounces of blood at once. If it has too much, it gets heavy and flies clumsily.

name: Woobat

attacks.name: Psy Bolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: Its habitat is dark forests and caves. It emits ultrasonic waves from its nose to learn about its surroundings.

name: Sneasel

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

flavorText: A smart and sneaky Pokémon, it makes its opponents flinch by suddenly showing the claws hidden in its paws.

attacks.name: Yawn
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Mini-Metronome
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. Mini-Metronome copies that attack except for its Energy cost. (You must still do anything else required for that attack.) (No matter what type that Pokémon is, Togepi's type is still Colorless.) Togepi performs that attack.

name: Tornadus

attacks.name: Jet Draft
attacks.text: Discard a Special Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Air Slash
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

flavorText: Tornadus expels massive energy from its tail, causing severe storms. Its power is great enough to blow houses away.

attacks.name: Magnetic Swirl
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

name: Hiding Darkness Energy
rules: As long as this card is attached to a Pokémon, it provides Darkness Energy.
The Darkness Pokémon this card is attached to has no Retreat Cost.

name: Feebas

abilities.name: Submerge
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).

flavorText: Although unattractive and unpopular, this Pokémon's marvelous vitality has made it a subject of research.

name: Holon Circle
rules: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.
Prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done by either player's Active Pokémon. If an Active Pokémon uses an attack, that attack ends, and discard this card.

name: Tepig

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

flavorText: It can deftly dodge its foe's attacks while shooting fireballs from its nose. It roasts berries before it eats them.

name: Rhyhorn

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

flavorText: Its powerful tackles can destroy anything. However, it is too slow witted to help people work.

name: Zubat

attacks.name: Poison Spray
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: While flying, it constantly emits ultrasonic waves from its mouth to check its surroundings.

name: Togepi

attacks.name: Attract Smack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: It transforms the kindness and joy of others into happiness, which it stores in its shell.

attacks.name: Magma Ring
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

name: Numel
flavorText: The magma in its body reaches 2,200 degrees Fahrenheit. Its hump gets smaller when it uses Fire-type moves.

attacks.name: Cat Fleas
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

name: Alolan Vulpix

attacks.name: Beacon
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

flavorText: It exhales air colder than -58 degrees Fahrenheit. Elderly people in Alola call this Pokémon by an older name—Keokeo.

name: Magmar

attacks.name: Controlled Burn
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

flavorText: When angered, it spouts brilliant fire from all over its body. It doesn't calm down until its opponent has burned to ash.

name: Falinks

attacks.name: Cliff Edge Formation
attacks.text: If your opponent has exactly 1 Prize card remaining, this attack does 160 more damage.

flavorText: The six of them work together as one Pokémon. Teamwork is also their battle strategy, and they constantly change their formation as they fight.

attacks.name: Damage Burn
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage.

name: Riolu
flavorText: It knows how people and Pokémon feel by looking at their auras. It doesn't approach dangerous opponents.

name: Pawniard
flavorText: A pack of these Pokémon forms to serve a Bisharp boss. Each Pawniard trains diligently, dreaming of one day taking the lead.

attacks.name: 3-D Attack
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

name: Chansey

attacks.name: Healing Trial
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, remove 3 damage counters from Chansey. If tails, remove 3 damage counters from the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Pulled Punch
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack's base damage is 10 instead of 40.

flavorText: A kindly Pokémon that lays highly nutritious eggs and shares them with injured Pokémon or people.

name: Geodude

attacks.name: Stone Barrage
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: Found in fields and mountains. Mistaking them for boulders, people often step or trip on them.

name: Switch Raft
rules: Switch your Active Water Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If you do, heal 30 damage from the Pokémon you moved to your Bench.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Haunter

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Dream Eater
attacks.text: You can't use this attack unless the Defending Pokémon is Asleep.

flavorText: Because of its ability to slip through block walls, it is said to be from another dimension.

name: Phanpy

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Phanpy.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: Phanpy does 10 damage to itself.

flavorText: It is strong despite its compact size. It can easily pick up and carry an adult human on its back.

name: Lickilicky

attacks.name: Knock Off
attacks.text: Discard a random card from your opponent's hand.

attacks.name: Lickichop
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.

flavorText: It wraps things with its extensible tongue. Getting too close to it will leave you soaked with drool.

name: Mareep
flavorText: Its soft wool coat captures air, allowing it to remain cool during the summer and warm in the winter.

name: Po Town
rules: Whenever any player plays a Pokémon from their hand to evolve 1 of their Pokémon, put 3 damage counters on that Pokémon.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

name: Lt. Surge's Strategy
rules: You can play this card only if you have more Prize cards remaining than your opponent.
During this turn, you can play 3 Supporter cards (including this card).
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

name: Sitrus Berry
rules: Attach Sitrus Berry to 1 of your Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex and Pokémon that has Dark or an owner in its name) that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it. If the Pokémon Sitrus Berry is attached to is Pokémon-ex or has Dark or an owner in its name, discard Sitrus Berry.
At any time between turns, if the Pokémon this card is attached to has at least 3 damage counters on it, remove 3 damage counters from it. Then, discard Sitrus Berry.

name: Eldegoss

attacks.name: Blessing of Fluff
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Grass Energy cards and attach them to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

flavorText: The cotton on the head of this Pokémon can be spun into a glossy, gorgeous yarn—a Galar regional specialty.

name: Cutiefly
flavorText: It feeds on the nectar and pollen of flowers. Because it's able to sense auras, it can identify which flowers are about to bloom.

name: Buizel
rules: Chesto Berry: If Buizel is Asleep, remove the Special Condition Asleep from Buizel at the end of each player's turn.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 30 more damage.

name: Carkol
flavorText: It forms coal inside its body. Coal dropped by this Pokémon once helped fuel the lives of people in the Galar region.

abilities.name: Galactic Switch
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may move an Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon SP to another of your Pokémon. Then, put 2 damage counters on Bronzong G. This power can't be used if Bronzong G is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Psychic Pulse
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Koffing

attacks.name: Foul Gas
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. If tails, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

flavorText: Its thin, balloon-like body is inflated by horribly toxic gases. It reeks when it is nearby.

name: Ekans
flavorText: The older it gets, the longer it grows. At night, it wraps its long body around tree branches to rest.

name: Heracross

attacks.name: Riled Horn
attacks.text: If your opponent has any TAG TEAM Pokémon in play, this attack does 70 more damage.

flavorText: It's proud of its thick horn. In Alola, its biggest rival is Vikavolt, which it's always fighting with.

name: Skitty

attacks.name: Double Slap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: It shows its cute side by chasing its own tail until it gets dizzy.

name: Raichu

attacks.name: Spark
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: When its electricity builds, its muscles are stimulated, and it becomes more aggressive than usual.

abilities.name: Solid Shell
abilities.text: Any damage done to Squirtle by attacks is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Bubblebeam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Mom's Kindness
