rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Chip Off
attacks.text: If your opponent has 6 or more cards in his or her hand, discard a number of cards without looking until your opponent has 5 cards left in his or her hand.

attacks.name: Poor Sleep
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 50 damage plus 30 more damage and Purugly G is now Asleep.

name: Dark Arbok
rules: This Pokémon is both Grass Darkness type.

attacks.name: Swallow Up
attacks.text: Before doing damage, count the remaining HP of the Defending Pokémon and Dark Arbok. If the Defending Pokémon has fewer remaining HP than Dark Arbok's, this attack does 10 damage plus 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Extra Poison
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Pokémon-ex, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned.

name: Furret

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage; if tails, this attack does 20 damage.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: It makes a nest to suit its long and skinny body. The nest is impossible for other Pokémon to enter.

name: Slowpoke

attacks.name: Whimsy Tackle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: It lazes vacantly near water. If something bites its tail, it won't even notice for a whole day.

name: Darkrai

attacks.name: Abyssal Sleep
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep. Your opponent flips 2 coins instead of 1 between turns. If either of them is tails, the Pokémon is still Asleep.

flavorText: It can lull people to sleep and make them dream. It is active during the nights of the new moon.

name: Togepi

attacks.name: Charm
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon attacks during your opponent's next turn, any damage it does is reduced by 10 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Spike Ball Tackle
attacks.text: Togepi does 10 damage to itself.

flavorText: Its shell is said to contain happiness itself, which it will share with those who are kind to it.

name: Claw Fossil
rules: Play Claw Fossil as if it were a Basic Pokémon. While in play Claw Fossil counts as a Colorless Pokémon (as well as a Trainer card). Claw Fossil has no attacks of its own, can't retreat, and can't be affected by any Special Conditions. If Claw Fossil is Knocked Out, it doesn't count as a Knocked Out Pokémon. (Discard it anyway.) At any time during your turn before your attack, you may discard Claw Fossil from play.

abilities.name: Jagged Stone
abilities.text: If Claw Fossil is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Claw Fossil is Knocked Out), put 1 damage counter on the Attacking Pokémon.

name: Trubbish

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Super Poison Breath
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: This Pokémon was born from a bag stuffed with trash. Galarian Weezing relish the fumes belched by Trubbish.

name: Gossifleur

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

flavorText: It whirls around in the wind while singing a joyous song. This delightful display has charmed many into raising this Pokémon.

name: Swinub

attacks.name: Double Headbutt
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: Rooting the tip of its snout into the ground, it searches for food. Sometimes, it even digs up a hot spring.

name: Morpeko

attacks.name: Explosive Discontent
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

flavorText: Hunger hormones affect its temperament. Until its hunger is appeased, it gets up to all manner of evil deeds.

name: Farfetch'd

attacks.name: Hard Swing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

flavorText: It can't live without the stalk it holds. That's why it defends the stalk from attackers with its life.

name: Kabuto

abilities.name: Ancient Guidance
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for Helix Fossil, Dome Fossil, or Old Amber and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Kabuto is affected by a Special Condition.

flavorText: It is thought to have inhabited beaches 300 million years ago. It is protected by a stiff shell.

name: Electrike

attacks.name: Thunder Jolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Electrike does 10 damage to itself.

flavorText: Using electricity stored in its fur, it stimulates its muscles to heighten its reaction speed.

name: Mudkip
flavorText: To alert it, the fin on its head senses the flow of water. It has the strength to heft boulders.

name: Kiawe
rules: Search your deck for up to 4 Fire Energy cards and attach them to 1 of your Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck. Your turn ends.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

name: Energy Retrieval
rules: Trade 1 of the other cards in your hand for up to 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile.

name: Hariyama

abilities.name: Guts
abilities.text: If this Pokémon would be Knocked Out by damage from an attack, flip a coin. If heads, this Pokémon is not Knocked Out, and its remaining HP becomes 10.

flavorText: Hariyama that are big and fat aren’t necessarily strong. There are some small ones that move nimbly and use moves skillfully.

name: Ekans
flavorText: The older it gets, the longer it grows. At night, it wraps its long body around tree branches to rest.

name: Popplio

attacks.name: Disarming Voice
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

flavorText: This Pokémon snorts body fluids from its nose, blowing balloons to smash into its foes. It's famous for being a hard worker.

name: Jubilife Village
rules: Once during each player's turn, that player may shuffle their hand into their deck and draw 5 cards. If they do, their turn ends.

name: Dark Gyarados
rules: This Pokémon is both Water Darkness type.

abilities.name: Dark Scale
abilities.text: If Dark Gyarados is your Active Pokémon and is Knocked Out by an opponent's attack, put 3 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dark Streak
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, each Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Tyrogue
rules: If this Baby Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and your opponent announces an attack, your opponent flips a coin (before doing anything else). If tails, your opponent's turn ends.

attacks.name: Smash Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: It is always bursting with energy. To make itself stronger, it keeps on fighting even if it loses.

name: Lure Ball
rules: Flip 3 coins. For each heads, put an Evolution Pokémon from your discard pile into your hand.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

attacks.name: Haunt
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dark Mind
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Absol

attacks.name: Drag Off
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to the new Active Pokémon.

flavorText: The elderly call it the disaster Pokémon and detest it, but interest in its power to predict disasters is on the rise.

attacks.name: Sonic Noise
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Pokémon-ex, that Pokémon is now Confused.

name: Space Center
rules: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play.
Ignore Poké-Bodies for all Basic Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's) (excluding Pokémon-ex and Pokémon that has an owner in its name).

name: Miltank

abilities.name: Moomoo Malt
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, whenever you attach an Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon, heal 90 damage from that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sitdown Splash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

flavorText: Its milk is high in calories and packed with nutrients. Therefore, if you drink too much of it, you may wind up with a body like Miltank's.

name: Eevee

attacks.name: Palette of Friends
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage for each different type of Pokémon on your Bench.

flavorText: Possessing an unbalanced and unstable genetic makeup, it conceals many possible evolutions.

name: Koffing

attacks.name: Foul Gas
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned; if tails, it is now Confused.

flavorText: Because it stores several kinds of toxic gases in its body, it is prone to exploding without warning.

name: Alolan Geodude

attacks.name: Rock Polish
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon has no Retreat Cost.

flavorText: Its body is a magnetic stone. Iron sand attaches firmly to the portions of its body that are particularly magnetic.

name: Sandshrew

attacks.name: Double Scratch
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Sand Tomb
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

flavorText: Disliking water, it lives in deep burrows in arid areas. It can roll itself instantly into a ball.

name: Yanmega

attacks.name: Nosedive
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

flavorText: This six-legged Pokémon is easily capable of transporting an adult in flight. The wings on its tail help it stay balanced.

name: Deino

attacks.name: Roar
attacks.text: Your opponent switches his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

flavorText: Lacking sight, it's unaware of its surroundings, so it bumps into things and eats anything that moves.

attacks.name: Feint Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy card attached to Houndoom.

name: Diggersby

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

flavorText: The fur on its belly retains heat exceptionally well. People used to make heavy winter clothing from fur shed by this Pokémon.

name: Marshadow & Machamp-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Revenge
attacks.text: If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack during their last turn, this attack does 90 more damage.

attacks.name: Acme of Heroism-GX
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), and if it would be Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack during their next turn, it is not Knocked Out, and its remaining HP becomes 10. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Sudowoodo

attacks.name: Reply Strongly
attacks.text: If this Pokémon was damaged by an attack during your opponent's last turn while it was your Active Pokémon, this attack does 80 more damage.

flavorText: Apparently, the larger the green parts of this Pokémon, the more collectors value it. It's a particular favorite among elderly people.

name: Recycle
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, put a card in your discard pile on top of your deck.

name: Riolu

attacks.name: Smash Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: The aura that emanates from its body intensifies to alert others if it is afraid or sad.

name: Psyduck

attacks.name: Dizziness
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Psyduck but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

flavorText: It is often seen holding its head in its paws, as if it were suffering from a headache.

name: Dark Golduck

attacks.name: Third Eye
attacks.text: Discard 1 Energy card attached to Dark Golduck in order to draw up to 3 cards.

flavorText: When Psyducks evolve, their headaches disappear and they find themselves in possession of formidable mental powers.

name: Shroomish

attacks.name: Worry Seed
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

flavorText: I wonder if I would look a little cuter with a beautiful flower?

attacks.name: Coral Glow
attacks.text: Draw a number of cards up to the number of your opponent's Basic Pokémon in play. (You can't have more than 10 cards in your hand in this way.)

name: Murkrow

attacks.name: Swarm
attacks.text: Search your deck for Murkrow and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Hide Crowd
attacks.text: Switch Murkrow with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

flavorText: It is believed that seeing this Pokémon at night will bring about ominous occurrences.

name: Electrike

attacks.name: Quick Turn
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: Using electricity stored in its fur, it stimulates its muscles to heighten its reaction speed.

name: Beast Bringer
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.

If you have exactly 6 Prize cards remaining, and if your opponent's Active Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX is Knocked Out by damage from an attack of the Ultra Beast this card is attached to, take 1 more Prize card.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

abilities.name: Slippery Skin
abilities.text: As long as the Defending Pokémon is an Evolved Pokémon, Dusparce's Retreat Cost is 0.

attacks.name: Tail Shake
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

name: Nidorina

attacks.name: Quick Blow
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage.

flavorText: It has a calm and caring nature. Because its horn grows slowly, it prefers not to fight.

name: Croagunk

attacks.name: Swagger
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

flavorText: Inflating its poison sacs, it fills the area with an odd sound and hits flinching opponents with a poison jab.

name: Shinx

attacks.name: Under Pressure
attacks.text: If your opponent has 3 or fewer Prize cards remaining, this attack does 50 more damage.

flavorText: All of its fur dazzles if danger is sensed. It flees while the foe is momentarily blinded.

name: Fletchinder
flavorText: From its beak, it expels embers that set the tall grass on fire. Then it pounces on the bewildered prey that pop out of the grass.

name: Armor Fossil
rules: Play Armor Fossil as if it were a Colorless Basic Pokémon. (Armor Fossil counts as a Trainer card as well, but if Armor Fossil is Knocked Out, this counts as a Knocked Out Pokémon.) Armor Fossil can't be affected by any Special Conditions and can't retreat. At any time during your turn before your attack, you may discard Armor Fossil from play. (This doesn't count as a Knocked Out Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Armor Stone
abilities.text: Whenever Armor Fossil would be damaged by your opponent's attack, flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, reduce that damage by 10.

name: Binacle

attacks.name: Swing Around
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

flavorText: They stretch and then contract, yanking their rocks along with them in bold hops. They eat seaweed that washes up on the shoreline.

name: Tangela

attacks.name: Nap
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

flavorText: Many writhing vines cover it, so its true identity remains unknown. The blue vines grow its whole life long.

name: Skorupi

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: It attacks using the claws on its tail. Once locked in its grip, its prey is unable to move as this Pokémon's poison seeps in.

name: Stantler

attacks.name: Mystifying Horns
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Enhanced Horns
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it, this attack does 60 more damage.

flavorText: The curved antlers change the flow of air to create a strange space where reality is distorted.

name: Drifloon

attacks.name: Creepy Wind
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

flavorText: If for some reason its body bursts, its soul spills out with a screaming sound.

name: Jynx

attacks.name: Doubleslap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Meditate
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

flavorText: Merely by meditating, the Pokémon launches a powerful psychic energy attack.

abilities.name: Glowing Screen
abilities.text: As long as Volbeat is in play, any damage done to Illumise by attacks from Fighting Pokémon and Darkness Pokémon is reduced by 30. You can't reduce more than 30 damage even if there is more than 1 Volbeat in play.

attacks.name: Chaotic Noise
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Pester
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

name: Whiscash

attacks.name: Fury
attacks.text: Does 20 damage times the number of damage counters on Whiscash.

attacks.name: Magnitude
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: It is very territorial. It repels foes by setting of tremors that extend over a three-mile radius.

name: Doublade

attacks.name: Double Slash
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 80 damage for each heads.

flavorText: Honedge evolves into twins. The two blades rub together to emit a metallic sound that unnerves opponents.

abilities.name: Energy Connect
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may take a basic Energy card attached to 1 of your Benched Pokémon and attach it to your Active Pokémon. This power can't be used if Ampharos is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Lightning Strike
attacks.text: You may discard all Lightning Energy cards attached to Ampharos. If you do, this attack's base damage is 80 instead of 40.

name: Mandibuzz

attacks.name: Bone Rush
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Blindside
attacks.text: This attack does 100 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: Although it's a bit of a ruffian, this Pokémon will take lost Vullaby under its wing and care for them till they're ready to leave the nest.

name: Staryu
flavorText: An enigmatic Pokémon that can effortlessly regenerate any appendage it loses in battle.

name: Tangela

attacks.name: Nutritional Support
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Grass Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: It tangles any moving thing with its vines. Their subtle shaking is ticklish if you get ensnared.

name: Salandit

attacks.name: Singe
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

flavorText: It burns its bodily fluids to create a poisonous gas. When its enemies become disoriented from inhaling the gas, it attacks them.

name: Rattata

attacks.name: Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: Cautious in the extreme, its hardy vitality lets it live in any kind of environment.

name: Potion Energy
rules: If you play this card from your hand, remove 1 damage counter from the Pokémon you attach it to, if it has any.
Potion Energy provides Colorless energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

attacks.name: Poison Fang
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

name: Charmander

attacks.name: Reprisal
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

flavorText: The flame on its tail indicates Charmander's life force. If it is healthy, the flame burns brightly.

attacks.name: Toxic Grip
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

name: Ash's Pikachu

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Thunder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

flavorText: This form of Pikachu is somewhat rare. It wears the hat of its Trainer, who is also its partner.

name: Minun

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Spark
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: Exposure to electricity from Minun and Plusle promotes blood circulation and relaxes muscles.

name: Tyrogue
rules: If your Active Pokémon is a Baby Pokémon and your opponent announces an attack, your opponent flips a coin (before doing anything else). If tails, your opponent's turn ends.

attacks.name: Energy Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard a Special Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Kartana

attacks.name: Divine Paper
attacks.text: If your opponent has exactly 6 Prize cards remaining, this attack does 90 more damage.

flavorText: One of the Ultra Beast life-forms, it was observed cutting down a gigantic steel tower with one stroke of its blade.

name: Vibrava

abilities.name: Obnoxious Whirring
abilities.text: Whenever your opponent plays a Supporter card from their hand, prevent all effects of that card done to this Pokémon.

flavorText: It vibrates its wings to generate ultrasonic waves, causing its prey to faint. Then it buries the prey alive in the sand to preserve it.

name: Paras
flavorText: No matter how much it eats, the mushrooms growing on its back steal away most of the nutrients it consumes.

name: Great Catcher
rules: You can play this card only if you discard 2 other cards from your hand.
Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX with their Active Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Sidney's Stadium
rules: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.
Each player's Darkness Pokémon can't be Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

name: Ultra Space
rules: Once during each player's turn, that player may search their deck for an Ultra Beast card, reveal it, put it into their hand, and shuffle their deck.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

name: Koffing

attacks.name: Smokescreen
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

flavorText: Its thin, filmy body is filled with gases that cause constant sniffles, coughs and teary eyes.

name: Cherubi

attacks.name: Leech Seed
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

flavorText: The small ball is not only filled with nutrients, it is also tasty. Starly try to peck it off.

name: Larvesta
flavorText: When battling opponents, it sprays fire from its five horns. The max temperature of the flames can reach nearly 5,500 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: Fire Memory
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
The Silvally-GX this card is attached to is a Fire Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Aron

attacks.name: Steel Tackle
attacks.text: Aron does 10 damage to itself.

flavorText: It usually lives deep in mountains. However, hunger may drive it to eat railroad tracks and cars.

name: Deino

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: Lacking sight, it's unaware of its surroundings, so it bumps into things and eats anything that moves.

name: Whirlipede

attacks.name: Continuous Tumble
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: Protected by a hard shell, it spins its body like a wheel and crashes furiously into its enemies.

name: Goldeen

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Goldeen.

attacks.name: Fury Attack
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: Though it appears very elegant when swimming with fins unfurled, it can jab powerfully with its horn.

name: Tapu Koko

attacks.name: Nature Dive
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is an Ultra Beast, this attack does 100 more damage, and discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

flavorText: Although it's called a guardian deity, if a person or Pokémon puts it in a bad mood, it will become a malevolent deity and attack.

name: Roggenrola

attacks.name: Stone Edge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

flavorText: They were discovered a hundred years ago in an earthquake fissure. Inside each one is an energy core.

name: Flabébé
flavorText: It's OK. No one will take away your flower. You look cute even when you're angry.

name: Cessation Crystal
rules: Attach Cessation Crystal to 1 of your Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex) that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it. If the Pokémon Cessation Crystal is attached to is a Pokémon-ex, discard this card.
As long as Cessation Crystal is attached to an Active Pokémon, each player's Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) can't use any Poké-Powers or Poké-Bodies.

abilities.name: Paranoid
abilities.text: As long as Machoke is Confused, Machok's attacks do 50 more damage to the Defending Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Split Kick
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each Defending Pokémon.

name: Aron

attacks.name: Rigidify
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

flavorText: It usually lives deep in mountains. However, hunger may drive it to eat railroad tracks and cars.

name: Drilbur

attacks.name: Focus Fist
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: It brings its claws together and whirls around at high speed before rushing toward its prey.

name: Diglett
flavorText: If a Diglett digs through a field, it leaves the soil perfectly tilled and ideal for planting crops.

name: Chinchou
flavorText: On the dark ocean floor, its only means of communication is its constantly flashing lights.

name: Wailmer

attacks.name: Wave Swallower
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, heal 50 damage from this Pokémon.

flavorText: It shows off by spraying jets of seawater from the nostrils above its eyes. It eats a solid ton of Wishiwashi every day.

name: Porygon2

attacks.name: Destructive Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

flavorText: It was upgraded to enable the exploration of other planets. However, it failed to measure up.

abilities.name: Aqua Lift
abilities.text: If Lombre has any Water Energy attached to it, the Retreat Cost for Lombre is 0.

attacks.name: Ambush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Paint Trick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused. Then, choose 1 of your Benched Pokémon and switch Smeargle with it.

attacks.name: Doublslap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

name: Poochyena

attacks.name: Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: A Pokémon with a persistent nature, it chases its chosen prey until the prey becomes exhausted.

name: Spicy Seasoned Curry
rules: Your Active Pokémon is now Burned. Heal 40 damage from it.
Item rule: You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Shiftry

abilities.name: Giant Fan
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. Your opponent shuffles that Pokémon and all cards attached to it into his or her deck.

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

flavorText: By flapping its leafy fan, it can whip up gusts of 100 ft/second that can level houses.

name: Gallade Spirit Link
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
Your turn does not end if the Pokémon this card is attached to becomes M Gallade-EX.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Kakuna

abilities.name: Grass Cushion
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has any Grass Energy attached to it, it takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

flavorText: Almost incapable of moving, this Pokémon can only harden its shell to protect itself when it is in danger.

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Giant Claw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Kindle
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy card attached to Numel and then discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

name: Croagunk

attacks.name: Frog Hop
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

flavorText: Its cheeks hold poison sacs. It tries to catch foes off guard to jab them with toxic fingers.

name: Rapid Strike Style Mustard
rules: You can play this card only when it is the last card in your hand.
Put a Rapid Strike Pokémon from your discard pile onto your Bench. If you do, draw 5 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Passimian

attacks.name: Spike Draw
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

flavorText: They use their saliva to stick leaves to their shoulders. You can tell what troop they belong to from the position of the leaves.

name: Geodude

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage time the number of damage counters on this Pokémon.

flavorText: Found in fields and mountains. Mistaking them for boulders, people often step or trip on them.

name: Zisu
rules: Draw cards until you have 1 more card in your hand than your opponent.
Supporter rule: You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Loudred

attacks.name: Energy Press
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

flavorText: It shouts loudly by inhaling air, and then using its well-developed stomach muscles to exhale.

name: Finneon
flavorText: The line running down its side can store sunlight. It shines vividly at night.

name: Donphan

attacks.name: Rock Hurl
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Double Spin
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 70 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: It has sharp, hard tusks and a rugged hide. Its tackle is strong enough to knock down a house.

name: Magmar

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

flavorText: Found near the mouth of a volcano. This fire-breather's body temperature is nearly 2,200 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: Lanturn

attacks.name: Special Tackle
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Special Energy attached to it, this attack does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Extreme Current
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

flavorText: Lanturn's light can shine up from great depths. It is nicknamed "The Deep-Sea Star."

name: Amoonguss

abilities.name: Sporprise
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may use this Ability. If you do, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Rising Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

flavorText: It lures prey close by dancing and waving its arm caps, which resemble Poké Balls, in a swaying motion.

attacks.name: Hypnoblast
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

name: Muk

abilities.name: Poison Sacs
abilities.text: The Special Condition Poisoned is not removed when your opponent's Pokémon evolve or devolve.

attacks.name: Toxic Secretion
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 2 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns.

flavorText: Their food sources have decreased, and their numbers have declined sharply. Sludge ponds are being built to prevent their extinction.

attacks.name: Bone Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Tepig

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

flavorText: It blows fire through its nose. When it catches a cold, the fire becomes pitch-black smoke instead.

name: Team Yell Grunt
rules: Put an Energy attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon into their hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Elgyem

attacks.name: Calm Mind
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

flavorText: This Pokémon had never been seen until it appeared from far in the desert 50 years ago.

name: Bede
rules: Attach a basic Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Vigoroth

attacks.name: Wake-up Punch
attacks.text: If Vigoroth evolved from Slakoth during this turn and Slakoth was Asleep, this attack's base damage is 60 instead of 10.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: Its heart beats at a tenfold tempo, so it cannot sit still even for a moment.

name: Piloswine

attacks.name: Charge Dash
attacks.text: You may do 30 damage plus 30 more damage. If you do, Piloswine does 30 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Icy Wind
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

flavorText: Its shaggy coat makes it unable to see. It checks surroundings with its sensitive nose instead.

name: Dragonair

attacks.name: Wrap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Rising Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage.

flavorText: If its body takes on an aura, the weather changes instantly. It is said to live in seas and lakes.

name: Rattata
flavorText: Bites anything when it attacks. Small and very quick, it is a common sight in many places.

attacks.name: Mega Peck
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Bronzor

attacks.name: Dull Light
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

flavorText: Implements shaped like it were discovered in ancient tombs. It is unknown if they are related.

name: Tentacruel

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Jellyfish Sting
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: The tentacles are normally kept short. On hunts, the are extended to ensnare and immobilize prey.

name: Kirlia

attacks.name: Psychic Research
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for a Supporter card and use the effect of that card as the effect of this attack. (The Supporter card remains in your discard pile.)

attacks.name: Telekinesis
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

flavorText: It is highly perceptive of its Trainer's feelings. It dances when it is feeling happy.

attacks.name: Searing Flame
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

name: Marshtomp

attacks.name: Endeavor
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

flavorText: Living on muddy ground that provides poor footing has made its legs sturdy.

name: Magneton

attacks.name: Metal Sound
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

flavorText: The stronger electromagnetic waves from the three linked Magnemite are enough to dry out surrounding moisture.

name: Oshawott

attacks.name: Razor Shell
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

flavorText: The scalchop on its stomach is made from the same elements as claws. It detaches the scalchop for use as a blade.

name: Choy
rules: Each player reveals their hand. Draw 3 cards.
Supporter rule: You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Drifloon

attacks.name: Triple Spin
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

flavorText: Said to lure away young children and carry them off to the afterlife. Some whisper that Drifloon are formed of reincarnated human souls, but these rumors are as yet unconfirmed.

name: Flabébé

attacks.name: Secret Blessings
attacks.text: Shuffle 3 in any combination of Pokémon and basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your deck.

flavorText: When it finds a flower it likes, it dwells on that flower its whole life long. It floats in the wind's embrace with an untroubled heart.

attacks.name: Drizzle
attacks.text: If you have Water Energy cards in your hand, attach as many Water Energy cards as you like to any of your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Max Bubbles
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Energy attached to all of your Active Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Steady Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

name: Minccino
flavorText: These Pokémon prefer a tidy habitat. They are always sweeping and dusting, using their tails as brooms.

name: Bunnelby
flavorText: They use their large ears to dig burrows. They will dig the whole night through.

name: Snover
flavorText: The berries that grow around its belly are like ice pops. Galarian Darumaka absolutely love these berries.

name: Professor Elm's Lecture
rules: Search your deck for up to 3 Pokémon with 60 HP or less, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

name: Duskull

attacks.name: Dark Guidance
attacks.text: Put a Basic Pokémon from your discard pile onto your Bench.

flavorText: It doggedly pursues its prey wherever it goes. However, the chase is abandoned at sunrise.

name: Plasma Energy
rules: This card provides Colorless Energy.

attacks.name: Corner
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat until the end of your opponent's next turn.

name: Mienfoo
flavorText: In fights, they dominate with onslaughts of flowing, continuous attack. With their sharp claws, they cut enemies.

name: Lampent

attacks.name: Luring Light
attacks.text: Switch the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

flavorText: This ominous Pokémon is feared. Through cities it wanders, searching for the spirits of the fallen.

name: Gabite

attacks.name: Sand Tomb
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

flavorText: As it digs to expand its nest, it habitually digs up gems that it then hoards in its nest.

name: Doublade

attacks.name: Cut Down
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

flavorText: The two swords employ a strategy of rapidly alternating between offense and defense to bring down their prey.

name: Chansey

attacks.name: Healing Pirouette
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from each of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sympathetic Slap
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has any damage counters on it before this attack does damage, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: Not only are these Pokémon fast runners, they're also few in number, so anyone who finds one must be lucky indeed.

name: Minccino
flavorText: The way it brushes away grime with its tail can be helpful when cleaning. But its focus on spotlessness can make cleaning more of a hassle.

name: Lillipup

attacks.name: Pickup
attacks.text: Put an Item card from your discard pile into your hand.

flavorText: It faces strong opponents with great courage. But, when at a disadvantage in a fight, this intelligent Pokémon flees.

name: Arbok

abilities.name: Last Pattern
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, discard 2 random cards from your opponent's hand.

attacks.name: Rocket Tail
attacks.text: If Jessie & James is in your discard pile, this attack does 80 more damage.

flavorText: The latest research has determined that there are over 20 possible arrangements of the patterns on its stomach.

name: Cherubi

attacks.name: Sleep Powder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Leech Seed
attacks.text: If this attack does any damage to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), remove 1 damage counter from Cherubi.

flavorText: The small ball holds the nutrients needed for evolution. Apparently, it is very sweet and tasty.

attacks.name: Minimize
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Shellder by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Random Receiver
rules: Reveal cards from the top of your deck until you reveal a Supporter card. Put it into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Vanillite

attacks.name: Jump On
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

flavorText: Theoretically, this Pokémon formed from icicles bathed in energy from the morning sun. Their breath is -58° F.

name: Poliwhirl

attacks.name: Double Slap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

flavorText: It marches over the land in search of bug Pokémon to eat. Then it takes them underwater so it can dine on them where it's safe.

abilities.name: Duplicate
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for another Ditto and switch it with Ditto. (Any cards attached to Ditto, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) If you do, put Ditto on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Duplicate Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Copy
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. Copy copies that attack. This attack does nothing if Ditto doesn't have the Energy necessary to use that attack. (You must still do anything else required for that attack.) Ditto performs that attack.

name: Challenge!
rules: Ask your opponent if he or she accepts your challenge. If your opponent declines (or if both Benches are full), draw 2 cards. If your opponent accepts, each of you searches your decks for any number of Basic Pokémon cards and puts them face down onto your Benches. (A player can't do this if his or her Bench is full.) When you both have finished, shuffle your decks and turn those cards face up.

name: Pokémon Ranger
rules: Remove all effects of attacks on each player and his or her Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

name: Yamask

attacks.name: Haunt
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

flavorText: Each of them carries a mask that used to be its face when it was human. Sometimes they look at it and cry.

name: Sobble
flavorText: When scared, this Pokémon cries. Its tears pack the chemical punch of 100 onions, and attackers won't be able to resist weeping.

name: Glameow

attacks.name: Caturday
attacks.text: Draw a card. If you do, this Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Boing Boing Tail
attacks.text: This attack does 60 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: It claws if displeased and purrs when affectionate. Its fickleness is very popular among some.

name: Professor Oak's Visit
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Draw 3 cards. Then, choose a card from your hand and put it on the bottom of your deck.

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Lightning Strike
attacks.text: You may discard all Lightning Energy cards attached to Jolteon. If you do, this attack's base damage is 70 instead of 40.

name: Kakuna

attacks.name: Stiffen
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Kakuna during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: Almost incapable of moving, this Pokémon can only harden its shell to protect itself from predators.

name: Onix

attacks.name: Guard Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

flavorText: It rapidly bores through the ground at 50 mph by squirming and twisting its massive, rugged body.

name: Enhanced Hammer
rules: Discard a Special Energy from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Drizzile

attacks.name: Bounce
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

flavorText: Highly intelligent but also very lazy, it keeps enemies out of its territory by laying traps everywhere.

name: Caterpie

attacks.name: String Shot
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: Its short feet are tipped with suction pads that enable it to tirelessly climb slopes and walls.

attacks.name: Double Chop
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Calm Mind
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters from Meditite (remove 1 if there is only 1).

name: Sewaddle
flavorText: Since this Pokémon makes its own clothes out of leaves, it is a popular mascot for fashion designers.

name: Torchic
flavorText: A fire burns inside, so it feels very warm to hug. It launches fireballs of 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: Eevee

attacks.name: Continuous Steps
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

flavorText: Thanks to its unstable genetic makeup, this special Pokémon conceals many different possible evolutions.

name: Drifloon

attacks.name: Minimize
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Drifloon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Pull
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, switch the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

flavorText: It is whispered that any child who mistakes Drifloon for a balloon and holds on to it could wind up missing.

attacks.name: Angry Horn
attacks.text: If there are 4 or more damage counters on Heracross, this attack's base damage is 50 instead of 30.

name: Tangela

attacks.name: Bind Down
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

flavorText: Many writhing vines cover it, so its true identity remains unknown. The blue vines grow its whole life long.

name: Nidorino

attacks.name: Toxic
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 2 damage counters instead of 1 on the Defending Pokémon between turns.

attacks.name: Frustration
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon that doesn't have any damage counters on it. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: It has a violent disposition and stabs foes with its horn, which oozes poison upon impact.

name: Donphan

abilities.name: Sturdy
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has full HP and would be Knocked Out by damage from an attack, this Pokémon is not Knocked Out, and its remaining HP becomes 10.

attacks.name: Rolling Spin
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Rolling Spin attack does 70 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

flavorText: The longer and bigger its tusks, the higher its rank in its herd. The tusks take long to grow.

name: Metagross

abilities.name: Magnetic Warp
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If you do, your opponent switches his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Iron Cannon
attacks.text: You may discard all Metal Energy attached to this Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 80 more damage.

flavorText: Metang combined to form it. With four brains, it has the intelligence of a supercomputer.

name: Dodrio

abilities.name: Retreat Aid
abilities.text: As long as Dodrio is Benched, pay Colorless less to retreat your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Dodrio.

flavorText: Uses its three brains to execute complex plans. While two heads sleep, one head stays awake.

name: Totodile

attacks.name: Aqua Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Water Energy attached to Totodile. This attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

flavorText: It is small but rough and tough. It won't hesitate to take a bite out of anything that moves.

name: PlusPower
rules: During this turn, your Pokémon's attacks do 10 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

attacks.name: Cry for Help
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Fire Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex), show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Fireworks
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard a Fire Energy attached to Torkoal.

name: Luxray

attacks.name: Raid
attacks.text: If this Pokémon evolved from Luxio during this turn, this attack does 100 more damage.

flavorText: Luxray's ability to see through objects comes in handy when it's scouting for danger.

name: Lickitung

attacks.name: Tongue Whip
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: Its long tongue, slathered with a gooey saliva, sticks to anything, so it is very useful.

name: Dangerous Energy
rules: This card can only be attached to Darkness Pokémon. This card provides Darkness Energy only while this card is attached to a Darkness Pokémon.

Whenever the Darkness Pokémon this card is attached to is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an attack from your opponent's Pokémon-EX (even if that Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 2 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon-EX.
(If this card is attached to anything other than a Darkness Pokémon, discard this card.)

name: Toxel

attacks.name: Tight Jaw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: It stores poison in an internal poison sac and secretes that poison through its skin. If you touch this Pokémon, a tingling sensation follows.

name: Trubbish

attacks.name: Acid Spray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

flavorText: Inhaling the gas they belch will make you sleep for a week. They prefer unsanitary places.

abilities.name: Emerge
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for an Evolution card named Koga's Beedrill and put it on Koga's Kakuna. (This counts as evolving Koga's Kakuna.) Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Koga's Kakuna is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Toxic Secretion
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. It now takes 20 Poison damage instead of 10 after each player's turn (even if it was already Poisoned).

name: Charmeleon

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: In the rocky mountains where Charmeleon live, their fiery tails shine at night like stars.

name: Ralts

attacks.name: Mind Bend
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

flavorText: If its horns capture the warm feelings of people or Pokémon, its body warms up slightly.

name: Electabuzz

attacks.name: Shock Bolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard all Lightning Energy attached to Electabuzz.

flavorText: Its body constantly discharges electricity. Getting close to it will make your hair stand on end.

name: Lucky Egg
rules: Attach Lucky Egg to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it. If that Pokémon is Knocked Out, discard this card.
When the Pokémon this card is attached to is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, draw cards until you have 7 cards in your hand.

name: Dwebble

attacks.name: Sharp Claws
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

flavorText: It first tries to find a rock to live in, but if there are no suitable rocks to be found, Dwebble may move in to the ports of a Hippowdon.

name: Tangrowth

attacks.name: Grind
attacks.text: Does 20 damage times the number of Energy attached to Tangrowth.

attacks.name: Plow Over
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, put 1 Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon in the Lost Zone.

flavorText: Its vines grow so profusely that, in the warm season, you can't even see its eyes.

name: Rolycoly

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

flavorText: It can race around like a unicycle, even on rough, rocky terrain. Burning coal sustains it.

name: Electrode

attacks.name: Orb Collector
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

flavorText: It stores an overflowing amount of electric energy inside its body. Even a small shock makes it explode.

attacks.name: Growth Spurt
attacks.text: Attach a Grass Energy card from your hand to Seedot.

attacks.name: Trip Over
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

attacks.name: Surprise Slash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, look at your opponent's hand. If he or she has any Trainer cards there, choose 1 of them. You opponent shuffles that card into his or her deck.

attacks.name: Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Stunky

attacks.name: Poison Gas
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: It sprays a nose-curling, stinky fluid from its rear to repel attackers.

name: Diglett
flavorText: Lives about three feet underground, where it feeds on plant roots. It sometimes appears above ground.

name: Beheeyem

attacks.name: Mind Bullet
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon times the amount of Energy attached to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

flavorText: It uses psychic power to control an opponent's brain and tamper with its memories.

name: Lampent

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

flavorText: It arrives near the moment of death and steals spirit from the body.

name: Shelgon

attacks.name: Knock Away
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

flavorText: Within its rugged shell, its cells have begun changing. The shell peels off the instant it evolves.

name: Azumarill

attacks.name: Deep Dive
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, heal 40 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Aqua Sonic
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

flavorText: Its long ears are superb sensors. It can distinguish the movements of things in water and tell what they are.

name: Golurk

attacks.name: Dig Out
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your deck. If that card is a Fighting Energy card, attach it to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Double Lariat
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 90 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: It flies across the sky at Mach speeds. Removing the seal on its chest makes its internal energy go out of control.

name: Vullaby

attacks.name: Leer
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: Their wings are too tiny to allow them to fly. They guard their posteriors with bones that were gathered by Mandibuzz.

name: Sandslash

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: Curls up into a spiny ball when threatened. It can roll while curled up to attack or escape.

name: Nidoran ♂

attacks.name: Hit Back
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has no damage counters on it, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: It scans its surroundings by raising its ears out of the grass. Its toxic horn is for protection.

name: Weedle

attacks.name: Multiply
attacks.text: Search your deck for Weedle and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

flavorText: Its poison stinger is very powerful. Its bright-colored body is intended to warn off its enemies.

name: Lotad

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

flavorText: Its leaf grew too large for it to live on land. That is how it began to live floating in the water.

name: Mienfoo

attacks.name: Triple Smash
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 times the number of heads.

flavorText: They has mastered elegant combos. As they concentrate, their battle moves become swifter and more precise.

name: Litten

attacks.name: Caturday
attacks.text: Draw a card. If you do, this Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Big Bite
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

flavorText: If you try too hard to get close to it, it won't open up to you. Even if you do grow close, giving it too much affection is still a no-no.

name: Seel
flavorText: It has always been supposed that Seel live only in cold seas. Their having shown up in Alola is a mystery.

name: Pokémon Nurse
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Remove all damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon. Then discard all Energy cards attached to it, if any.

name: Whiscash

attacks.name: Thrash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon also does 60 damage to itself. If heads, this attack does 60 more damage.

flavorText: It makes its nest at the bottom of swamps. It will eat anything—if it is alive, Whiscash will eat it.

name: Great Ball
rules: Look at the top 7 cards of your deck. You may reveal a Pokémon you find there and put it into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

attacks.name: Growth
attacks.text: Attach a Grass Energy card from your hand to Bulbasaur.

name: Cutiefly

attacks.name: Fly Around
attacks.text: If any damage is done to this Pokémon by attacks during your opponent's next turn, flip a coin. If heads, prevent that damage.

flavorText: It feeds on the nectar and pollen of flowers. Because it's able to sense auras, it can identify which flowers are about to bloom.

name: Farfetch'd

attacks.name: Leek Slap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. Either way, you can't use this attack again as long as Farfetch'd stays in play (even putting Farfetch'd on the Bench won't let you use it again).

flavorText: The sprig of green onions it holds is its weapon. This sprig is used much like a metal sword.

name: Tropius

attacks.name: Return
attacks.text: Draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand.

attacks.name: Energy Press
attacks.text: Does 20 more damage for each Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

flavorText: It flies by flapping its broad leaves and gives the sweet, delicious fruit around its neck to children.

name: Energy Removal
rules: Choose 1 Energy card attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon and discard it.

name: Vulpix

attacks.name: Fire Soul
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: It controls balls of fire. As it grows, its six tails split from their tips to make more tails.

name: Relicanth

attacks.name: Deep Sea Search
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Pokémon Tool cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

flavorText: A rare Pokémon discovered during a deep-sea exploration. It has not changed in over 100 million years.

name: Morpeko

attacks.name: Explosive Discontent
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

flavorText: Hunger hormones affect its temperament. Until its hunger is appeased, it gets up to all manner of evil deeds.

name: Eldegoss

attacks.name: Sunny Wind
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

flavorText: The cotton on the head of this Pokémon can be spun into a glossy, gorgeous yarn—a Galar regional specialty.

name: Cinccino

attacks.name: Captivate
attacks.text: Switch the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Fluffy Tail
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

flavorText: Their white fur feels amazing to touch. Their fur repels dust and prevents static electricity from building up.

name: Eelektrik

attacks.name: Small Appetite
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon's maximum HP is 100 or more, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: It wraps itself around its prey and paralyzes it with electricity from the round spots on its sides. Then it chomps.

name: Silcoon

attacks.name: Harden
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, If Silcoon would be damaged by an attack, prevent that attack's damage done to Silcoon if that damage is 30 or less.

attacks.name: Entangling String
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

flavorText: It anchors itself by wrapping twigs with the silk from its body. It motionlessly awaits evolution.

name: Cottonee
flavorText: It shoots cotton from its body to protect itself. If it gets caught up in hurricane-strength winds, it can get sent to the other side of the Earth.

name: Beedrill

attacks.name: Twineedle
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Paralyze Poison
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is also Paralyzed.

flavorText: It can take down any opponent with its powerful poison stingers. It sometimes attacks in swarms.

attacks.name: Bind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Darkness Energy
rules: If the Pokémon Darkness Energy is attached to attacks, the attack does 10 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance). Ignore this Effect if the Pokémon that Darkness Energy is attached to isn't Darkness. Darkness Energy provides Darkness Energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

name: Hoppip

attacks.name: Multiply
attacks.text: Search your deck for Hoppip and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

flavorText: It drifts on winds. It is said that when Hoppip gather in fields and mountains, spring is on the way.

name: Fairy Charm Fighting
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
Prevent all damage done to the Fairy Pokémon this card is attached to by attacks from your opponent's Fighting Pokémon-GX and Fighting Pokémon-EX.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Ninetales

attacks.name: Flame Cloak
attacks.text: Attach a Fire Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

flavorText: It is said to live 1,000 years, and each of its tails is loaded with supernatural powers.

name: Metagross

abilities.name: Gravitation
abilities.text: Each Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's) gets -20 HP. No more than 20 HP can be reduced by all Gravitation Poké-Bodies.

attacks.name: Geo Impact
attacks.text: If you have a Stadium card in play, this attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that is the same type as the Defending Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: Metang combined to form it. With four brains, it has the intelligence of a supercomputer.

name: Shinx

abilities.name: Evolutionary Advantage
abilities.text: If you go second, this Pokémon can evolve during your first turn.

flavorText: All of its fur dazzles if danger is sensed. It flees while the foe is momentarily blinded.

name: Silcoon

attacks.name: String Shot
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: It drinks dew that collects on its silk and waits for evolution. Its hard cocoon repels attacks.

name: Mime Jr.

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Mr. Mime from your hand onto Mime Jr. (this counts as evolving Mime Jr.) and remove all damage counters from Mime Jr.

attacks.name: Mime
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw a number of cards equal to the number of cards in your opponent's hand.

flavorText: It habitually mimics foes. Once mimicked, the foe cannot take its eyes off this Pokémon.

name: Skyla
rules: Search your deck for a Trainer card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

attacks.name: Smokescreen
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

name: Duskull

abilities.name: Spiritborne Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard 3 cards from your hand. If you do, search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Ominous Eyes
attacks.text: Put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

flavorText: It doggedly pursues its prey wherever it goes. However, the chase is abandoned at sunrise.

name: Cottonee

attacks.name: Cotton Guard
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

flavorText: When attacked, it escapes by shooting cotton from its body. The cotton serves as a decoy to distract the attacker.

name: Croagunk

attacks.name: Knock Off
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking and discard it.

attacks.name: Nimble
attacks.text: If you have Turtwig in play, remove from Croagunk the number of damage counters equal to the damage you did to the Defending Pokémon.

flavorText: Inflating its poison sacs, it makes an eerie blubbering sound for intimidation.

name: Dustox

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Twilight Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned.

flavorText: It violently flutters its wings to scatter toxic dust when attacked. It becomes active after sunset.

attacks.name: Yawn
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

name: Koffing

attacks.name: Offensive Gas
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Gas Bomb
attacks.text: Koffing does 30 damage to itself, and don't apply Weakness and Resistance to this damage.

flavorText: Lighter-than-air gases in its body keep it aloft. The gases not only smell, they are also explosive.

name: Tropius

attacks.name: Bonus Leaf
attacks.text: Remove 3 damage counters from each of your Benched Pokémon that has any Grass Energy attached to it.

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

flavorText: Because it continually ate only its favorite fruit, the fruit started growing around its neck.

name: Seel

attacks.name: Icy Wind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

flavorText: A Pokémon that lives on icebergs. It swims in the sea using the point on its head to break up ice.

name: Salamence V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Swoop Across
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Ferroseed
flavorText: It defends itself by launching spikes, but its aim isn't very good at first. Only after a lot of practice will it improve.

name: Wooloo

attacks.name: Knock Away
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 more damage.

flavorText: If its fleece grows too long, Wooloo won’t be able to move. Cloth made with the wool of this Pokémon is surprisingly strong.

name: Growlithe
flavorText: While it's quite friendly toward humans once it's grown used to them, in the wild it must be quite fierce to defend its territory from Rockruff.

name: Duosion
flavorText: Since they have two divided brains, at times they suddenly try to take two different actions at once.

name: Zygarde

attacks.name: Rumble
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Geostrike
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: It's hypothesized that it's monitoring those who destroy the ecosystem from deep in the cave where it lives.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Plusle during your opponent's next turn.

name: Chikorita
flavorText: Its pleasantly aromatic leaf has the ability to check the humidity and temperature.

name: Low Pressure System
rules: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play.
Each Grass and Lightning Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's) gets +10 HP.

name: Riolu
flavorText: It can discern the physical and emotional states of people, Pokémon, and other natural things from the shape of their aura waves.

name: Hippopotas

attacks.name: Eleventh Hour Tackle
attacks.text: If there are 3 or fewer cards in your deck, this attack does 130 more damage.

flavorText: It enshrouds itself with sand to protect itself from germs. It does not enjoy getting wet.

name: Zebstrika
flavorText: They have lightning-like movements. When Zebstrika run at full speed, the sound of thunder reverberates.

name: Rainbow Energy
rules: This card provides Colorless Energy. While in play, this card provides every type of Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time. When you attach this card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon, put 1 damage counter on that Pokémon.

name: Pachirisu

attacks.name: Trans Tail
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for a Lightning Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand.

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: It makes electricity with pouches in its cheeks and shoots charges from its tail. It lives atop trees.

attacks.name: Sniff Out
attacks.text: Put any 1 card from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Quick Blow
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

abilities.name: Duplicate
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for another Ditto and switch it with Ditto. (Any cards attached to Ditto, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) If you do, put Ditto on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Duplicate Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Linear Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Skitty

attacks.name: Heal Bell
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: Skitty does 10 damage to itself.

flavorText: It can't stop itself from chasing moving things, and it runs in a circle, chasing its own tail.

abilities.name: Dense
abilities.text: Any damage done to Quagsire by attacks from your opponent's Evolved Pokémon is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Rock Hurl
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Shell Grab
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Lively Grouping
attacks.text: Search your deck for any number of Magikarp, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Raging Fin
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Magikarp and Gyarados in your discard pile.

name: Energy Switch
rules: Move a basic Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.

name: Blitzle

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

flavorText: Its mane shines when it discharges electricity. They use their flashing manes to communicate with one another.

name: Makuhita

attacks.name: Continuous Slap
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: It toughens its body by slamming into thick trees. Many snapped trees can be found near its nest.

name: Flabébé

attacks.name: Aromatherapy
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from each of your Pokémon.

flavorText: It draws out and controls the hidden power of flowers. The flower Flabébé holds is most likely part of its body.

name: Spearow
flavorText: Due to its short wings, it can't fly long distances. It wanders about restlessly and pecks at bug Pokémon.

name: Starly
flavorText: Because they are weak individually, they form groups. However, they bicker if the group grows too big.

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Hustle Belt
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.

If the Pokémon this card is attached to has 30 HP or less remaining and has any damage counters on it, its attacks do 60 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Sunkern

attacks.name: Leech Seed
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

flavorText: It may plummet from the sky. If attacked by a Spearow, it will violently shake its leaves.

name: Town Map
rules: Turn all of your Prize cards face up. (Those Prize cards remain face up for the rest of the game.)
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Venonat

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

flavorText: Its big eyes are actually clusters of tiny eyes. At night, its kind is drawn by light.

name: Espurr

attacks.name: Focused Wish
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

flavorText: There's enough psychic power in Espurr to send a wrestler flying, but because this power can't be controlled, Espurr finds it troublesome.

abilities.name: Power Circulation
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your discard pile for a basic Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it on top of your deck. If you do, put 1 damage counter on Sealeo. This power can't be used if Sealeo is affected by a Special Condition.

name: Energy Switch
rules: Move a basic Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.

name: Bounsweet
flavorText: When under attack, it secretes a sweet and delicious sweat. The scent only calls more enemies to it.

name: Tangela

attacks.name: Bind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Poison Powder
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: Blue plant vines cloak the Pokémon's identity in a tangled mass. It entangles anything that gets close.

name: Meowstic

attacks.name: Energy Present
attacks.text: Attach up to 2 Energy cards from your hand to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

flavorText: The eyeball patterns on the interior of its ears emit psychic energy. It keeps the patterns tightly covered because that power is too immense.

name: Lugia-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Overflow
abilities.text: If your opponent's Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from an attack of this Pokémon, take 1 more Prize card.

attacks.name: Plasma Gale
attacks.text: Discard a Plasma Energy attached to this Pokémon. If you can't discard a Plasma Energy, this attack does nothing.

name: Krabby
flavorText: It lives in burrows dug on sandy beaches. Its pincers fully grow back if they are broken in battle.

name: Cyrus's Conspiracy
