rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.

Search your deck for a Supporter card, a basic Energy card, and a Trainer card that has Team Galactic's Invention in its name, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Smelly Gas
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each Benched Pokémon (including your own). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Lake Boundary
rules: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.
Apply Weakness for each Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) as ×2 instead.

name: Good Manners
rules: In order to play this card, you can't have any Basic Pokémon cards in your hand. Show your hand to your opponent, then search your deck for a Basic Pokémon card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Kricketune

attacks.name: Improvisational Performance
attacks.text: If you have exactly 1 card in your hand, this attack does 100 more damage. If you have exactly 3 cards in your hand, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused. If you have exactly 6 cards in your hand, this attack does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: It crosses its knifelike arms in front of its chest when it cries. It can compose melodies ad lib.

name: Voltorb

attacks.name: Magnetic Bomb
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage. If tails, Voltorb does 10 damage to itself.

flavorText: It rolls to move. If the ground is uneven, a sudden jolt from hitting a bump can cause it to explode.

name: Mantyke

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Mantine from your hand onto Mantyke (this counts as evolving Mantyke) and remove all damage counters from Mantyke.

attacks.name: Call for Friends
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Water Basic Pokémon, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

flavorText: A friendly Pokémon that captures the subtle flows of seawater using its two antennae.

abilities.name: Chaos Flash
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Golduck is your Active Pokémon, you may flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon (choose 1 if there are 2) is now Confused. This power can't be used if Golduck is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Special Blow
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Special Energy cards attached to it, this attack does 30 damage plus 40 more damage.

name: Pokémon Reversal
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent switches 1 of his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Darkness Call
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon, if any.

name: Geodude

attacks.name: Defense Curl
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks during your opponent's next turn.

flavorText: Geodude that have lived a long life have had all their edges smoothed out until they're totally round. They also have a calm, quiet disposition.

name: Kricketune

attacks.name: Screech
attacks.text: During your next turn, any damage done to the Defending Pokémon by attacks is increased by 60 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

flavorText: It signals its emotions with its melodies. Scientists are studying these melodic patterns.

name: Sunflora

attacks.name: Petal Dance
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads. Sunflora is now Confused (after doing damage).

flavorText: It converts sunlight into energy. In the darkness after sunset, it closes its petals and becomes still.

name: Unown X

abilities.name: X-RAY
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if you have Unown X on your Bench, you may look at the top card of your opponent's deck and put it back on top of his or her deck.

attacks.name: Hidden Power
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: Shaped like ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or UNOWN came first.

name: Drifloon

attacks.name: Sneaky Placement
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

flavorText: Because of the way it floats aimlessly, an old folktale calls it a "Signpost for Wandering Spirits."

name: Super Rod
rules: Shuffle 3 in any combination of Pokémon and basic Energy cards from your discard pile back into your deck.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Ferroseed

attacks.name: Harden
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if this Pokémon would be damaged by an attack, prevent that attack's damage done to this Pokémon if that damage is 60 or less.

flavorText: It absorbs the iron it finds in the rock while clinging to the ceiling. It shoots spikes when in danger.

name: Paras
flavorText: No matter how much it eats, the mushrooms growing on its back steal away most of the nutrients it consumes.

name: Pidove

attacks.name: Scout
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals his or her hand.

flavorText: These Pokémon live in cities. They are accustomed to people. Flocks often gather in parks and plazas.

name: Tangela

attacks.name: Nap
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

flavorText: Many writhing vines cover it, so its true identity remains unknown. The blue vines grow its whole life long.

name: Chinchou

attacks.name: Spark
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: It lives in the depths beyond the reach of sunlight. It flashes lights on its antennae to communicate with others of its kind.

name: Rusted Shield
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached.
The Zamazenta V this card is attached to gets +70 HP.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Reserved Ticket
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a card, shuffle your deck, then put that card on top of it.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Heal Energy
rules: Heal Energy provides Colorless Energy. When you attach this card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon, remove 1 damage counter and all Special Conditions from that Pokémon. If Heal Energy is attached to Pokémon-ex, Heal Energy has no effect other than providing Energy.

name: Snover
flavorText: It lives on snowy mountains. It sinks its legs into the snow to absorb water and keep its own temperature down.

name: Drifloon

attacks.name: Creepy Wind
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

flavorText: If for some reason its body bursts, its soul spills out with a screaming sound.

attacks.name: Poison Claws
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Seedot

attacks.name: Bide
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, if this Pokémon would be Knocked Out by damage from an attack during your opponent's next turn, it is not Knocked Out and its remaining HP becomes 10 instead.

flavorText: When it dangles from a tree branch, it looks just like an acorn. It enjoys scaring other Pokémon.

attacks.name: High Voltage
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent can't play Trainer cards from his or her hand during his or her next turn.

attacks.name: Double Spin
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Baltoy

attacks.name: Triple Spin
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

flavorText: It moves while spinning around on its single foot. Some Baltoy have been seen spinning on their heads.

attacks.name: Twister
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both are tails, this attack does nothing. For each heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

name: Relicanth

attacks.name: Primal Calling
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Trainer Cards that have Fossil in their names, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Sleep Swirl
attacks.text: Both Relicanth and the Defending Pokémon are now Asleep.

flavorText: A rare Pokémon discovered during a deep-sea exploration. It has not changed in over 100 million years.

name: Lapras

attacks.name: Aqua Bullet
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage times the amount of Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

flavorText: These Pokémon were once near extinction due to poaching. Following protective regulations, there is now an overabundance of them.

name: Energy Switch
rules: Move a basic Energy card attached 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.

name: Magcargo

abilities.name: Magma Pool
abilities.text: If Magcargo is your Active Pokémon and moves to the Bench, remove 1 Fire Energy card attached to Magcargo, if any, and attach it to the new Active Pokémon. (You can't choose an Energy card that you used to pay the Retreat Cost.)

attacks.name: Lava Flow
attacks.text: You may discard any number of Fire Energy cards attached to Magcargo when you use this attack. If you do, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage for each Fire Energy card you discarded in this way.

flavorText: The shell on its back is just skin that has cooled and hardened. It breaks easily with a slight touch.

name: Charmeleon

attacks.name: Call for Support
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Supporter card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

flavorText: My precious friend who is always with me. I have so many things I want to tell you.

attacks.name: Frostbite
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Mirage
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

name: Light Machamp

abilities.name: Tag Team
abilities.text: When you play Light Machamp from your hand, if it is on your Bench, remove 3 damage counters from your Active Pokémon. If it has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them. Then, switch Light Machamp with your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Beatdown
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has Dark in its name or is a Darkness Pokémon, flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 100 damage instead of 50.

flavorText: It uses its four arms in combat to unleash a ceaseless flurry of punches.

abilities.name: Form Change
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for another Deoxys and switch it with Deoxys. (Any cards attached to Deoxys, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) If you do, put Deoxys on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Form Change Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Energy Crush
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to all of your opponent's Pokémon.

name: Sewaddle

attacks.name: Leaf Boomerang
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: Leavanny dress it in clothes they made for it when it hatched. It hides its head in its hood while it is sleeping.

name: Koffing

attacks.name: Smokescreen
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

flavorText: Its thin, filmy body is filled with gases that cause constant sniffles, coughs and teary eyes.

name: Floatzel

attacks.name: Floatify
attacks.text: Put up to 2 Item cards from your discard pile into your hand.

flavorText: Its flotation sac developed as a result of pursuing aquatic prey. It can double as a rubber raft.

name: Buck's Training
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Draw 2 cards. As long as Buck's Training is next to your Active Pokémon, each of your Active Pokémon's attacks does 10 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Minun

attacks.name: Negative Ion
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 30 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Electrishower
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

flavorText: It cheers on friends. If its friends are losing, its body lets off more and more sparks.

name: Slumbering Forest
rules: If a Pokémon is Asleep, its owner flips 2 coins instead of 1 for that Special Condition between turns. If either of them is tails, that Pokémon is still Asleep.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

name: Voltorb
flavorText: It looks just like a Poké Ball. It is dangerous because it may electrocute or explode on touch.

name: Pinsir

attacks.name: Grip and Squeeze
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

flavorText: One solid blow from its horns is enough to split apart a large tree. Its greatest rival in Alola is Vikavolt.

name: Hitmonchan

attacks.name: Bullet Punch
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

flavorText: The arm-twisting punches it throws pulverize even concrete. It rests after three minutes of fighting.

name: Baltoy

attacks.name: Triple Spin
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

flavorText: It moves while spinning around on its single foot. Some Baltoy have been seen spinning on their heads.

name: Lickitung

attacks.name: Continuous Lick
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

flavorText: It checks out whatever's around it by licking everything. If you don't clean off a spot where it's licked you, you'll break out in a rash!

name: Inkay

attacks.name: Disorderly Flip
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: It flashes the light-emitting spots on its body, which drains its opponent's will to fight. It takes the opportunity to scuttle away and hide.

name: Misty's Tears
rules: Discard 1 of the other cards in your hand in order to search your deck for up to 2 Water Energy cards. Show those cards to your opponent, then put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Gastly

attacks.name: Ominous Eyes
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

flavorText: Should a strange light be seen flickering in an abandoned building, Gastly is lurking there.

attacks.name: Teleportation Burst
attacks.text: Switch Ralts with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Super Hypno Wave
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

name: Pokémon Center Lady
rules: Heal 60 damage from 1 of your Pokémon, and it recovers from all Special Conditions.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Zorua

attacks.name: Paralyzing Gaze
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Shadow Bind
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

flavorText: To protect themselves from danger, they hide their true identities by transforming into people and Pokémon.

name: Thwackey

abilities.name: Lay of the Land
abilities.text: If you have a Stadium in play, this Pokémon has no Retreat Cost.

flavorText: The faster a Thwackey can beat out a rhythm with its two sticks, the more respect it wins from its peers.

attacks.name: Sleepy Song
attacks.text: Each Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

name: Dubwool

attacks.name: Cotton Guard
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Double-Edge
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

flavorText: Its majestic horns are meant only to impress the opposite gender. They never see use in battle.

name: Ponyta

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

flavorText: As a newborn, it can barely stand. However, through galloping, its legs are made tougher and faster.

name: Honedge

attacks.name: Metal Sound
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

flavorText: If anyone dares to grab its hilt, it wraps a blue cloth around that person's arm and drains that person's life energy completely.

attacks.name: Quick Turn
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Surprise
attacks.text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking. Look at the card you chose, then have your opponent shuffle that card into his or her deck.

name: Super Scoop Up
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, return 1 of your Pokémon and all cards attached to it to your hand.

name: Buddy-Buddy Rescue
rules: Each player puts a Pokémon from his or her discard pile into his or her hand. (Your opponent chooses first.)
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Bidoof

attacks.name: Scrunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks during your opponent's next turn.

flavorText: It constantly gnaws on logs and rocks to whittle down its front teeth. It nests alongside water.

name: Dragonair

attacks.name: Destructive Whirlpool
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

flavorText: Lakes where Dragonair live are filled with offerings from people, because they believe this Pokémon is able to control the weather.

name: Heatmor

attacks.name: Singe
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Incinerate
attacks.text: Before doing damage, discard a Pokémon Tool card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

flavorText: Using their very hot, flame-covered tongues, they burn through Durant's steel bodies and consume their insides.

name: Pikachu

attacks.name: Nuzzle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

flavorText: It raises its tail to check its surroundings. The tail is sometimes struck by lightning in this pose.

name: Pidove

attacks.name: Chirp
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Pokémon with Fighting Resistance, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

flavorText: Where people go, these Pokémon follow. If you're scattering food for them, be careful—several hundred of them can gather at once.

name: Coalossal

abilities.name: Tar Generator
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may attach a Fire Energy card, a Fighting Energy card, or 1 of each from your discard pile to your Pokémon in any way you like.

flavorText: It's usually peaceful, but the vandalism of mines enrages it. Offenders will be incinerated with flames that reach 2,700 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: Bergmite

attacks.name: Break Open
attacks.text: If your opponent has a Stadium card in play, discard it. If you do, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: Using air of -150 degrees Fahrenheit, they freeze opponents solid. They live in herds above the snow line on mountains.

attacks.name: Super Singe
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage.

name: Lure Module
rules: Each player reveals the top 3 cards of their deck and puts all Pokémon they find there into their hand. Then, each player shuffles the other cards back into their deck.
Item rule: You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Potion
rules: Heal 30 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

name: Justified Gloves
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached.
The attacks of the Pokémon this card is attached to do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Darkness Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Loudred

attacks.name: Energy Press
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

flavorText: It shouts loudly by inhaling air, and then using its well-developed stomach muscles to exhale.

abilities.name: Energy Evolution
abilities.text: Whenever you attach an Energy card from your hand to Eevee, you may search your deck for a card that evolves from Eevee that is the same type as the Energy card you attached to Eevee. Put that card onto Eevee. (This counts as evolving Eevee.) Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used when you attach an Energy card to Eevee as part of an attack's effect.

name: Gossifleur
flavorText: It whirls around in the wind while singing a joyous song. This delightful display has charmed many into raising this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Interviewer's Questions
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Look at the top 8 cards of your deck. Choose as many Energy cards as you like, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

name: Oshawott

attacks.name: Razor Shell
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

flavorText: The scalchop on its stomach is made from the same elements as claws. It detaches the scalchop for use as a blade.

attacks.name: Focus Energy
attacks.text: During your next turn, Combusken's High Jump Kick attack's base damage is 70.

name: Pachirisu

attacks.name: Overshort
attacks.text: Before doing damage, discard all Pokémon Tool cards from your opponent's Active Pokémon. If you discarded a Pokémon Tool card in this way, this attack does 40 more damage, and your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: A pair may be seen rubbing their cheek pouches together in an effort to share stored electricity.

name: Weakness Guard Energy
rules: This card provides Colorless Energy.
The Pokémon this card is attached to has no Weakness.

name: Burning Energy

If this card is discarded by an attack of the Fire Pokémon this card is attached to, attach this card from your discard pile to that Pokémon after attacking.
(If this card is attached to anything other than a Fire Pokémon, discard this card.)

If the Pokémon R Energy is attached to attacks, the attack does 10 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance). When your turn ends, discard R Energy.

rules: If you play this card from your hand, the Pokémon you attach it to is no longer Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned.
Full Heal Energy provides Colorless energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

name: Blend Energy WaterLightningFightingMetal
rules: This card provides Colorless Energy. When this card is attached to a Pokémon, this card provides Water, Lightning, Fighting, or Metal Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time.

name: Darkness Energy
rules: If the Pokémon Darkness Energy is attached to damages the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), the attack does 10 more damage to the Defending Pokémon. At the end of every turn, put 1 damage counter on the Pokémon Darkness Energy is attached to, unless it's Darkness or has Dark in its name. Darkness Energy provides Darkness Energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

name: Double Magma Energy
rules: This card can only be attached to Team Magma Pokémon. Discard this card at the end of the turn you attached it.
This card provides FightingFighting Energy only while it is attached to a Team Magma Pokémon.
(If this card is attached to anything other than a Team Magma Pokémon, discard this card.)

name: Boost Energy
rules: Boost Energy can be attached only to an Evolved Pokémon. Discard Boost Energy at the end of the turn it was attached. Boost Energy provides ColorlessColorlessColorless Energy. The Pokémon Boost Energy is attached to can't retreat. When the Pokémon Boost Energy is attached to is no longer an Evolved Pokémon, discard Boost Energy.

name: Hiding Darkness Energy
rules: As long as this card is attached to a Pokémon, it provides Darkness Energy.
The Darkness Pokémon this card is attached to has no Retreat Cost.

name: Full Heal Energy
rules: If you play this card from your hand, the Pokémon you attach it to is no longer Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned.
Full Heal Energy provides Colorless energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

name: Rainbow Energy
rules: This card provides Colorless Energy. While in play, this card provides every type of Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time. When you attach this card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon, put 1 damage counter on that Pokémon.

name: Stone Fighting Energy
rules: As long as this card is attached to a Pokémon, it provides Fighting Energy.
The Fighting Pokémon this card is attached to takes 20 less damage from attacks from your opponent's Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
